title: Permanent makeup artist
description: Unique beauty salon is in the heart of south Etobicoke. We are looking for talented, and passionate individuals who want to be a part of our team. Joining our team you won’t regret it.

title: Lead Concept Artist
description:
Who are Timbre Games?

Timbre Games are a Vancouver based early-stage game development studio with over 100 years of founding leadership. We believe culture drives creative, where we draw on community and diversity to build truly unique experiences.

Our mission is to build a world class network of Game Studios; to provide accessible awesomeness to our players, to our team, to the world.

Everyone has a story. Come write yours!

Who You Are

As a human, you’re a visionary explorer, a pursuer of fun, and focused on building community. You see an opportunity within games to do more and to have more than “just a job”. You’ve had unique experiences both at work and personally that have expanded your curiosities to seek the root of a problem, to seek out issues, and work with people to explore solutions! Your experiences have made you who you are, and that has led to you understanding the importance of diversity in both thinking and in people. Oh, and games… You may like those, too!

Who You Are At Work

You lead with humility in all that you do. You showcase passion for your craft through the work you produce and the task-oriented service you give to others. You don’t take orders, you push art to higher levels to set the tone of what you’re working on. You connect with people through humour and curiosity and these elements make up some of the foundation in your approach to communication.  

At Timbre, we take mentoring seriously, and as a lead, we want you to as well. We are here to make amazing games and grow the next generation of game industry people – two goals that are at the heart of who we are.

What impact will you have as a Lead Concept Artist at Timbre   
  • You'll prototype and iterate to truly define what the Timbre style is, working on character and environment work
  • Define the tone of what it means to be a Timbre game
  • Create inspirational mood pieces, gameplay and character ideation, sketches and colour key scripts
  • Partner with other Art and Design Timbreoos to help steer initial conceptual direction into compelling visual and game experiences
  • Scope the needs for current and future projects, potentially partnering with outsourced vendors and offsite contractors
  • Collaborate with Production to help create and maintain clear schedules
  • Work closely with Recruitment to improve our recruitment process and bring in value aligned people
  • Onboard and nurture current and future Art teammates, playing a huge role in their development
Your track record might include
  • 7+ years of industry experience as a Concept Artist
  • Previous Senior/Lead experience on a project, setting the tone for a AAA game
  • A portfolio of conceptual design fundamentals and versatility in both rapid ideation, sketching and production paintings
  • Highly skilled communication, both verbally and digitally, to different disciplines within the studio as well as external partners where required
  • Experienced foundational art knowledge in theories of form, value, colour, proportion, anatomy and scale
  • Ability to give as well as embrace constructive feedback
  • Experience in a team where people come first and culture isn't defined by a cheesy poster on the wall
About Timbre Games

Timbre Games are headed up by industry veterans in beautiful Vancouver, BC. Our experience stretches through mobile to AAA (think Gears of War, the Sims, SSX, FIFA, Age of Empires, among others!). We’re excited to build a ‘playoff ready’ studio that is centered on creativity, humour and diversity. We can’t wait to share our first project that we’re secretly working away on, and we welcome your application with open arms as we grow a world-class studio here in Canada!

Benefits
  • Competitive salary & benefits
  • Annual bonus & RRSP matching
  • 20 days paid vacation, plus Christmas week off
  • Remote / Work from home / Flexible hours
  • Open door policy with direct access to leadership
  • Industry veterans with a wealth of knowledge to share
Timbre Game’s Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Timbre recognizes the importance of creating an environment where all our employees feel included and empowered. We believe that culture drives creative, we value each employee’s unique experiences and perspectives across our company and recognize that it is both the smart and right thing to foster diversity, equity, and inclusion within our organization.

By diversifying our workforce, increasing equality, and ensuring that our individual differences are valued, we are better able to deliver an experience that reflects, inspires, and connects with our audience... because games are for everyone!

DO I NEED TO MEET ALL CRITERIA TO APPLY?

Definitely not! If you share our mission of creating games that are accessible for everyone, we’d love to meet you and see what is possible!

If you believe you are who we’re looking for, contact us at: work@timbregames.com

Please upload a link to your portfolio/github for us to review if applicable!

title: Kiehl's Counter Manager (Hudson's Bay)
description:
What This Position Is All About

You are a friendly, customer-focused individual who understands the importance of always being ready to serve the customer. You are a team player who has earned the respect of your peers through commitment, partnership and effective communication. You organize and prioritize your workload in a way that always puts the customer first and delivers the operational standards that are required. In a dynamic fast-paced environment you are self-motivated, adaptable and decisive ensuring the best outcome for the customer and the business.

Who You Are
  • Acts with customers in mind, great networking and relationship management.
  • Puts the needs of internal and external customers first. Seeks customer information when improving products and services.
  • Often goes above and beyond their goals. Is consistently a top performer and elevates the performance of others
  • Sees ahead clearly, is knowledgeable and has a capability for a big picture perspective.
You Also Have
  • Knowledge of skin/body care treatments with 2-5 years of work experience in Cosmetics
  • Certified Make-up Artist
  • Must have experience in a commission and clientele selling environment
  • Full flexibility with schedule (including evenings and weekends)
As The Counter Manager Of Cosmetics, You Will
  • Analyze business metrics to develop action plans that address opportunities and positively impact the business
  • Build your client base through the Preferred Customer Program
  • Observe staff on the selling floor and their interaction with customers, co-workers and overall customer service level
  • Achieve daily / weekly / monthly sales goals based on the department's goal and are expected to track their sales
  • Deliver World-class service through client communication, product knowledge, fashion direction and solution-based selling at the highest-level
  • Work with Vendor Partners to maximize sales opportunities through suggestive selling, store events / seminars and wardrobe clients
How Often You May Travel
  • NA
Your Life And Career At HBC
  • Be part of a world-class team; work with an adventurous spirit; think and act like an owner- operator!
  • Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities, from retail to supply chain, to digital or corporate.
  • A culture that promotes a healthy, fulfilling work/life balance
  • Benefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, vision and dental).
  • An amazing employee discount
Thank you for your interest with HBC. We look forward to reviewing your application.

HBC provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, HBC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

HBC welcomes all applicants for this position. Should you be individually selected to participate in an assessment or selection process, accommodations are available upon request in relation to the materials or processes to be used.

title: VFX Production Coordinator
description:
The VFX Coordinator is the main level of support for the entire production team throughout the course of a project, from pre-production to final delivery.

Main responsibilities:

  • Maintain show shot list. Determine, with the VFX Supervisor and VFX Producer, milestones for the project and artists and ensure they are met;
  • Maintain shot status and artist targets and be able to produce show status at all times; 
  • Update all documents that allow follow up on the show status (shotlist, schedule, etc.);
  • Take, receive and disseminate internal and client shot notes;
  • Manage the flow of information and transfer of information/work between departments or with clients. Oversee the file transfer and receipt process with the Production Assistant; 
  • Make sure that artists have the necessary information and elements to begin work efficiently;
  • Set and track targets for the week with the VFX Supervisor and VFX Producer. Meet with each artist assigned to the project on a daily basis to ensure they are clear on their targets, answer questions, follow-up on progress, etc.
  • Anticipate and raise any concerns about targets, deadlines, etc. based on daily artist activity;
  • Arrange, attend, and manage meetings, turnovers, reviews with VFX Supervisor and artists, ensure that all notes are transmitted to the artists;
  • Organize the dailies playlist, and take detailed notes throughout the meeting;
  • Keep artists and supervisors up to date with information – client notes, shot changes, modifications - and evaluate impact on current work.  Relay information to Producer if there are anticipated schedule implications;
  • Evaluate and validate all work with VFX Supervisors to make sure they are approved, and notes are distributed to relevant crew.

Qualifications

  • Minimum of 3 years of production experience in visual effects or film;
  • Experience in an administrative position;
  • Fluent in English, written and spoken;
  • Excellent knowledge of GSuite and Microsoft Office;
  • Strong organizational skills.

Additional Information

  • Full-time, Permanent Contract;
  • 5 paid sick days;
  • 2 additional statutory holidays in the winter holidays;
  • Group Insurance, access to Dialogue online support and to an Employee Assistance Program (EAP);
  • RRSP with employer contribution;
  • Discounts with Bixi, Nautilus Plus and many more local businesses.

Diversity is a core value at Rodeo FX. We are passionate about building and sustaining an inclusive and equitable work environment where diversity is celebrated and valued. We believe every member on our team enriches our work by exposing us to a broad range of ways to perceive and interact with the world, identify challenges, and to design and deliver projects.

title: Senior Character Artist
description:
Who are Timbre Games?

Timbre Games are a Vancouver based early-stage game development studio with over 100 years of founding leadership. We believe culture drives creative, where we draw on community and diversity to build truly unique experiences.

Our mission is to build a world class network of Game Studios; to provide accessible awesomeness to our players, to our team, to the world.

Everyone has a story. Come write yours!

Who You Are

As a human, you’re a visionary explorer, a pursuer of fun, and focused on building community. You see an opportunity within games to do more and to have more than “just a job”. You’ve had unique experiences both at work and personally that have expanded your curiosities to seek the root of a problem, to seek out issues, and work with people to explore solutions! Your experiences have made you who you are, and that has led to you understanding the importance of diversity in both thinking and in people. Oh, and games… You may like those, too!

Who You Are At Work

You lead with humility in all that you do. You showcase passion for your craft through the work you produce and the service you give to others. It brings a smile to your face seeing concepts turn into beautiful 3D art. You connect with people through humour and curiosity and these elements make up some of the foundation in your approach to communication.

At Timbre, we take mentoring seriously, and as a lead, we want you to as well. We are here to make amazing games and grow the next generation of game industry people – two goals that are at the heart of who we are.

What impact will you have as a Senior Character Artist at Timbre:
  • You’ll be hands-on and involved in all aspects of creating visually stunning 3D characters: modelling, rigging, texturing  
  • You’ll work cross functionally with all your fellow Timbreoos to identify priorities and produce characters that enhance player experience  
  • You’ll identify solutions in our production pipeline and work with Tech Art to improve tools and pipelines  
  • Your passion for creation will be infectious across Timbre Games and elevate the team from prototyping through production
  • Iterate artistic styles and support your reports to adhere to those principles and standards 
  • Work closely with recruitment to improve our recruitment process and bring in value aligned people 
  • Onboard and nurture current and future Art teammates
Your Track Record Might Include
  • 5+ years character development experience  
  • Previous experience as an Intermediate Artist within a game production environment.
  • A portfolio of delivered digital projects and games that showcases quality and diversity of character modelling skills  
  • Highly skilled communication, both verbally and digitally, to different disciplines within the studio as well as external partners where required  
  • Strong modelling, rigging, UV and material skills with an ability to create high-poly as well as engine efficient assets 
  • Taking 2D concept art and realizing it in a 3D software tool
  • Ability to give as well as embrace constructive feedback and iterate efficiently  
  • Ability to scope workload and identify efficiencies  
  • Experience working with a team where people come first and culture isn’t defined by a cheesy poster on the wall  
About Timbre Games

Timbre Games are headed up by industry veterans in beautiful Vancouver, BC. Our experience stretches through mobile to AAA (think Gears of War, the Sims, SSX, FIFA, Age of Empires, among others!). We’re excited to build a ‘playoff ready’ studio that is centered on creativity, humour and diversity. We can’t wait to share our first project that we’re secretly working away on, and we welcome your application with open arms as we grow a world-class studio here in Canada!

Benefits
  • Competitive salary & benefits
  • Annual bonus & RRSP matching
  • 20 days paid vacation, plus Christmas week off
  • Remote / Work from home / Flexible hours
  • Open door policy with direct access to leadership
  • Industry veterans with a wealth of knowledge to share
Timbre Game’s Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Timbre recognizes the importance of creating an environment where all our employees feel included and empowered. We believe that culture drives creative, we value each employee’s unique experiences and perspectives across our company and recognize that it is both the smart and right thing to foster diversity, equity, and inclusion within our organization.

By diversifying our workforce, increasing equality, and ensuring that our individual differences are valued, we are better able to deliver an experience that reflects, inspires, and connects with our audience... because games are for everyone!

DO I NEED TO MEET ALL CRITERIA TO APPLY?

Definitely not! If you share our mission of creating games that are accessible for everyone, we’d love to meet you and see what is possible!

If you believe you are who we’re looking for, contact us at: work@timbregames.com

Please upload a link to your portfolio/github for us to review if applicable!

title: Compositing Supervisor (Ads)
description:
Work with the VFX Supervisor and production team to plan and establish the workflow and methodology that will be applied throughout the project for their specialty, ensuring the best creative and technical approach to meet requirements, budgets and the project schedule;

Participate in the hiring process for artists on projects.

In collaboration with production, assign plans and sequences to artists, taking into account their abilities and level;

Communicate the client's vision and creative goals to their team, ensuring that individual and/or collective responsibility for results is understood;

Lead artists in their work throughout the project and closely monitor the quality of work produced. 

Lead review sessions and ensure the work meets clients' on going expectations;

Work on complex shots or sequences or participate in their creation;

Solve visual, artistic and technical problems throughout the project, in collaboration with the various project stakeholders;

Participate in technical scouting and on-set supervision while VFX sequences are being filmed:

  • Retrieve information about the shoot (ex: camera info, lights, measurements, etc.);

  • Supervise the necessary installations on set for the shooting of the sequences;

  • Make critical decisions on set to maximize filming success and find solutions to problems encountered;

  • Be called upon to travel depending on the location of the projects.

Make recommendations to the VFX Supervisor regarding the specific training needs of team members. 

May participate in the preparation of training materials or in group training sessions;

If necessary, help the production team bid for projects;

Maintain up-to-date knowledge in their specialty and stay abreast of the latest technological advances in methods and approaches



Qualifications

  • Minimum of 5 years of experience as an image compositing artist in the VFX industry;

  • Knowledge of English and French - must be fluent in one of these languages ​​and functional in the other;

  • Excellent knowledge of Nuke and/or Flame software;

  • Good knowledge of Shotgun project management software;

  • Knowledge of photography, expertise in colors, lighting (reflections, refraction, shadows), perspective and composition;

  • Excellent understanding of the VFX production pipeline;

  • Ability to remain calm under pressure and act as a positive role model and mentor.



Additional Information

  • Permanent full-time contract;
  • Group insurance, access to the Dialogue online service and an employee assistance program;
  • Additional holidays during the holiday season;
  • Group RRSP with employer contribution; And much more!

Diversity is a core value at Rodeo FX. We are passionate about building and sustaining an inclusive and equitable work environment where diversity is celebrated and valued. We believe every member on our team enriches our work by exposing us to a broad range of ways to perceive and interact with the world, identify challenges, and to design and deliver projects.

title: Counter Manager, Cosmetics (Hudson's Bay)
description:
What This Position Is All About

You are a friendly, customer-focused individual who understands the importance of always being ready to serve the customer. You are a team player who has earned the respect of your peers through commitment, partnership and effective communication. You organize and prioritize your workload in a way that always puts the customer first and delivers the operational standards that are required. In a dynamic fast-paced environment you are self-motivated, adaptable and decisive ensuring the best outcome for the customer and the business.

Who You Are
  • Acts with customers in mind, great networking and relationship management.
  • Puts the needs of internal and external customers first. Seeks customer information when improving products and services.
  • Often goes above and beyond their goals. Is consistently a top performer and elevates the performance of others
  • Sees ahead clearly, is knowledgeable and has a capability for a big picture perspective.
You Also Have
  • Knowledge of skin/body care treatments with 2-5 years of work experience in Cosmetics
  • Certified Make-up Artist
  • Must have experience in a commission and clientele selling environment
  • Full flexibility with schedule (including evenings and weekends)
As The Counter Manager Of Cosmetics, You Will
  • Analyze business metrics to develop action plans that address opportunities and positively impact the business
  • Build your client base through the Preferred Customer Program
  • Observe staff on the selling floor and their interaction with customers, co-workers and overall customer service level
  • Achieve daily / weekly / monthly sales goals based on the department's goal and are expected to track their sales
  • Deliver World-class service through client communication, product knowledge, fashion direction and solution-based selling at the highest-level
  • Work with Vendor Partners to maximize sales opportunities through suggestive selling, store events / seminars and wardrobe clients
How Often You May Travel
  • NA
Your Life And Career At HBC
  • Be part of a world-class team; work with an adventurous spirit; think and act like an owner- operator!
  • Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities, from retail to supply chain, to digital or corporate.
  • A culture that promotes a healthy, fulfilling work/life balance
  • Benefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, vision and dental).
  • An amazing employee discount
Thank you for your interest with HBC. We look forward to reviewing your application.

HBC provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, HBC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

HBC welcomes all applicants for this position. Should you be individually selected to participate in an assessment or selection process, accommodations are available upon request in relation to the materials or processes to be used.

title: Market Specialist, Vancouver
description:
Overview

MAKE UP FOR EVER is looking for a Market Specialist. Based in Vancouver reporting to the Regional Manager, West, this person is responsible for driving sales through education and support of the Sephora Stores in their territory, as well as fostering beauty advisor’s Love of MAKE UP FOR EVER and positive brand perception.

About Us

MAKE UP FOR EVER honored to be a part of the LVMH group, the largest luxury conglomerate in the world. Louis Vuitton Moet-Hennessy is home to 75 distinguished houses rooted in six different sectors.

MAKE UP FOR EVER is a professional cosmetics brand founded in 1984 by artist, Dany Sanz. Originally a painter and sculptor working in Parisian cabarets and theaters in the late 1980s, Sanz discovered that art of body painting, what she coined as her “paintings in motion”. After harnessing her body painting craft, she went on to teach make-up artists her body painting techniques, slowly building following in the make-up community and a revolution in the world of make-up.

Today, MAKE UP FOR EVER is a leader in the professional beauty market, providing high quality products in a wide range of colors and textures for MUAs and everyday consumers alike. Our products have been featured in hit shows like Riverdale and Euphoria, major publications like Allure and Glamour, and runways around the world.

We would like to welcome you to our collective of PROFESSIONAL, EDUCATIONAL, ARTISTIC, and EXUBERANT talent!

Responsibilities

SALES
  • Achieve retail sales objectives through the education of Sephora beauty advisers.
  • Exhibit strong selling and communication skills
  • Build and maintain store relationships through consistent follow up communication with the Store Leadership and beauty advisors.
  • Plan and manage time effectively when working in store to maximize efficiency and effectiveness in driving revenue.
  • Participate in and ensure execution of store events & initiatives to achieve sales goals, while staying within budget.
  • Review and analyze daily & weekly sales achievement by door and where applicable by Selling Specialist. Reinforce achievement by door compared to sales, last year and comp goals. Partner with RM to establish a plan by door to achieve or exceed sales plan.
  • Partner with Regional Manager to create regional initiatives & sales contest to leverage education to see positive ROI.
  • Understand business to partner and plan store visits which best impact the business Plan in-store coverage during key store hours.
  • Properly manage calendar & schedule to support top doors in region.
  • Understand and respect the Sephora beauty advisors, assistant-Managers, Managers and Store Director Roles, and communicate with appropriate person to affect change. When Sephora procedures do not resolve concern, address the topic with your Regional Manager.
  • Gondola Management: Observe, investigate, facilitate and follow up on all aspects of Gondola, including Visual Merchandising and Inventory weekly.
  • Attend Business Brand Reviews with Regional Manager.
  • Meet Sephora Brand Partner Expectations to result in above 90% love scores.
EDUCATION AND ARTISTRY
  • Be an outstanding role model for education and artistry skill and lead by example.
  • Execute training objectives set by National Sales & Education director.
  • Educate Sephora beauty advisors based on curriculum set by Sales & Education Department.
  • Exhibit consistent, appropriate, and effective training and artistry skills
  • Be a passionate, professional, positive brand representative to internal and external clients.
  • Partner with Sephora Leadership team in identifying and addressing areas for development: in artistry, business, or other areas of opportunity.
  • Support Brand and Sephora events and trainings. Master class, Brand Trainings, NSO and/or new additional programs as requested.
ADMINISTRATIVE
  • Two office days per month to manage reporting of sales, training trackers and other reports as needed
  • Strategically build quarterly calendars with RM in Outlook
  • Timely completion of monthly expense reports (if applicable)
  • Clear and effective email communication in a timely manner
  • Manage distribution of beauty advisors' gratis
Qualifications
  • College degree preferred
  • Must have two or more years of experience in field sales experience within the retail cosmetics field. Experience within Sephora is preferred.
  • Mandarin and/or Hindi speaking a plus
  • Must be able to exhibit basic beauty make up skills.
  • Must have basic computer knowledge.
  • Must be able to travel 25% of the year
  • Must have their own vehichle and maintain valid driver’s license, with proof of insurance.
  • Must be physically able to carry boxes of a reasonable weight and work in a fragrance filled cosmetic environment.
  • Must be available to work on a Tuesday to Saturday schedule.
  • Must exhibit a high level of professional personal appearance and hygiene.
  • Must be eligible to obtain a corporate credit card.
skills: ['Properly manage calendar & schedule to support top doors in region.', 'Must have two or more years of experience in field sales experience within the retail cosmetics field. Experience within Sephora is preferred.', 'College degree preferred', 'Must be able to travel 25% of the year', 'Strategically build quarterly calendars with RM in Outlook', 'Gondola Management: Observe, investigate, facilitate and follow up on all aspects of Gondola, including Visual Merchandising and Inventory weekly.', 'Must be eligible to obtain a corporate credit card.', 'Be a passionate, professional, positive brand representative to internal and external clients.', 'Must exhibit a high level of professional personal appearance and hygiene.', 'Be an outstanding role model for education and artistry skill and lead by example.', 'Build and maintain store relationships through consistent follow up communication with the Store Leadership and beauty advisors.', 'Must have basic computer knowledge.', 'Must be available to work on a Tuesday to Saturday schedule.', 'Must be physically able to carry boxes of a reasonable weight and work in a fragrance filled cosmetic environment.', 'Achieve retail sales objectives through the education of Sephora beauty advisers.', 'Must have their own vehichle and maintain valid driver’s license, with proof of insurance.', 'Review and analyze daily & weekly sales achievement by door and where applicable by Selling Specialist. title: Coordinator, Canada Marketing
description:
Overview

MAKE UP FOR EVER is looking for a Coordinator, Canada Marketing. Based in the Montreal Office and reporting to the Senior Director, North America Marketing, this person will be responsible for supporting the team in establishing product launch campaigns & initiatives and executing them. From day one, this individual will contribute to existing marketing programs, while assisting with the development of new initiatives aligned with company and client goals. The ideal candidate will have prior experience with a wide range of marketing functions, including project management, marketing localization, merchandizing and digital marketing. The marketing coordinator must be an organized multitasker and able to handle many diverse projects at once and meet tight deadlines.

About Us

MAKE UP FOR EVER honored to be a part of the LVMH group, the largest luxury conglomerate in the world. Louis Vuitton Moet-Hennessy is home to 75 distinguished houses rooted in six different sectors.

MAKE UP FOR EVER is a professional cosmetics brand founded in 1984 by artist, Dany Sanz. Originally a painter and sculptor working in Parisian cabarets and theaters in the late 1980s, Sanz discovered that art of body painting, what she coined as her “paintings in motion”. After harnessing her body painting craft, she went on to teach make-up artists her body painting techniques, slowly building following in the make-up community and a revolution in the world of make-up.

Today, MAKE UP FOR EVER is a leader in the professional beauty market, providing high quality products in a wide range of colors and textures for MUAs and everyday consumers alike. Our products have been featured in hit shows like Riverdale and Euphoria, major publications like Allure and Glamour, and runways around the world.

Perks

We are passionate about providing an enriching experience for all our employees- including interns! Some of our perks include:
  • Hybrid environment (2 days in/ 3 days remote optional)
  • Flexible work hours
  • One-time WFH equipment stipend
  • Mentorship opportunities with senior management
  • Potential for mobility within the LVMH group
We would like to welcome you to our collective of PROFESSIONAL, EDUCATIONAL, ARTISTIC, and EXUBERANT talent!

Responsibilities

Canda Retailer Support
  • Liaise with retailers and internal departments to support and help execute marketing plans
  • Conduct gondola planogram review, assist with translations and partner with Visual Merchandising to provide error-free deliverables
  • Help maintain and develop master documents such as marketing calendar, assortment files, launch performance reports, etc.
  • Deliver documentation and assets needed to setup SKUs, enact price changes and setup product pages
  • Assist with sales, market overview, trend, and competitive analysis
  • Coordinate sampling plans and partner with retailer and operation teams to ensure proper execution
  • Assist with project management and timely response to all retailer requests
  • Aid in retailer meeting and event planning
  • Assist in ongoing administrative tasks like coding invoices, budget tracking, organizing lab samples, shipping product comps to retailers, etc.
  • Support the Pro, Sales, Education and Communications departments with product launches, marketing tools and events
Qualifications
  • Minimum 3-5 years of agency or marketing experience preferably in the cosmetic
  • Sephora experience highly preferred
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving & project management
  • Highly organized and detail-oriented.
  • Strong ability to multi-task and manage timelines.
  • Passionate about beauty and in tune with key market
  • Excellent skills in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
  • Strong interpersonal skills, approachable, positive and Able to work interactively and proactively with internal and external parties at all levels is a must.
  • High level of maturity; ability to handle weekly communication with internal/external
  • Self-starter, high degree of initiative and independence – not afraid to ask questions, take criticism and lead new
  • Resourceful and creative problem solver – at times with little direction/oversight.
  • Strong organizational skills; able to track multiple projects and
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills (French and English)

title: Senior Technical Artist
description:
What you will do: The technical artist responsible for destruction system plays a very central role on this important pillar feature. More precisely the candidate will be involved in the
following areas:

  • Configure, test, maintain and play important part in the development of the destruction system
  • Make sure that destructible system is aligned with high level design requirements for the game
  • Elaborate budgets for destructible content, memory-wyse, performance-wyse and platform-wyse (mobile, next gen)
  • Assist and support content creators making destructible assets
  • Validate created content and make sure they follow guidelines to meet defined budgets
  • Play a role in the design features of the system with engine programmer
  • Support gameplay/vfx/audio programmers in the usage of destructible assets
  • Stay up to date on Unreal Engine best practices regarding content creation and performance

Qualifications

What we are looking for:

  • Having shipped at least one title as a technical artist 
  • 4+ years Unreal Engine experience
  • Having shipped an open world game
  • Houdini and its destruction tool set experience
  • And/or other procedure destruction asset generation pipeline experience

Additional Information

Eligible to work full time in Canada

title: Business Manager Clinique (Hudson's Bay)
description:
What This Position Is All About

You are a friendly, customer-focused individual who understands the importance of always being ready to serve the customer. You are a team player who has earned the respect of your peers through commitment, partnership and effective communication. You organize and prioritize your workload in a way that always puts the customer first and delivers the operational standards that are required. In a dynamic fast-paced environment you are self-motivated, adaptable and decisive ensuring the best outcome for the customer and the business.

Who You Are
  • Acts with customers in mind, great networking and relationship management.
  • Puts the needs of internal and external customers first. Seeks customer information when improving products and services.
  • Often goes above and beyond their goals. Is consistently a top performer and elevates the performance of others
  • Sees ahead clearly, is knowledgeable and has a capability for a big picture perspective.
You Also Have
  • Knowledge of skin/body care treatments with 2-5 years of work experience in Cosmetics
  • Certified Make-up Artist
  • Must have experience in a commission and clientele selling environment
  • Full flexibility with schedule (including evenings and weekends)
As The Counter Manager Of Cosmetics, You Will
  • Analyze business metrics to develop action plans that address opportunities and positively impact the business
  • Build your client base through the Preferred Customer Program
  • Observe staff on the selling floor and their interaction with customers, co-workers and overall customer service level
  • Achieve daily / weekly / monthly sales goals based on the department's goal and are expected to track their sales
  • Deliver World-class service through client communication, product knowledge, fashion direction and solution-based selling at the highest-level
  • Work with Vendor Partners to maximize sales opportunities through suggestive selling, store events / seminars and wardrobe clients
How Often You May Travel
  • NA
Your Life And Career At HBC
  • Be part of a world-class team; work with an adventurous spirit; think and act like an owner- operator!
  • Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities, from retail to supply chain, to digital or corporate.
  • A culture that promotes a healthy, fulfilling work/life balance
  • Benefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, vision and dental).
  • An amazing employee discount
Thank you for your interest with HBC. We look forward to reviewing your application.

HBC provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, HBC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

HBC welcomes all applicants for this position. Should you be individually selected to participate in an assessment or selection process, accommodations are available upon request in relation to the materials or processes to be used.

title: Market Specialist, Quebec, Ottawa & Maritimes
description:
Overview

MAKE UP FOR EVER is looking for a Market Specialist. Based in Montreal reporting to the Regional Manager East, this person is responsible for driving sales through education and support of the Sephora Stores in their territory, as well as fostering beauty advisor’s Love of MAKE UP FOR EVER and positive brand perception.

About Us

MAKE UP FOR EVER honored to be a part of the LVMH group, the largest luxury conglomerate in the world. Louis Vuitton Moet-Hennessy is home to 75 distinguished houses rooted in six different sectors.

MAKE UP FOR EVER is a professional cosmetics brand founded in 1984 by artist, Dany Sanz. Originally a painter and sculptor working in Parisian cabarets and theaters in the late 1980s, Sanz discovered that art of body painting, what she coined as her “paintings in motion”. After harnessing her body painting craft, she went on to teach make-up artists her body painting techniques, slowly building following in the make-up community and a revolution in the world of make-up.

Today, MAKE UP FOR EVER is a leader in the professional beauty market, providing high quality products in a wide range of colors and textures for MUAs and everyday consumers alike. Our products have been featured in hit shows like Riverdale and Euphoria, major publications like Allure and Glamour, and runways around the world.

We would like to welcome you to our collective of PROFESSIONAL, EDUCATIONAL, ARTISTIC, and EXUBERANT talent!

Responsibilities

SALES
  • Achieve retail sales objectives through the education of Sephora beauty advisers.
  • Exhibit strong selling and communication skills
  • Build and maintain store relationships through consistent follow up communication with the Store Leadership and beauty advisors.
  • Plan and manage time effectively when working in store to maximize efficiency and effectiveness in driving revenue.
  • Participate in and ensure execution of store events & initiatives to achieve sales goals, while staying within budget.
  • Review and analyze daily & weekly sales achievement by door and where applicable by Selling Specialist. Reinforce achievement by door compared to sales, last year and comp goals. Partner with RM to establish a plan by door to achieve or exceed sales plan.
  • Partner with Regional Manager to create regional initiatives & sales contest to leverage education to see positive ROI.
  • Understand business to partner and plan store visits which best impact the business Plan in-store coverage during key store hours.
  • Properly manage calendar & schedule to support top doors in region.
  • Understand and respect the Sephora beauty advisors, assistant-Managers, Managers and Store Director Roles, and communicate with appropriate person to affect change. When Sephora procedures do not resolve concern, address the topic with your Regional Manager.
  • Gondola Management: Observe, investigate, facilitate and follow up on all aspects of Gondola, including Visual Merchandising and Inventory weekly.
  • Attend Business Brand Reviews with Regional Manager.
  • Meet Sephora Brand Partner Expectations to result in above 90% love scores.
EDUCATION AND ARTISTRY
  • Be an outstanding role model for education and artistry skill and lead by example.
  • Execute training objectives set by National Sales & Education director.
  • Educate Sephora beauty advisors based on curriculum set by Sales & Education Department.
  • Exhibit consistent, appropriate, and effective training and artistry skills
  • Be a passionate, professional, positive brand representative to internal and external clients.
  • Partner with Sephora Leadership team in identifying and addressing areas for development: in artistry, business, or other areas of opportunity.
  • Support Brand and Sephora events and trainings. Master class, Brand Trainings, NSO and/or new additional programs as requested.
ADMINISTRATIVE
  • Two office days per month to manage reporting of sales, training trackers and other reports as needed
  • Strategically build quarterly calendars with RM in Outlook
  • Timely completion of monthly expense reports (if applicable)
  • Clear and effective email communication in a timely manner
  • Manage distribution of beauty advisors' gratis
Qualifications
  • College degree preferred
  • Must have two or more years of experience in field sales experience within the retail cosmetics field. Experience within Sephora is preferred.
  • Must have exceptional communication skills French and English, both written and verbal, as well as exceptional interpersonal skills.
  • Must be able to exhibit basic beauty make up skills.
  • Must have basic computer knowledge.
  • Must be able to travel, drive, and maintain valid driver’s license, with proof of insurance.
  • Must be physically able to carry boxes of a reasonable weight and work in a fragrance filled cosmetic environment.
  • Must be available to work on a Tuesday to Saturday Schedule.
  • Must exhibit a high level of professional personal appearance and hygiene.
  • Must be eligible to obtain a corporate credit card.

title: Shiseido Counter Manager
description:
What This Position Is All About

You are a friendly, customer-focused individual who understands the importance of always being ready to serve the customer. You are a team player who has earned the respect of your peers through commitment, partnership and effective communication. You organize and prioritize your workload in a way that always puts the customer first and delivers the operational standards that are required. In a dynamic fast-paced environment you are self-motivated, adaptable and decisive ensuring the best outcome for the customer and the business.

Who You Are
  • Acts with customers in mind, great networking and relationship management.
  • Puts the needs of internal and external customers first. Seeks customer information when improving products and services.
  • Often goes above and beyond their goals. Is consistently a top performer and elevates the performance of others
  • Sees ahead clearly, is knowledgeable and has a capability for a big picture perspective.
You Also Have
  • Knowledge of skin/body care treatments with 2-5 years of work experience in Cosmetics
  • Certified Make-up Artist
  • Must have experience in a commission and clientele selling environment
  • Full flexibility with schedule (including evenings and weekends)
As The Counter Manager Of Cosmetics, You Will
  • Analyze business metrics to develop action plans that address opportunities and positively impact the business
  • Build your client base through the Preferred Customer Program
  • Observe staff on the selling floor and their interaction with customers, co-workers and overall customer service level
  • Achieve daily / weekly / monthly sales goals based on the department's goal and are expected to track their sales
  • Deliver World-class service through client communication, product knowledge, fashion direction and solution-based selling at the highest-level
  • Work with Vendor Partners to maximize sales opportunities through suggestive selling, store events / seminars and wardrobe clients
How Often You May Travel
  • NA
Your Life And Career At HBC
  • Be part of a world-class team; work with an adventurous spirit; think and act like an owner- operator!
  • Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities, from retail to supply chain, to digital or corporate.
  • A culture that promotes a healthy, fulfilling work/life balance
  • Benefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, vision and dental).
  • An amazing employee discount
Thank you for your interest with HBC. We look forward to reviewing your application.

HBC provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, HBC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

HBC welcomes all applicants for this position. Should you be individually selected to participate in an assessment or selection process, accommodations are available upon request in relation to the materials or processes to be used.

title: Manager, Pro Business Development (Canada)
description:
Overview

MAKE UP FOR EVER is looking for a Manager, Pro Business Development. Based in Montreal and reporting to the Director, Pro Business, this person serves to build and maintain Pro business across Canada, while also focusing on pro client service education.

About Us

MAKE UP FOR EVER honored to be a part of the LVMH group, the largest luxury conglomerate in the world. Louis Vuitton Moet-Hennessy is home to 75 distinguished houses rooted in six different sectors.

MAKE UP FOR EVER is a professional cosmetics brand founded in 1984 by artist, Dany Sanz. Originally a painter and sculptor working in Parisian cabarets and theaters in the late 1980s, Sanz discovered that art of body painting, what she coined as her “paintings in motion”. After harnessing her body painting craft, she went on to teach make-up artists her body painting techniques, slowly building following in the make-up community and a revolution in the world of make-up.

Today, MAKE UP FOR EVER is a leader in the professional beauty market, providing high quality products in a wide range of colors and textures for MUAs and everyday consumers alike. Our products have been featured in hit shows like Riverdale and Euphoria, major publications like Allure and Glamour, and runways around the world.

Perks

We are passionate about providing an enriching experience for all our employees- including interns! Some of our perks include:
  • Hybrid environment (2 days in/ 3 days remote optional)
  • Flexible work hours
  • One-time WFH equipment stipend
  • Mentorship opportunities with senior management
  • Potential for mobility within the LVMH group
We would like to welcome you to our collective of PROFESSIONAL, EDUCATIONAL, ARTISTIC, and EXUBERANT talent!

Responsibilities
  • Participate in strategy/planning and execution all initiatives as listed in the Pro Marketing Calendar
  • Execute and support core curriculum.
  • Research and generate new business.
  • Maintain and support relationships with current school clients.
  • Generate and support new production, agency, and freelance artist business.
  • Facilitate the Internship program, recruiting new Interns and manage their progress.
  • Promote the Backstage Pro Card through varying channels and developing new ones.
  • Plan and support IMATS Trades Show
  • Plan and support all Pro events initiatives.
  • Forecast new launch needs and submissions.
  • Recognize and develop support materials for internal and partner needs.
  • Build, coordinate and coach special events teams
Qualifications
  • Personality and work ethic that fits with this growing market and the Brand’s Pro DNA.
  • 2-3 years working experience in a related position or field.
  • Must have advanced makeup artistry skils and ability to train/educate.
  • Exceptional communication skills, proficient in Excel and Word.
  • Must be able to efficiently manage time and multi task.
  • Excellent English and French written and oral communication skills (some translation need may be required)
  • Must be able to travel, drive and maintain a driver’s license.

description:
At Chatters, Style Happy is all about encouraging your artistic self-expression. Igniting your passion for providing that unforgettable customer experience. That’s why you continually have loyal clients that keep coming back. You have what it takes to ensure that our customers leave looking and feeling their best.

If you like having fun and making a difference; bring your Styling skills that are unparalleled to Chatters. Our Elite ongoing education and training opportunities will compliment your already mastered skills. We’re on the hunt for a talented, trend setting, experienced Licensed Hairstylist at our Currents of Windermere retail salon located in south west Edmonton.

A little about who you are:

  • An artist at heart, your creativity keeps them coming back!
  • A natural trend setter, you do that colour, cut or style the best in the business
  • You have 5 + years experience in a Stylist role with a license to work in Alberta
  • Mad multi-tasker with a passion to provide the best possible experience
  • You are flexible with relentless ambition to succeed and make those around you better
  • You are positive and build lasting relationships with your Style Happy family
  • You have a warm and welcoming manner that makes our guests feel comfortable from start to finish

A little about what you’ll do:

  • Deliver on our philosophy that the “Experience is Everything”, make a connection with each guest.
  • Use your super-styling powers for good, always looking to improve and succeed through advanced education.
  • Speak their language. You recognize that everyone has a different approach to beauty and are able to effectively communicate in a way that everybody understands
  • Be a pro. Maintain a high level of competence and professionalism when representing Chatters at all times
  • Have fun!

A little about what we offer: We know that great employees deserve great benefits, like:

  • Competitive pay in a high-traffic salon, with up to 54% commission
  • Discounted products and salon services
  • Flexible hours
  • Medical and dental, including employer RRSP contributions
  • Elite education by industry leaders

Plus, lots of opportunities to learn and grow! Want to get to know us a little better? Come check us out at https://www.chatters.ca

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent
Part-time hours: 20-40 per week

Salary: $15.00-$50.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Commission pay
  • Tips

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Weekend availability

Experience:

  • Hair styling: 3 years (required)

Licence/Certification:

  • Hairstylist Journeyman License or Red Seal (preferred)

Shift availability:

  • Night Shift (preferred)
  • Day Shift (preferred)

title: Makeup Artist/ Part Time
description:
Position Summary
As one of our highly skilled make-up artists you will combine your creative and technical expertise and passion for people to provide a welcoming, inspirational and personalized in-store experience which educates and delights our customers.
You will also like working as part of a high performing team to create impact with in-store events and to ensure that the store always achieves our high standards of visual merchandising to stand out against our competitors.
If you are a dynamic self-starter looking for a progressive career opportunity then this could be the perfect role for you and the first step of your career with a leader in prestige beauty.
While certification in make -up artistry and/or previous retail make up experience is desirable we also welcome applicants with amateur level experience.
As a leader in prestige beauty with a culture that values diversity of thought and people, we offer excellent training and development and a competitive remuneration and benefits package.
Qualifications
Qualifications

  • While a qualification in make-up artistry/previous retail make up experience is preferred, we welcome applicants with amateur level experience who are able to demonstrate a high level of creative and technical expertise
  • All applicants must be able to demonstrate the ability to provide inspirational, authentic and personalized customer service
  • Ability to work retail hours including days, nights, weekends and special events in a fast-paced work environment
  • Previous experience with retail point-of-sale software
  • Applicants must be able to provide proof of right to live and work in the country if invited to attend for interview

Job: Retail - Store
Primary Location: CA-ON-Toronto
Job Type: Standard
Schedule: Part-time
Shift: Variable
Job Number: 226770
We are an equal opportunity employer. Minorities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities are available on request.

Job Type: Part-time

title: Make Up Artist
description:
Why you’ll love us:
  • Blo is the industry leader, with over 100 North American locations and growing. Blo is a recognized brand with an international presence in the hair and beauty industry.
  • Amazing product partnerships including: UNITE haircare and Glo Skin Beauty, who support and love our salon staff as much as we do.
  • Dedicated to our extended Blo family. We offer our staff ongoing training, educational programs, product knowledge, skill development and career advancement opportunities for hairstylists.
  • Competitive hourly wage, gratuities and commission
Why We Will Love You
  • Love making people feel beautiful, special and valued
  • Collaborate well with team members in a fun, professional work environment in a salon
  • Understand the importance of maintaining a squeaky-clean work environment when working as a stylist
  • Passion for the hair and beauty industry
  • Friendly, approachable and an excellent listener
  • Mature, tactful and knows how to diffuse a tense situation and turn a good experience into a great one
You Must Have
  • 1-2 years of professional experience applying makeup
  • A certified/licensed makeup artist with experience in applying makeup
  • Knowledgeable on makeup consultation, application techniques and skin care
  • Expert in color matching across all skin tones
  • 1-2 year of salon experience (or working knowledge)
  • The ability to work weekends (Saturday at a minimum with Sunday and Friday availability preferred) and be flexible with your schedule (must be able to work peak hours as determined by the bar, typically Friday through Sunday)
Nice to Have
  • Comfortable with shampooing services, add on hair treatments, blow drying, hot tool styling



Visit www.blomedry.com for the skinny. And check out our Instagram @blo_burlington

All employment and hiring decisions are made by the Franchisee. Blo Blow Dry Bar Inc. is not the employer. All inquiries about employment at an independently owned and operated Blo location should be made directly to the Franchisee.

title: Make Up Artist
description:
Why you’ll love us:

  • Blo is the industry leader, with over 100 North American locations and growing.
  • Blo is a recognized brand with an international presence in the hair and beauty industry.
  • Amazing product partnerships including: UNITE hair care and Glo Skin Beauty, who support and love our salon staff as much as we do.
  • Dedicated to our extended Blo family. We offer our staff ongoing training, educational programs, product knowledge, skill development and career advancement opportunities for hairstylists.

Why We Will Love You

  • A certified/licensed makeup artist with experience in applying makeup
  • Passionate about the beauty industry and what’s on trend
  • Knowledgeable on makeup consultation, application techniques and skin care
  • Expert in color matching across all skin tones
  • Able to create a personalized makeup application for each gust
  • Can work weekends and are flexible with scheduling
  • Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills
  • Proactive and collaborative team player with a great work ethic
  • Friendly, approachable and an excellent listener
  • Mature, tactful and knows how to diffuse a tense situation and turn a good experience into a great one
  • An individual that is able to adapt to changing environments; someone who has experienced (and enjoyed) contributing to and implementing new approaches and processes with hair and makeup stylists

You Must Have

  • 1-2 years of professional experience applying makeup
  • Salon industry experience (or working knowledge)
  • Passion for the hair and beauty industry
  • The ability to work weekends (Fridays and Saturday) and be flexible with your schedule (must be able to work peak hours as determined by the bar, typically Thursday through Saturday)

Job Responsibilities:

  • Perform makeup applications on guests from Blo’s Signature Makeup Menu, in addition to custom makeup applications, including Bridal
  • Become a product knowledge expert of Glo Skin Beauty (Blo Blow Dry Bar’s chief makeup partner) and complete certification
  • Receive valuable ongoing education through Blo’s partnership with Glo Skin Beauty
  • Have the opportunity to perform off-site services (Blo on the Go) including cross-promotional events and pop-ups
  • Work in a sleek, modern blow dry bar alongside a passionate and dedicated team of hair and beauty experts
  • Behave as a brand ambassador for Blo in each interaction with co-workers and guests. You will live the “Blo Hearts You” motto, making sure that everyone feels the love!

Visit www.blomedry.com for the skinny. And check out our Instagram @bloheartsyou

All inquiries about employment at an independently owned and operated Blo location should be made directly to the Franchisee.

title: Character Artist – Dragon Age
description:
Multiple Locations: Edmonton, Alberta, Canada • Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada • Toronto, Ontario, Canada • Montreal, Quebec, Canada • Austin, Texas, United States

Requisition Number: 173172

Position Title: Character Artist 2

External Description:

At BioWare, our mission is to create worlds of adventure, conflict, and companionship that inspire you to become the hero of your story. Our teams inspire creativity using tech and tools such as the Frostbite engine and work with thousands of excellent developers across EA's network of studios. We are passionate about games and their potential as a creative medium to reach and inspire people through emotion, artistry, and engaging storytelling. If you share this passion, this is an amazing opportunity to help shape the next generation of gaming.

Responsibilities:

  • Partner with artists, designers, and writers to create industry-leading characters and creatures for BioWare
  • Provide guidance and feedback to external development teams ensuring a high-quality standard of 3D art
  • Iterate and provide feedback on character and creature workflows and tools to maximize efficiency for the project

Qualifications:

  • 3+ years of modeling experience creating industry standard character & creature related 3D art
  • Advanced skills in Maya, ZBrush, Substance, Marvelous Designer, Photoshop
  • Experience working closely with external art vendors
  • Experience with character and creature anatomy
  • Experience with character and creature design.
  • A degree or diploma in fine arts, animation, graphic design, or equivalent experience.
  • Bonus if you have experience with the Frostbite or Unreal engines.

Portfolio:

  • All submissions must include a portfolio showing personal or professional artwork

City:

State:

Remote?: 1

Community / Marketing Title: Character Artist - Dragon Age

Company Profile:

Electronic Arts is an innovative tech company that creates incredible experiences for millions of players around the world. But what matters most is our people who inspire us, and the world, to play. As we bring new forms of entertainment to people around the world, we need innovative, collaborative, diverse and adaptable people to keep making Electronic Arts better.

EEOText: About EA We exist to inspire the world to play. Through innovative technology and immersive storytelling, we deliver new ways of experiencing worlds of interactive entertainment for our millions of players worldwide. Our strength lies in the diversity of our people, combining creativity, innovation and passion. We fully champion inclusive culture, and provide opportunities for growing, learning, and leading that allows for the most impactful and rewarding work of our teams’ careers. We put our people first, and we make sure they’re taken care of both in and out of the office. As we reflect on our learnings and successes from remote work, we aim to provide dynamic, collaborative and flexible work environments for our teams. Our employees connect through our Employee Resource Groups, which are actively involved in driving business decisions every step of the way. But our support doesn’t end at the workplace—we also encourage a balanced lifestyle with paid time off and new parent leave, free video games, fitness reimbursement and more. Our goal is to provide a safe, respectful and inspiring workplace for all of our employees. Through our diversity, equity, inclusion and social responsibility programs, we’re doing the work to give everyone the space to be their full selves while giving back to our community. We’re looking for problem-solvers, game-changers, innovators, dreamers, doers—people that are ready to move the needle and build on our success. As our industry accelerates, we aren’t just keeping up—we’re staying ahead of the game. Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Electronic Arts also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

Date Opened: 2022-04-21 22:42:10.743

title: Pre-Professional Program Artist (Musician) Ontario AUDITIONS...
description:
Pre-Professional Program Artist (Musician) - Ontario


This is a full time position.

You must apply using our easy-apply portal: https://ontariomusicians.easyapply.co/

Please note that aspects of this position are modified to ensure Health and Safety during the COVID-19 pandemic.

This call for Pre-Professional Program Artists is for applicants residing in Ontario. If you reside in Ontario, you are welcomed and encouraged to apply under this job post. Alternatively, you can apply on the Canada-wide job post. You do not need to apply for more than one location when applying for the Pre-Professional Program.


Note: Emails regarding this position come from a "Get Hired" account, and may be delivered to your spam folder. If you haven't received a confirmation of your application within 72 hours, please email jobs@canadianmusicians.coop for support.

The Pre-Professional Program is a full-time, paid opportunity for early-career musicians to level up their artist business in preparation for the Emerging Artist Program and a career in the music industry. We have roles for singer-songwriters, self-accompanied vocalists, and instrumentalists (including backline performers on bass, drums, keys, guitar, and horns).

Over the course of two months in the summer, Pre-Professional Artists will participate in workshops and a variety of skill-building opportunities to improve their understanding of the music industry. They will split their time between performance and training, building a foundational understanding of the Canadian Music Industry at large.

Pre-Professional Program Artist Eligibility:
  • Must have their own portable solo performance setup for in-person performance opportunity (amplification implements optional)
  • Must have minimum of 60 minutes of material suitable for performance in public spaces, and be prepared to engage and entertain the public
  • Must be prepared to perform for up to 2 hours in length in-person

  • Must be willing to engage in online performances of up to 60 minutes

Due to federal funding requirements for this program, successful applicants must be:

  • 15–30 years of age on their first day of work
  • A Canadian citizen, have a permanent resident card, or be protected under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act ( There is no requirement to be a student)

  • Residing in Canada during the length of the employment.

This program pays minimum wage for your province.


Pre-Professional Program Artist Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Perform music and provide engaging and high-quality entertainment at summer events such as festivals, community celebrations, tourism initiatives, and agricultural fairs taking place in public and quasi-public spaces within municipalities partnered with the Co-op. (Due to COVID-19, the 2022 Pre-Professional Program will be a blended model of in-person and online activities, subject to local health regulations and guidelines. Participants must be prepared to record and perform remotely–either at home or another location arranged by the artist–such that the quality is acceptable for online hosting or streaming).
  • Participate in career-related skill-development programs, workshops, rehearsals and training programs to develop the highest caliber of professional skills and attitudes that will transcend the summer job period.
  • Respond to inquiries and interactions via electronic means (i.e., email, Slack, etc.) in a timely and professional manner.
  • Maintain professional workplace behavior and confidentiality when dealing with workplace challenges.
  • Complete administrative tasks on time and with accuracy, as assigned.
  • Attend functions such as job fairs, networking events, schools, and other approved locations to promote the Co-op, the Summer Emerging Artist/Musicians program objectives.

  • Complete other tasks as assigned.

Pre-Professional Program Work Hours:

  • Tuesday to Friday, 10am to 5pm (PST, EST, AST)
  • Sat-Sun, variable times: 6 hours of in-person or online performance, as scheduled by your Program Coordinator

  • Monday: Full day off, no program activities scheduled for artists

The Pre-Professional Program will be 6-8 weeks in length, commencing in early July and ending near the end of August.

Application Requirements:

You must upload your artistic resume and cover letter, and include a professional headshot specific to your artist-business, if you have one.

You must submit a link (in the pre-screening questions) to a YouTube video (2-3 minutes) of yourself performing one or more songs that you feel best represent your musical ability.

  • Original material is preferred.
  • Video must be unedited (i.e., no vocal tuning, audio processing, or video editing of any kind).
  • Links to public performances are permitted as long as they follow these guidelines.
  • We will review a maximum of three minutes of content. You can provide a link that starts at a specified timestamp of your choice.
  • Video may be uploaded as “unlisted” on YouTube if preferred. Please ensure that your video link is NOT private, as the audition jurors will not be able to view it and your application will not be considered.

Note: Bands or ensembles are encouraged to apply, however members must apply and audition individually.

*** RETURNING STAFF ***
Pre-Professional Program Artists employed in this role or the Emerging Artist role in any prior seasons are required to add a resume and cover letter detailing their growth since their last season, why they would like to return, and what they hope to get out of the program if selected for 2022. Please keep in mind that you will not necessarily return to the same position that you held last year.

Next Steps:

After the initial application (including the video performance submission), applicants successful at that stage will be invited to participate in a live, but online, ‘Callbacks’ second-round process. Please make sure you are available on the following dates:

  • April 28th, or April 29th, or April 30th

Callbacks will consist of a second-round audition, media interview, and a formal panel job interview. All this will take place over Zoom, and each level of assessment will be recorded. Candidates will be required to sign a media release before attending callbacks.


The Co-op also offers the Emerging Artist Program, which may better suit musicians with a higher level of skill.

The Emerging Artist (EA) Program is designed to help young Canadian musicians navigate the next level of their career, whether that is a national tour, preparing for export, or any other major stepping stone from the beginner level to the intermediate. We have roles for singer-songwriters, self-accompanied vocalists, and instrumentalists (including backline performers on bass, drums, keys, guitar, and horns).

EAs will get structured training from a variety of industry professionals in navigating the intricacies of the music industry, gaining skills and knowledge crucial for career growth along the way. The primary focus of this program is to provide support for and animate our communities and to build sustainability in our artistic workforce. Hours not spent performing will be occupied with workshops, training, and hands-on activities to prepare EAs for levelling up their business. Some performers may be selected as principal roles in our end-of-summer touring Showcase.

Those who apply for only the Pre-Professional Program will not be considered for the EA program. If you want to be considered for the EA program, please apply under the EA job posting and indicate that you would also like to be considered for the Pre-Professional Program.


IMPORTANT ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:

To have your application considered by the Jury, all pre-interview questions must be filled out completely.

Please note that there are no part-time or performance-only positions this year.

Membership is not required to participate in the competition for this position, and no preference is given to existing members in our ranking process, however, upon acceptance of an employment contract, all employees are required to join the co-operative.

Those not selected for the Summer Emerging Artist Program or the Pre-Professional Program (PPP) are still welcome to join The Co-op as members. Professional Creator members have access to the same live or digital resources, support and community as those with that membership level in our programs.

Canadian Musicians Co-operative welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Please email jobs@canadianmusicians.coop if you have any questions or require accommodations.

title: newProduction Artist 2
description:
Requisition ID: 313651

Position Number: 20009698

Posting End Date: May 11, 2022

City: Winnipeg

Site: Health Sciences Centre

Department / Unit: Printing HSC

Job Stream: Non-Clinical

Union: OEM-HSC

Anticipated Start Date: ASAP

FTE: 1.00

Anticipated Shift: Days

Daily Hours Worked: 7.50

Annual Base Hours: 1950

Salary: $25.467, $26.231, $27.019, $27.829, $28.664, $29.524


Shared Health leads the planning and coordinates the integration of patient-centred clinical and preventive health services across Manitoba. The organization also delivers some province-wide health services and supports centralized administrative and business functions for Manitoba health organizations.

Position Overview

Under the general direction of the Manager and with a strong focus on customer service the Production Artist II performs the following duties: Consults with clients and processes printing requisitions by utilizing the appropriate procedure (i.e. desk top publishing, typesetting, and designing). Participates on the forms committees and provides direction on requirements and policies for the production of forms. Manages forms including recording and quality control. Troubleshoots technical problems related to image setting and plate making equipment.

Experience

  • Three years previous experience in desk top publishing required.
  • Must be proficient in the use of the following programs: Quark X Press, Corel Draw, InDesign, Freehand, Photoshop, and Microsoft Word/Publisher and possess a thorough knowledge of graphic formats and their appropriate use.

Education (Degree/Diploma/Certificate)

  • Complete high school education, Manitoba standards, required.
  • Successful completion of a recognized two year Graphic Arts program.
  • An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered by the centre.

Qualifications and Skills

  • Demonstrated proficiency in typesetting and art/paste-up required.
  • Must be knowledgeable of printing processes.

Physical Requirements

  • Extended periods of sitting in one position


We have a unique ability to work together to make health care better. If you want to make a difference and contribute to supporting the health of your family, friends and neighbours, please apply today.


Interested candidates should select the "Apply" icon below to upload their cover letter, resume and copy of licenses/certification.


This position requires a current satisfactory Criminal Records Check (including Vulnerable Sector Search), Child Abuse Registry Check and Adult Abuse Registry Check as conditions of employment. The successful candidate will be responsible for any service charges incurred. A security check is considered current if it was obtained no more than six (6) months prior to the start of employment.


Please note that an employee is not permitted to hold two or more positions in Shared Health that combine to equal more than 1.0 FTE.


Shared Health values and supports employment equity and workplace diversity and encourages all qualified individuals to apply. We thank all applicants but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.


We welcome applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request during the assessment and selection process.
