title: Lead Character Artist
description:
A career at New World Interactive is about being part of a team working on some of the most creative FPS shooters in the world. You would be welcomed to a friendly, inclusive environment where you can learn, and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.

NWI is looking for a talented Lead Character Artist that will guide the development of characters and creatures. Mentoring, supporting, and managing the great and skilled character art team, who will have a passion and willingness to be part of our Character design process. This is a full-time permanent position within the Character Team where you can focus on what you love. We're a remote-first studio hiring within Canada.


Responsibilities:
  • Working together with the Creative Director and other team leads to create appealing characters, understanding the technical limitations of the engine.
  • Create and establish workflows that better fits the department needs.
  • Manage your team's timelines, progress, and deadlines sharply.
  • Mentor and nurture the character art team to make it grow and succeed in this competitive industry.
  • Work closely with the Technical Art department to ensure the highest quality possible.
  • Review the in-house and outsource character art work to ensure that they meet the artistic and technical standards established for our games.
  • Attend and organize meetings to plan and track current and future tasks.
  • Research and develop better practices to be updated with the latest technologies.

Qualifications:
  • At least 3 years of experience creating Characters for video games.
  • At least 2 games shipped as a Character Artist
  • Strong knowledge of Human and Animal Anatomy with great attention to detail of form, shape, and silhouette.
  • Proficiency in UE4, be able to create believable materials for skin, cloth, eyes, hair, etc.
  • Strong understanding of Normal Map synchronization and baking.
  • Comfortable with a broad range of styles, techniques, and workflows.
  • Great eye for colour and texture.
  • Ability to understand and learn technical and creative concepts.
  • Great understanding of topological flow for better deformation.
  • Comfortable understanding and following technical limitations.
  • Self-motivated to learn new technologies and stay up to date with game technologies.
  • Great organization and management skills to mentor and motivate an amazing team.

Skills:
  • Blender
  • Substance Painter
  • Zbrush
  • Marmoset Toolbag
  • Unreal Engine 4
  • Traditional art skills like drawing, painting, and sculpting are a plus

Why New World Interactive?

At New World, we believe in our team’s happiness. We respect the well-being of our teammates and believe healthy, happy, and passionate employees are the result of a best-in-class work environment.


We believe in inclusivity. We create an environment of safety where everyone feels like they belong. We value every team member for the skills they bring, regardless of their gender, demographics or community. We ensure everyone has the same opportunities for advancement.

We believe in teamwork. We appreciate the value that is created by every team member working together with trust, collaboration, responsibility, and accountability. We celebrate success.

We believe in creativity. We enjoy solving problems and trying new things. We rely on unique and varied perspectives to continuously improve. We promote autonomy within the team.

We believe in putting players first. We empathize with our players and keep the user experience and user impact at the forefront of our decision-making.

Benefits

  • Tenure based vacation policy with a yearly week-long studio closure at the end of December
  • Unlimited PTO and sick days
  • Extended Health Benefits (Drug, Vision, Dental, Specialists)
  • Continuing Education and Personal Development Benefits
  • Cost-of-living raises
  • Bonus program

New World is an equal opportunity employer. All employment opportunities are provided without regard to race, religion, sex, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by the Employment Equity Act in Canada.

title: newDigital Twins Content Lead - Sr. Technical Artist
description:
The Opportunity

We're looking for a Senior Technical Artist to join our Digital Twins Technical Marketing team at Unity. In this role, our new team member will build and develop high quality content and assets to support marketing activations such as product demos, videos, sales enablement content, and much more - focusing on markets for Automotive, Transportation, Manufacturing, Architecture, Engineering, Construction, Government and Aerospace, Retail, Robotics, Machine Learning and AI. Do you want to use your background in producing high quality visuals and technical training to drive adoption and long term retention of Unity's Digital Twin solutions?

What you'll be doing:

  • Lead a small but growing team of content specialists who are producing assets and innovative content to support the Digital Twins Technical Marketing team!
  • Work with cross-functional project teams to plan, scope, conceptualize, and build assets and content for our Digital Twins Technical Marketing programs.
  • Build and maintain assets, models, and projects in our ever growing content library for use in sales and marketing content.
  • Implement creative solutions to ensure the highest quality standards internally and with vendors.
  • Remain up to date on all Unity Digital Twins products and services

What We're Looking For

  • Experience with crafting content for the Industrial sectors.
  • Hands-on experience with DCC and artist tools like Houdini, Maya, and or Blender, Photoshop.
  • Proficiency with Materials, Lighting and Texturing and Shaders for PBR workflows
  • Experience with commercial/industrial data (CAD, BIM, GIS, LIDAR, point clouds, IoT, PLM, etc.)
  • Understanding of real-time 3D data preparation, performance and optimizations (Tessellation, Decimation, retopology and more)

You might also have

  • Knowledge of cinematography fundamentals, cameras and lenses. Excellent eye for lighting, color and outstanding aesthetic
  • C# programming skills
  • Experience with the Unity Industrial Collection of products.

Please provide work samples or Portfolio.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Life at Unity

Unity (NYSE: U) is the world's leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity's platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices.

In the fourth quarter of 2021, Unity had, on average, 3.9 billion monthly active end users who consumed content created or operated with its solutions. The applications developed by these creators were downloaded, on average, five billion times per month in 2021. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.

Unity is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment and celebrate our employees across age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. Our differences are strengths that enable us to support the growing and evolving needs of our customers, partners, and collaborators. If there are preparations or accommodations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.


À propos de Unity

Unity (NYSE: U) est la plateforme la plus utilisée au monde pour la création et l'exécution interactive de contenu 3D en temps réel (RT3D). Des créateur(rice)s, notamment des développeur(se)s de jeux vidéo, des artistes, des architectes, des concepteur(rice)s automobiles, des cinéastes et bien d'autres professionnel(le)s, utilisent Unity pour donner vie à leurs projets. Unity constitue la base sur lesquelles sont créés les contenus numériques les plus remarquables au monde. Plus précisément, la plateforme de Unity offre un ensemble complet de solutions logicielles pour créer, exécuter et monétiser du contenu interactif 2D et 3D en temps réel pour les téléphones mobiles, les tablettes, les ordinateurs, les consoles et les appareils de réalité augmentée et de réalité virtuelle.

Au quatrième trimestre de l'année 2021, Unity comptait en moyenne 3,9 milliards d'utilisateurs finaux actifs mensuels ayant consommé du contenu créé ou exploité au moyen de ses solutions. Les applications développées par ces créateurs ont été téléchargées en moyenne cinq milliards de fois par mois en 2021. Pour en savoir davantage, veuillez consulter le site www.unity.com.

Unity est un employeur fier de garantir l'égalité des chances. Nous nous engageons à favoriser un environnement inclusif et innovateur et à célébrer nos employés à travers l'âge, l'éthinicité, la couleur, l'ascendance, l'origine nationale, la religion, le handicap, le sexe, l'identité ou l'expression de genre, l'orientation sexuelle ou tout autre statut protégé conformément à la loi applicable. Nos différences sont des forces nous permettant de répondre aux besoins croissants et évolutifs de nos clients, partenaires et collaborateurs. S'il y a des préparatifs ou ajustements que nous pourrions apporter afin de vous offrir une expérience d'entrevue confortable et positive, n'hésitez pas à nous en informer.

Les chasseurs de têtes et les agences de recrutement ne peuvent pas soumettre résumes/CV par ce site Web ou directement aux superviseurs. Unity n'accepte pas des chasseurs de têtes non sollicités et des résumés (CV) d'agence. Unity ne payera pas d'honoraires à aucune agence tierce ou entreprise qui n'a pas signé d'ententes avec Unity.

title: newSenior 3D Environment Artist
description:
Our mission is to craft retro-infused JRPGs that awaken cherished childhood memories. We’re assembling a dream team of talent from across the globe to make this happen. Join us on this epic quest to make fun, narrative-rich games in an inclusive, supportive and fun studio environment!

You’ll be working on Threads of Time, a 2.5D JRPG inspired by Chrono Trigger and Final Fantasy where you get to travel from the pre-historic era to the end of time.

  • Become part of a veteran team that includes legendary developers of the JRPG world
  • 4 weeks paid vacation (1 week of which is taken in late December)
  • Collaborative environment with opportunities to contribute to the game’s creative design and take ownership of features
  • Competitive salary and benefits including medical, dental, vision, and life insurance
  • Opportunities to help you strengthen your skills or learn something new
  • Workplace that appreciates and values diversity and inclusivity
Responsibilities
  • Work closely with the lead environment artist
  • Creating 3D environments and assets from concept art and descriptions
  • Creating block-out assets and crafting production level stylized game environments
  • Modeling various models that are efficient, UV’d and have proper lightmaps
  • Create stylized PBR textures
  • Importing models into Unreal, setting them up correctly and creating applicable materials
  • Working closely with the rest of the art team to maintain a consistent and high-quality art style
  • Working closely with game designers to create and adjust environments based on gameplay needs
Requirements
  • A minimum of 5 years of experience in 3D modeling/sculpting/texturing
  • Proficient in industry standard tools like Maya, Blender, Photoshop, Substance
  • Expert Knowledge of game environment development processes from sculpting, to retopo, baking, uvs, texturing etc
  • Strong knowledge of modular construction and assembly techniques, lighting, colour theory, composition, shape language and post process effects
  • Good sense of asset organization and adherence to naming conventions
  • Comfortable with ambiguity and able to drive towards clarity to deliver work on time
  • Able to give and receive constructive feedback
  • A shipped game title
Pluses
  • Familiarity with Unreal Engine and version control
  • A love of RPG games
  • Resident of Ontario, Canada
This is a full-time remote position. Applicants must reside in Canada.

title: Subway Sandwich Artist in the Kelowna Airport
company: Subway Sandwich Artist inside the Kelowna Airport
description:
JOB SUMMARY:

We are looking for people like you!

Fun and flexible environment where guest are your neighbors, where co-workers are your friends and where simple acts make a lasting impression.

  • $15.20+ per hour depending on experience
  • Free parking
  • Flexible schedules
  • Medical/dental after 30 days for full time employees
  • No experience necessary
  • Comprehensive on the job training
  • Advancement opportunities

RESPONSIBILITIES and DUTIES:

  • Greet, serve and interact with Guests
  • Provide exceptional Guest Service
  • Prepare and serve all menu items
  • Operate POS system, handle cash and credit card equipment
  • Complete University of SUBWAY® courses as directed
  • Maintains a professional appearance and grooming standards as outlined in the SUBWAY® Operations Manual
  • Understands and adheres to proper food handling, safety and sanitation standards during food preparation, service and clean up
  • Cleans and maintains all areas of the restaurant to promote a clean image
  • Understands and adheres to all quality standards, formulas and procedures as outlined in the SUBWAY® Operations Manual

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Fluent English speaking and writing skills
  • Must submit application for Airport Security Clearance and Records Check
  • Winning attitude
  • Team player
  • Must be eligible to work in Canada

Job Type: Part or Full-time

Work remotely

  • No

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent
Part-time hours: 20-40 per week

Salary: From $15.20 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Holidays
  • Monday to Friday
  • Night shift
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
Full vaccination and current photo ID required to work inside the Kelowna Airport. All customers and staff are required to wear face masks. Sanitization procedures and wellness checks are also required.

Application question(s):

  • Are you currently in Kelowna?

title: Compositor - Intermediate/ Senior
description:
POSITION PURPOSE


The Compositor is responsible for delivering high quality composites in a quick and efficient manner. They will apply notes provided by the Compositing Supervisors/Leads. They will manage their time effectively to ensure tasks are completed within the assigned timeframe and to the specifications requested by Image Engine clients. The will take on shots in varying levels of difficulty including, green screen, 2D tracking and 2D projections. They will identify and troubleshoot problems as needed and will ask for assistance when necessary to ensure effective use of time and resources.


They will begin quality checking their own work and assisting Senior artists to develop new concepts and approaches to improve work quality. They will participate in all team meetings when necessary.


DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES


  • Apply client notes to all comp shots with minimal guidance
  • Communicate successes and challenges faced by the team to the Compositing Supervisor
  • Take direction from the Compositing Supervisor to help realize the vision of the shots
  • Ensure continuity is upheld across shots and sequences
  • Work primarily with Compositing Supervisor/ leads to effectively solve compositing challenges within the pipeline
  • Composite multiple types of shots (live action footage, digital still photography, rendered cg elements and digital paint) with minimal supervision to create believable environments that are to be seamlessly integrated into the film
  • Work with production and supervisor team to understand and manage schedules and shot deadlines
  • Attend dailies, reviews, and team meetings
  • Provide input regarding tools and interfaces to improve throughout
  • Work with Compositing team to maintain continuity and consistent performance within a show
  • Work closely with lighters and matte painters to finish shots so that computer generated elements are seamlessly integrated with live-action plates
  • Manage time and resources to meet weekly targets
  • Promote interdepartmental collaboration

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE


  • 3+ years (Mid) - 5+ years (Senior) experience in compositing digital VFX for film
  • Demonstrated work experience in Nuke (ie. assemble cg passes, cleanup, keying, roto)
  • Ability to balance quick turnaround while achieving a high degree of aesthetic quality

SKILLS AND ABILITIES


Technical skills

  • Experience in Nuke
  • Strong aptitude for technical workflow challenges such as directory structure, file formats, naming conventions, scripts, automation tools, automated dailies, etc.
  • Knowledge of compositing workflow and the compositing application interface
  • Good understanding of photography and film and how the interactions of light, lenses and film emulsions go to make up the image
  • Ability to understand black levels, grain structure and any technical issues pertaining to the film format

Core skills

  • Ability to composite multiple types of shots from simple to difficult with increasingly less supervision
  • Ability to troubleshoot and deal with competing priorities and projects
  • Ability to adapt quickly to new technologies and applications
  • Excellent time management and communication skills
  • Ability to remain calm during peak production periods and maintain the morale of the Compositing team.

  • Candidates are required to be based in British Columbia.

title: newEstee Lauder Counter Manager
description:
LocationEDMONTON,Alberta,Canada
CategoryStores
Job OpenedMay 3rd, 2022
EducationHigh School Diploma/GED
Job Number2200028Q
Job TypeFull-Time
RemoteNo

job description

What This Position is All About
You are a friendly, customer-focused individual who understands the importance of always being ready to serve the customer. You are a team player who has earned the respect of your peers through commitment, partnership and effective communication. You organize and prioritize your workload in a way that always puts the customer first and delivers the operational standards that are required. In a dynamic fast-paced environment you are self-motivated, adaptable and decisive ensuring the best outcome for the customer and the business.
Who You Are:
  • Acts with customers in mind, great networking and relationship management.
  • Puts the needs of internal and external customers first. Seeks customer information when improving products and services.
  • Often goes above and beyond their goals. Is consistently a top performer and elevates the performance of others
  • Sees ahead clearly, is knowledgeable and has a capability for a big picture perspective.
You Also Have:
  • Knowledge of skin/body care treatments with 2-5 years of work experience in Cosmetics
  • Certified Make-up Artist
  • Must have experience in a commission and clientele selling environment
  • Full flexibility with schedule (including evenings and weekends)
As The Counter Manager of Cosmetics, You Will:
  • Analyze business metrics to develop action plans that address opportunities and positively impact the business
  • Build your client base through the Preferred Customer Program
  • Observe staff on the selling floor and their interaction with customers, co-workers and overall customer service level
  • Achieve daily / weekly / monthly sales goals based on the department's goal and are expected to track their sales
  • Deliver World-class service through client communication, product knowledge, fashion direction and solution-based selling at the highest-level
  • Work with Vendor Partners to maximize sales opportunities through suggestive selling, store events / seminars and wardrobe clients
How Often You May Travel:
  • NA
Your Life and Career at HBC:
  • Be part of a world-class team; work with an adventurous spirit; think and act like an owner- operator!
  • Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities, from retail to supply chain, to digital or corporate.
  • A culture that promotes a healthy, fulfilling work/life balance
  • Benefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, vision and dental).
  • An amazing employee discount
Thank you for your interest with HBC. We look forward to reviewing your application.
HBC provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, HBC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
HBC welcomes all applicants for this position. Should you be individually selected to participate in an assessment or selection process, accommodations are available upon request in relation to the materials or processes to be used.

title: newProduction Manager - CG Animation
description:
Ever fantasized about working on a DreamWorks production? Then pull up those underpants captain, and troll on over the virtual hedge, your next adventure awaits! Let’s make that fantasy a reality, come and work for Stellar, where we hire exactly that - STELLARS!

About Us:

At Stellar Creative Lab we live, breathe, and dream animation. We foster a creative and collaborative culture where we face challenges as a team and flourish together. Stellar is a thriving company that will support and mentor your objectives. Curious? - Contact us!

Summary:

Stellar Creative Lab is looking for a Production Manager to join our team for an awesome New Streaming Series for DreamWorks Animation. This project is fun for both youngins and the big kids. The PM, while working closely with the Line Producer and Department Coordinators, will be instrumental in managing the daily operations of production. The Production Manager should thrive under pressure, work well in a team environment and be passionate about people and animation. Please note we are unable to offer relocation at this time.

What We Need:

  • Project Management – proven ability in managing projects from concept to completion. Able to prioritize appropriately and always meet deadlines. The ability to juggle multiple balls at once.
  • Superb Written & Verbal Communication – good at following directions; Ability to interact with and integrate requests of directors, executives and clients.
  • Excellent Teamwork – ability to assemble and motivate teams and work effectively with others.
  • Experience as an accomplished Production Manager, and/or Production Coordinator.

Your Main Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Maintain overall production schedule and manage departmental quotas.
  • Make recommendations for improvements to production systems, particularly with-respect-to scheduling, flow of information, milestone realization, and resource management.
  • Daily interaction with the client on production related needs and deliveries.
  • Organization – demonstrated strong organizational skills including attention to detail.
  • Manage production related purchase orders, invoices, and expenses and update the financial forecast weekly.
  • Perform other various duties as assigned by the Producer.

Your Experience, Talents and Abilities:

  • Ideally hold a Bachelor’s (BA) degree from accredited four-year college or university, or equivalent experience.
  • A thorough knowledge of production and animation CG processes, 2D experience is beneficial.
  • Proficient with Google Drive, MS office suites including Excel and Word.
  • Previous experience working with Shotgun a requirement.
  • Strong Problem solving skills.
  • Excellent conflict resolution and negotiation skills.
  • Eligible to work in B.C.
  • This is a remote (work from home) position, if requested work from the studio is possible.

Live in Squamish? Kelowna? Vancouver Island? Somewhere in BC with a great internet connection? We can work with that! Stellar Creative Lab encourages artists to work where they live and love where they work. Join us - we have some amazing opportunities.

In response to the COVID - 19 pandemic, Stellar Creative Lab is able to offer the following benefits:

  • the option to work at the studio as well as remotely across British Columbia
  • ongoing health and safety training
  • support for your ergonomic workspace at home

title: Experienced Rigging Artist - Feature Animation
description:
We are looking for Rigging Artists to work on an exciting project! If you are interested in working in an animation studio full of some of the best people out there to make some incredible entertainment, please get in touch!


Our Rigging Team


At Cinesite Vancouver, the rigging department is responsible for creating the controls and their associated deformations for others to effectively animate characters, vehicles, environment sets and props. In Rigging we look for good technical knowledge with the understanding of the creative requirements of their creations. As well as working collaboratively as a team, we work closely with the design, animation, modeling and CFX departments.


If this all sounds like a role for you, apply!


What you will be doing


  • Create, modify and document templates for other artists to use
  • Troubleshoot technical issues and flag workflow inefficiencies
  • Create tickets and provide data and feedback when issues arise
  • Work collaboratively with other departments for optimization, solving issues and ensuring continuity
  • Support others in the team with trouble shooting
  • Keep leads, supervisors and production updated in a timely manner

What you will bring to the team


  • Proficient in Maya and version control software
  • Efficient time management and strong understanding of resource management
  • Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills
  • Eye for detail and continuity
  • Good at setting up rigs for optimal performance and efficient animation output
  • In depth understanding of established methods of working with skeletons, modeling geometry and weighting that meet the project’s creative objectives
  • Good understanding of asset topology, mesh flow and skinning workflow
  • Good at developing and maintaining procedural rig components
  • Good understanding of Python


Cinesite Vancouver welcomes and encourages applications from people who require accommodations. Reasonable accommodations may be requested for reasons related to mental health, physical disability, religious practices, medical conditions etc.


P.S. Our studio is built on respect and inclusion - we strive to create a safe place for all to come to work (or to work remotely)

title: 3D Environment Artist - ON
description:
At Mainframe Studios, we’re creators first. We eat creative and technical challenges for breakfast and come back for more. We’ve been doing this for 25+ years, and we’re still going strong. We’re lucky enough to have the best team in the business. From our artists to our technical and production folks, everyone is passionate about collaborating on some kickass projects. We’ve partnered with the biggest names in the business to create a huge library of content. With partners like Mattel, Netflix, DreamWorks, Sony, Silvergate, and Nickelodeon, it's no wonder we’ve established ourselves as a creative force to be reckoned with.
WE WANT YOU (and your mad skills)!
On a CG animated TV series, working with the Art Director, Director and Modeling Supervisor/team, the Foliage Artist is responsible for creating and/or modifying foliage, rocks and natural like assets and distributing them through out the sets in the show.
This role specializes in Foliage and Set Dressing using Speedtree and Mash.
Responsibilities and Duties

  • Collaborating with the art team and acting positively on Art Direction and feedback, to complete the work to a high quality and required art style.
  • Interpreting 2D concept art and reference into accurate 3D models that capture the spirit of the concept as well as the technical dimensions.
  • Significant experience and techniques in the creation of trees, plants, shrubs, and vines using cards/flats.
  • Experience working with SpeedTree (or similar software).
  • Understanding and experience with Mash and set dressing tool base software.
  • Collaborates with lighters and compositors to make sure the final look is achieved.
  • Collaborates with animation to ensure all elements are included and set-up as required.
  • Ability to prioritize the completion of shots with the goal to facilitate optimal workflow in the production pipeline.
  • Interprets and implements notes and feedback from (based on the production structure) the Director, Producer, Art Director/Production Designer, Visual Effects Supervisor in a timely and qualitatively acceptable way.
  • Supervises completion of all set dressing assignments per production schedule.
  • Adheres to digital file management protocols.
  • Supports and integrates the values of Mainframe that being a commitment to innovation, creativity, professionalism and inspiration.
  • Interacts respectfully and professionally with colleagues, staff members and clients.
  • Additional duties as requested.

Qualifications and Skills

  • Degree and/or diploma in fine arts or animation or equivalent is required.
  • 3+ years of experience working in a professional environment within their discipline.
  • Must demonstrate an strong knowledge of staging and composition.
  • High level proficiency using Maya is required.
  • SpeedTree modelling skills (or similar software) is required.
  • Great understanding of proportion, scale, perspective, lighting and colour.
  • Familiarity with Substance Painter and Photoshop texturing skills, targeting physically based rendering.
  • Ability to liaise with production staff and artists and clearly communicate production process, plans and concepts and set clear expectations.
  • Practices attentive and active listening. Shares information, methodologies and ideas with others.
  • Adaptable to change, they can alter course of action quickly per production needs. Highly motivated, proactive, solution-minded, solid work ethic and positive attitude. Consistently strives to expand knowledge base.
  • Makes decisions in a timely manner. Accepts accountability for own actions. Creatively solves problems, eliminates roadblocks and focuses on issue at hand.
  • Outstanding organizational and time management skills. Ability to multi-task and delegate.
  • Outstanding problem-solving skills and ability to work collaboratively.
  • Responsible for managing the Department's output and meeting quota expectation per project's requirements.

-
Mainframe Studios is an Equal Opportunity Employer, which means we will not discriminate against any individual based on race, colour, sex, national origin, age, religion, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, military or veteran status, disability, or any factors prohibited by applicable law. This policy applies to every aspect of employment at Mainframe Studios, including recruitment, hiring, training, advancement, and termination. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and partners. Should you require accommodation throughout the recruitment process, please let us know your requirements when contacted.

title: newStoryboard Artists - 2D Animated Series
description:
House of Cool Inc.

130 Queens Quay East, Suite 600

Toronto, Ontario, Canada, M5A 1B4

Project based, Full Time

Language in work environment - English

Wage range $70,000-$104,000

Benefits per company policy: Health Insurance, Sick and Vacation leave.

House of Cool in Toronto is seeking Story Artists for 2D Animated Series!

House of Cool is the leading studio in animation for Pre‐Production throughout the world. Together with our clients, the House of Cool team has worked to design stories and craft some of the worlds coolest Animated Series and Feature Films such as: Spies in Disguise (Disney/Fox) and Maya and the Three (Netflix). House of Cool has also worked on Next Gen (Netflix), Ferdinand (Fox), The Book of Life (Fox), Rio 1 & 2 (Fox) and many more productions!


Our Mission is to bring families and audiences together through the development of unforgettable animated characters in feature films and series. We look to achieve this through our creative and professional talents that make up the growing family at House of Cool. We pride ourselves in being an equal opportunity employer providing training and workshops to develop skills and values necessary for artists to thrive in our dynamic and awesome industry.


About the Story Artist, 2D Animated Series!


Responsibilities

  • Work with script to produce dynamic storyboard panels for sequences/episodes
  • Attention to detail, clarity, acting, and cinematographic storytelling
  • Communicate progress with Director and Production staff
  • Pitch boards to Director and Storyboard Supervisor
  • Follow launches/direction and revisions for each stage of the boarding process
  • Troubleshoot story issues and help find solutions
  • Maintain deadlines from launch to final deliverables
  • Consistently achieve the quality and style of the project
  • Collaborate with grace, humility, and open mindedness

Requirements

  • 4+ years’ experience on animated series
  • Strong sense of story, composition and character acting
  • Must be able to illustrate digitally in any style required
  • Storyboard samples or credits demonstrating desired traits listed in posting
  • Inclusive team player, able to collaborate with international and remote crew
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Working in studio preferred
  • Ontario residents preferred, others will be considered
  • Expertise in Storyboard Pro and Photoshop required

2 References Required

Only those considered for the position will be contacted.

Please submit resumes to houseofcool.bamboohr.com/jobs

title: Hard Surface Artist (Apex Legends)
description:
Founded in 2010 by the original creators of the Call of Duty Franchise, Respawn was created with the philosophy that when talented people have creative freedom, they'll make extraordinary games that achieve the unexpected. From our roots as an indie studio to joining the expansive roster of studios at Electronic Arts, this remains our guiding principle. We truly love what we do and want to share our passion with players worldwide. Our shipped titles include critically acclaimed multi-platform games Apex Legends, Titanfall, Titanfall 2, Star Wars™ Jedi: Fallen Order and Medal of Honor: Above and Beyond. Join us for the opportunity to create groundbreaking games with some of the best developer talent in the industry.

You can learn more about our studio and values at respawn.com/studio.

Apex Legends is looking for outstanding Hard Surface artists to come join us in fleshing out the Apex Universe. Whether it's experience managing others and owning areas to develop, setting visual targets, or just excelling at environmental storytelling and craft, there could be a role for you!

Responsibilities

  • Hard Surface creation – assets including Weapons, Character kits, Props, and a variety of assets not limited to hard surface modeling for Apex Legends.
  • Working in a team - Operates effectively with guidance from Art Director (AD) and Lead. Occasionally partner with other artists and/or under senior artist’s guidance.
  • Collaboration – Expected to proactively work with other departments independently. Partnering with departments such as animation, concept, VFX to find solutions or design requirements.
  • High Tier assets – Artist will be responsible for the creation of some of our high value assets. Task includes rapid prototyping, building proxy, simple animation, proof of concept to name a few.
  • Team support – capable of assisting other team member with challenges such workload support, and other general needs that may come up in a moment notice.
  • Technical support – assist AD and Lead in contributing to quality-of-life improvements for workflows and documentation. Testing new tools and providing feedback.
  • Operating proprietary tools – can work proficiently with in house tools and game engine.

Qualifications

  • 5+ years of production experience primarily as a Hard Surface or Prop Artist
  • Proficient 3D modelling with emphasis in Hard Surface
  • Have experiences shipping titles as a Hard Surface Artist
  • Building asset not just aesthetically but in consideration of design, function, gameplay, and optimization
  • Experiences working in collaboration with other discipline
  • Communicates effectively with Email, Slack, and Zoom
  • Substance Painter and Marmoset for bakes and texture
  • Maya as a primary 3D application
  • Some understanding of mechanical design
  • Strong understanding of PBR
  • Comprehensive knowledge of some mainstream or proprietary game engine
  • Proficient in at least a secondary modeling program for high-res modelling such as Blender, Zbrush, 3DS Max, or equivalent

Portfolio Requirements

  • Examples of professional hard surface work
  • Understanding of weapon design and general mechanical designs
  • Bakes, UV layout, Mesh flow

Bonus

  • Rigging and animation
  • Game scripts
  • Lighting and Rendering

Electronic Arts is an innovative tech company that creates incredible experiences for millions of players around the world. But what matters most is our people who inspire us, and the world, to play. As we bring new forms of entertainment to people around the world, we need innovative, collaborative, diverse and adaptable people to keep making Electronic Arts better.

title: Lash Tech/Microblading Tech
description:
Description:

      • Job Summary

        Donato Salon + Spa is looking for an Eyelash Extension and Microblading Tecnhinican to join our award winning team.

        Overview

        Known for creative and progressive hair design, Donato Salon + Spa is synonymous with beauty and fashion. Donato Salon + Spa features the city's best hairstylists, colourists, estheticians, massage therapists, and make up artists. These innovative trendsetters, talented artists and experienced designers are known throughout Canada and the around the world!

title: Rough Layout Artist
description:
Company Description


Mikros Animation is a global CGI animation studio located in Paris, Montreal, Los Angeles, Bangalore and London, dedicated to feature films and episodic content. Since its inception, Mikros Animation has always put creativity and CG artistry at the heart of its animation and production activities, allowing our artists to work across a great variety of stories with a high level of stylized craft. So far, Mikros Animation has contributed to ten released feature animations and to numerous high-quality animated series, for the world’s best-known animation studios, either as creative studio, line producer or executive producer. Mikros Animation has also produced more than 250 hours of programming, broadcast by notable channels including Cartoon Network, Nickelodeon, TF1, France TV, Gulli, M6, Gloob, and Super RTL. Our animated episodic content airs and streams globally, in over 180 countries.


At Mikros Animation, we believe great animation is about making real connections with real people. By partnering with filmmakers to unite their creative visions, with our industry-leading craftsmanship and artistry, we create characters that connect with audiences on an authentic and emotional level to bring powerful stories to life.


Job Description


Under the direction of the Rough/Final Layout Supervisor, the 3D Layout Artist is in charge of setting up the assets and cameras for the 3D scenes assigned. He/she must be able to make cinematographic proposals while respecting the director's intentions.

From the sequences received from the Editorial and under the responsibility of the Layout Supervisor:

  • Create shots, position characters, environments, and key props of the action when necessary
  • Propose relevant camera angles and movements, in line with the director's intentions
  • Predefine the movements of the characters in the scene
  • Guarantee the continuity of the shots and sequences
  • Respect the quotas established and given by the Layout Supervisor and the Production Coordinator

Ensure the finalization of the camera work on the shots that will be assigned to him:

  • Provide strong artistic and technical expertise.
  • Ensure that the requested retakes are taken into account and follow up on them
  • Respect the quotas given by the production
  • Resolve camera and set dressing issues and be able to track cameras and shots as they move through the pipeline

Qualifications
  • Have an eye for image composition and staging
  • Strong storytelling skills
  • Knowledge of focal lengths
  • Have a very good knowledge of MAYA software
  • A good level of English

And appreciated assets

  • Have previous experience as a Layout Artist / Previs on animated films
  • Knowledge of Shotgun
  • Be comfortable with the Linux environment
  • Experience in directing and/or editing.

He/she must be able to make cinematographic proposals while respecting the director's intentions."]

title: newLead Concept Artist
description:
Job reference

m2mkQSQg8UkZ1

Company Name

Sumo Digital Ltd.

Salary

Competitive

Location

Vancouver, Canada

Country

Canada

Industry sector

Animation

Job start date

ASAP

Posted date

08/03/2022

Experience Level

Mid-Senior Level

Job type

Permanent | Full Time

Remote / Hybrid

No




Who are Timbre Games?

Timbre Games are a Vancouver based early-stage game development studio with over 100 years of founding leadership. We believe culture drives creative, where we draw on community and diversity to build truly unique experiences.

Our mission is to build a world class network of Game Studios; to provide accessible awesomeness to our players, to our team, to the world.

Everyone has a story. Come write yours!

Who you are:

As a human, you're a visionary explorer, a pursuer of fun, and focused on building community. You see an opportunity within games to do more and to have more than " just a job". You've had unique experiences both at work and personally that have expanded your curiosities to seek the root of a problem, to seek out issues, and work with people to explore solutions! Your experiences have made you who you are, and that has led to you understanding the importance of diversity in both thinking and in people. Oh, and games... You may like those, too!

Who you are at work:

You lead with humility in all that you do. You showcase passion for your craft through the work you produce and the task-oriented service you give to others. You don't take orders, you push art to higher levels to set the tone of what you're working on. You connect with people through humour and curiosity and these elements make up some of the foundation in your approach to communication.

At Timbre, we take mentoring seriously, and as a lead, we want you to as well. We are here to make amazing games and grow the next generation of game industry people - two goals that are at the heart of who we are.

What impact will you have as a Lead Concept Artist at Timbre


  • You'll prototype and iterate to truly define what the Timbre style is, working on character and environment work
  • Define the tone of what it means to be a Timbre game
  • Create inspirational mood pieces, gameplay and character ideation, sketches and colour key scripts
  • Partner with other Art and Design Timbreoos to help steer initial conceptual direction into compelling visual and game experiences
  • Scope the needs for current and future projects, potentially partnering with outsourced vendors and offsite contractors
  • Collaborate with Production to help create and maintain clear schedules
  • Work closely with Recruitment to improve our recruitment process and bring in value aligned people
  • Onboard and nurture current and future Art teammates, playing a huge role in their development

Your track record might include
  • 7+ years of industry experience as a Concept Artist
  • Previous Senior/Lead experience on a project, setting the tone for a AAA game
  • A portfolio of conceptual design fundamentals and versatility in both rapid ideation, sketching and production paintings
  • Highly skilled communication, both verbally and digitally, to different disciplines within the studio as well as external partners where required
  • Experienced foundational art knowledge in theories of form, value, colour, proportion, anatomy and scale
  • Ability to give as well as embrace constructive feedback
  • Experience in a team where people come first and culture isn't defined by a cheesy poster on the wall


About Timbre Games:

Timbre Games are headed up by industry veterans in beautiful Vancouver, BC. Our experience stretches through mobile to AAA (think Gears of War, the Sims, SSX, FIFA, Age of Empires, among others!). We're excited to build a 'playoff ready' studio that is centered on creativity, humour and diversity. We can't wait to share our first project that we're secretly working away on, and we welcome your application with open arms as we grow a world-class studio here in Canada!

BENEFITS:

  • Competitive salary & benefits

  • Annual bonus & RRSP matching

  • 20 days paid vacation, plus Christmas week off

  • Remote / Work from home / Flexible hours

  • Open door policy with direct access to leadership

  • Industry veterans with a wealth of knowledge to share

Timbre Game's Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Timbre recognizes the importance of creating an environment where all our employees feel included and empowered. We believe that culture drives creative, we value each employee's unique experiences and perspectives across our company and recognize that it is both the smart and right thing to foster diversity, equity, and inclusion within our organization.

By diversifying our workforce, increasing equality, and ensuring that our individual differences are valued, we are better able to deliver an experience that reflects, inspires, and connects with our audience... because games are for everyone!

DO I NEED TO MEET ALL CRITERIA TO APPLY?

Definitely not! If you share our mission of creating games that are accessible for everyone, we'd love to meet you and see what is possible!

If you believe you are who we're looking for, contact us at: work@timbregames.com

Please upload a link to your portfolio/github for us to review if applicable!

#LI-Remote

title: Animation Supervisor
description:
Company Description


As a company founded and run by an artist, it's our mission to provide talented artists with the freedom and resources they need to deliver quality work and to thrive in a fun and creative environment.


Job Description


The Animation Supervisor is responsible for the work that comes out of their department, ensuring their team meets the high quality standards and specifications of the project. Working closely with the VFX Supervisor and CG Supervisor, they establish an approach that accounts for technical challenges, the Rodeo FX pipeline, and which respects the client's creative vision.

They are responsible for ensuring fluid communication with Production and the Animation Artists, as well as delegating appropriate workloads. Acting as an artistic and technical resource, they coach, train and provide feedback to Animation Artists.

Main responsibilities:

  • Work with the Head of Department and the Production team to plan and establish the workflow and methodology that will be applied throughout the project for their specialty, ensuring the best creative and technical approach to meet project requirements, budgets and deadlines;
  • Make recommendations as to potential tool development required and participate in the creation of tools for their speciality. Ensure that tools are tested before their integration and that clear documentation is available;
  • Participate in the casting of artists on projects. In conjunction with Production, assign shots and sequences to artists, taking into account their abilities and level;
  • Communicate the creative vision and objectives to their team, ensuring individual and/or team responsibility for results are understood;
  • Direct the artists in their work throughout the project and closely monitor the quality of work produced. Run dailies sessions, review assets and shots and make sure work follows proper methodology and corresponds with client’s artistic vision;
  • Participate or work on complex shots or sequences;
  • Resolve visual, artistic and technical issues throughout the project, working with other supervisors and/or the CG Supervisor, escalating to the Head of Department as needed;
  • Monitor upcoming milestones and keep the project team informed of the status of work, issues to be resolved, ramifications of problems encountered and potential solutions;
  • Intervene rapidly with team members who do not meet the set objectives, ethics or work methods, by proposing solutions and clarifying expectations. Notify the Head of Department of any repetitive or serious issues;
  • Actively monitor the work climate in the team, ensure the maintenance of a positive work environment and adherence to company values;
  • Communicate any staffing shortages to the Head of Department, as well as any artists who may not have enough work. May assist in finding alternative tasks (training, R&D pipeline tools, etc);
  • Mentor members of their team by providing training and sharing knowledge. Communicate any specific training needs to the Head of Department. May participate in preparing training materials or giving group training sessions;
  • Complete mid & post mortem reviews for the artists on their team. Participate in annual reviews of artists by providing feedback to the Head of Department;
  • May assist the Head of Department with hiring functions (screening and interviewing);
  • May assist the production team with bidding for shows;
  • Maintain up-to-date knowledge of their specialty and be on the lookout for the latest technological advances in methods and approaches.

Qualifications
  • Minimum 7 years of experience in a VFX studio.
  • Excellent knowledge of Maya software;
  • Good knowledge of Shotgun;
  • Excellent knowledge of body mechanics and facial animation;
  • Excellent understanding of the VFX production pipeline;
  • Ability to stay calm under pressure and act as a positive role model and mentor.

Additional Information
  • Full-time, Permanent Contract;
  • 5 paid sick days;
  • 2 additional statutory holidays in the winter holidays;
  • Group Insurance, access to Dialogue online support and to an Employee Assistance Program (EAP);
  • RRSP with employer contribution;
  • Discounts with Bixi, Nautilus Plus and many more local businesses.

Diversity is a core value at Rodeo FX. We are passionate about building and sustaining an inclusive and equitable work environment where diversity is celebrated and valued. We believe every member on our team enriches our work by exposing us to a broad range of ways to perceive and interact with the world, identify challenges, and to design and deliver projects.

title: newOn-Call/ Freelance MAC Artist - The Bay - Anjou
description:
Position Summary

As one of our highly skilled make-up artists you will combine your creative and technical expertise and passion for people to provide a welcoming, inspirational and personalized in-store experience which educates and delights our customers.

You will also like working as part of a high performing team to create impact with in-store events and to ensure that the store always achieves our high standards of visual merchandising to stand out against our competitors.

If you are a dynamic self-starter looking for a progressive career opportunity then this could be the perfect role for you and the first step of your career with a leader in prestige beauty.
While certification in make -up artistry and/or previous retail make up experience is desirable we also welcome applicants with amateur level experience.

As a leader in prestige beauty with a culture that values diversity of thought and people, we offer excellent training and development and a competitive remuneration and benefits package.

Qualifications

Qualifications
While a qualification in make-up artistry/previous retail make up experience is preferred, we welcome applicants with amateur level experience who are able to demonstrate a high level of creative and technical expertise
All applicants must be able to demonstrate the ability to provide inspirational, authentic and personalized customer service
Ability to work retail hours including days, nights, weekends and special events in a fast-paced work environment
Previous experience with retail point-of-sale software
Applicants must be able to provide proof of right to live and work in the country if invited to attend for interview

Job: Retail - Store
Primary Location: CA-QC-Ville d'Anjou
Job Type: Standard
Schedule: Contingent
Shift: On Call
Job Number: 225738

We are an equal opportunity employer. Minorities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities are available on request.

title: Esthetican
description:
As a wellness pioneer, Life Time is reshaping the way consumers approach their health by integrating where we move, work and live – digitally and physically – all with the primary goal of helping people lead healthy, happy lives. Life Time is committed to an inclusive culture that welcomes and respects everyone. We promote an inviting community that supports all people on their path to a healthy way of life.

WE ARE CONFIDENCE. It’s what we offer to every client we help look and feel amazing, and it’s how we exemplify ourselves as a community built on love, loyalty and a healthy way of life. LifeSpa is the largest full-service salon and spa in the nation, and we’re looking for talented artists to join us. What does it mean to join our team? Continued investment in your education, industry-leading compensation, flexible scheduling, a built-in book of leads, an incredible benefits package and free membership to Life Time – including yoga, Pilates and group fitness classes.

Position Summary

The LifeSpa Esthetician provides various skin and facial services and treatments that improves the guest’s overall sense of well-being and enhances the club experience. This includes services such as facials, waxing, eyebrow and eyelash tinting, and make-up application that exceed the guest’s expectations.

Job Duties and Responsibilities

  • Provides individualized skin and facial services and treatments that meet the clients’ needs and expectations
  • Educates clients on LifeSpa and Salon products, services and treatments
  • Discusses options with clients to determine the individual needs of each client
  • Maintains LifeSpa and Salon appearance and cleanliness
  • Serves as an expert in skin analysis and maintenance regimens
  • Promotes all LifeSpa and Salon products, services and treatments
  • Remains current on certifications and new trends in the industry


Position Requirements

  • High School Diploma or GED
  • Esthetician License in state where work is performed
  • Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest and commissions
  • Ability to stand, walk, feel, reach and lift up to 50 pounds

Preferred Requirements

  • 2 years of cosmetology experience
  • 6 months of sales experience
  • Knowledge in Salon Biz software


If you are contacted regarding a job opportunity, please let us know of any accommodations needed to meet your accessibility needs during the recruitment process. Any accommodation information will be treated as confidential and only used for the purpose of enabling you to have an accessible candidate experience.

Life Time is a place for everyone. As an organization, we are committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace that respects and celebrates the unique contributions of each individual while ensuring we remain an equal opportunity employer that recruits, hires, trains and promotes based on merit and qualifications.

title: newLead 3D Environment Artist
description:
Our mission is to craft retro-infused JRPGs that awaken cherished childhood memories. We’re assembling a dream team of talent from across the globe to make this happen. Join us on this epic quest to make fun, narrative-rich games in an inclusive, supportive and fun studio environment!

You’ll be working on Threads of Time, a 2.5D JRPG inspired by Chrono Trigger and Final Fantasy where you get to travel from the pre-historic era to the end of time.

  • Become part of a veteran team that includes legendary developers of the JRPG world
  • 4 weeks paid vacation (1 week of which is taken in late December)
  • Collaborative environment with opportunities to contribute to the game’s creative design and take ownership of features
  • Competitive salary and benefits including medical, dental, vision, and life insurance
  • Opportunities to help you strengthen your skills or learn something new
  • Workplace that appreciates and values diversity and inclusivity
Leadership
  • Juggle creating 3D environments and assets while organizing, planning and leading the environment art team
  • Study, review, validate and supervise the work of Environment Artists to ensure that the environments created respect the artistic vision, meet the needs of the game, meet the technical requirements, achieve the required quality and are fully debugged
  • Define development opportunities for team members and coach them to achieve these goals
  • Provide guidance and mentorship to other artists on your team, as well as reviews and critiques for external artists
Responsibilities
  • Creating 3D environments and assets from concept art and descriptions
  • Bring life and excitement to the game through your design and implementation of high quality, stylized 3D environments and assets
  • Work closely with Art and Creative Directors to ensure that environments and assets match quality bar and vision for the game
  • Help establish and maintain both aesthetic quality and technical performance standards (polycount, memory, draw calls, etc.)
  • Ensure the artistic and technical follow-up of the assets imported into Unreal Engine and make the necessary modifications
  • Propose and establish optimized pipelines for improving quality and time of production
  • Working closely with game designers to create and adjust environments based on gameplay needs
  • Contribute innovative and original ideas toward the game’s visual identity and development
Requirements
  • A minimum of 5 years of experience in 3D modeling/sculpting/texturing
  • Mastery of stylized environment texturing and workflows
  • Excellent proficiency of industry standard DCC applications and procedural texturing tools, such as Maya/3DS Max, Zbrush, Photoshop, Substance Painter and Designer
  • Strong modelling, UV unwrapping, and texturing skills are required
  • Knowledge of the technical constraints relating to real-time, 3D engines, and level editors
  • Your compositional skills and understanding of the fundamentals of art (lighting, composition, colour theory, etc) are of an advanced level
  • Good sense of asset organization and adherence to naming conventions
  • You are known for your excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to take direction well
  • Comfortable with ambiguity and able to drive towards clarity to deliver work on time
  • Shipped at least 1 game title
Pluses
  • Familiarity with Unreal Engine and version control
  • A love of RPG games
  • Resident of Ontario, Canada
This is a full-time remote position. Applicants must reside in Canada.

title: MAC Artist - 12 Hrs- MAC La Capitale - Quebec City, QC
description:
Position Summary
As one of our highly skilled make-up artists you will combine your creative and technical expertise and passion for people to provide a welcoming, inspirational and personalized in-store experience which educates and delights our customers.
You will also like working as part of a high performing team to create impact with in-store events and to ensure that the store always achieves our high standards of visual merchandising to stand out against our competitors.
If you are a dynamic self-starter looking for a progressive career opportunity then this could be the perfect role for you and the first step of your career with a leader in prestige beauty.
While certification in make -up artistry and/or previous retail make up experience is desirable we also welcome applicants with amateur level experience.
As a leader in prestige beauty with a culture that values diversity of thought and people, we offer excellent training and development and a competitive remuneration and benefits package.



Qualifications
Qualifications
  • While a qualification in make-up artistry/previous retail make up experience is preferred, we welcome applicants with amateur level experience who are able to demonstrate a high level of creative and technical expertise
  • All applicants must be able to demonstrate the ability to provide inspirational, authentic and personalized customer service
  • Ability to work retail hours including days, nights, weekends and special events in a fast-paced work environment
  • Previous experience with retail point-of-sale software
  • Applicants must be able to provide proof of right to live and work in the country if invited to attend for interview



Job: Retail - Store
Primary Location: CA-QC-Quebec City
Job Type: Standard
Schedule: Part-time
Shift: Variable
Job Number: 225444

We are an equal opportunity employer. Minorities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities are available on request.

title: Technical Artist -Tools & Pipelines - SKATE
description:
Pour visualiser la description de poste en français, veuillez sélectionner le français ("Select Language") dans le menu déroulant au haut de la page

WE MAKE FUN...FUNNER.

We are Full Circle, and we're all about having fun and making great games that people want to play with their friends. As the developers of Skate™, we are set to deliver an experience that embraces and builds upon everything our community found special about the previous games. We believe in creating an inclusive world inside and outside of our games for our players and our team. As a geo-diverse studio, our team members around the globe can either work from home, in the office or a hybrid of both.

As an experienced Technical Artist - Pipelines and Tools, reporting to Skate's Technical Art Director, you will work in collaboration with content creators and other Technical Artists working on features and content creation techniques.

Responsibilities

  • You will research and explore potential solutions for Content Creation Problems as specified by the Technical Art Director for Tools and Pipelines and create proof-of-concept work in pre-production.
  • Work with Technical Artists, Tools Software Engineers & Rendering Software Engineers to convert prototype content generation solutions into production content generation workflows and tools.
  • Communicate technical requirements for pipelines, workflows, and tools to serve game team product goals.
  • You will partner on inclusion of new pipelines, tools & workflows in tech roadmaps, including engine roadmaps, product tech art roadmaps, and content team workflow roadmaps.
  • Partner in selection of off-the-shelf software and hardware solutions to support the game content creation goals.
  • Stay Current with and exhibit a high degree of technical knowledge about current state-of-the-industry content workflows, tools and pipelines.
  • You will educate our game team on concepts relating to Tools & Pipelines through presentations; Audiences will include members of other disciplines as Art Direction, Engineering, Operations, and Production.

Qualifications
Please note that you do not need to qualify for all requirements to be considered. We encourage you to apply if you can meet most of the requirements and are comfortable opening a dialog to be considered.

  • 5+ Years Experience as a Technical Artist working on Tools and Pipelines.
  • Experience developing tools and pipelines on at least 1-2 shipped console/PC titles.
  • An understanding of architecture for complex tools and pipelines with a focus on content creator (artist/designer) friendly workflows and scalability.
  • Effective at communicating and working with different audiences to partner in technology and tool development: Content Creators, Technical Artists, Tools and Rendering SEs.
  • Experience using and setting up Automation for content/asset processing.
  • Understanding of a wide range of real-time game content and the requirements for these to be efficient and high-quality.
  • A proficiency in at least one of the following languages: C#, Python, C++
  • A willingness to jump into the unknown and solve new problems;
  • Expert knowledge in a few 2D and 3D Art packages and workflows: Maya, Photoshop, Substance, Houdini, Etc. i

Electronic Arts is an innovative tech company that creates incredible experiences for millions of players around the world. But what matters most is our people who inspire us, and the world, to play. As we bring new forms of entertainment to people around the world, we need innovative, collaborative, diverse and adaptable people to keep making Electronic Arts better.

title: Hair Artist / Independent Contractor
description:
If you are an independent hair artist looking for a cute new home to host your clients, keep reading!

ABOUT YOU:

You LOVE to set goals and GROW. Working with a team of other artists keeps you inspired! Staying on task and focused isn't too hard for you when you love what you do. You revel in showing off a clean(stain free), well maintained workspace to all your clients and get excited for a group gab between other salon guests and artists alike. You're the type to help your fellow artist out; whether it's a sweep sweep here, or a sanispray there, you know team work makes the dream work! Client comfort and satisfaction has always been at the forefront of what you do, and you want to be around other artists who feel the same way. You know that a large part of providing the best service possible to your guest, is making the right product recommendations and you feel confident in your ability to do so. You're comfortable with an online booking system and require minimal guidance in navigating social media, booking software and a pos system.

ABOUT US:

We are a Kevin Murphy Session Salon. This means we proudly use and retail cruelty-free, environmentally conscious products. We love to support local businesses by partnering with other (mainly woman owned) small businesses to provide our clients with wonderful, inspiring products and raise awareness of all the amazing local creators we love. Our space has capacity to provide a large range of services, making our space a one stop shop for many guests. We love animals, the environment, our community, and of course, all things BEAUTY.

Our artists are committed to:

  • Letting go of ego, fear and/or any blocks around their growth.
  • Continuing their lifelong learning, both within the salon and in their personal time.
  • Staying creative and seeking inspiration, both for their own art and to share positivity with their fellow artists and guests.
  • Setting monthly, quarterly and yearly smart goals; and will be responsible for checking in and ensuring their following through.
  • Learning and honoring all salon policies. (mental health, inclusion, health and safety, and education policy, etc.)
  • Taking risks, in the name of their growth.
  • Supporting the team and the salon brand, through social media, in salon and in all things they do.
  • Respect the salon space, by completing my opening, closing, sanitation and cleaning duties.

REQUIREMENTS:

In order to join our team of independent artists, you'll need to provide copies of the following:

  • Business License
  • Business Insurance
  • Certificate of Qualification
  • BeautySafe or Preempt Certification

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Demonstrate personal accountability and effective work habits
  • Time management
  • Collaborate well with fellow artists.
  • Provide reliable client services.
  • Maintain sanitation between each guest.
  • Book appointments and cash clients out.
  • Offer product recommendations.
  • Maintain your own social media pages and regularly share images/videos of your work with the salon (for marketing purposes and newsletters).
  • Learn and review policies and procedures regularly.

In addition, our team works together to maintain our beautiful salon. Some tasks our team shares are as follows:

  • Sweeping and mopping common spaces
  • Folding towels
  • Regular sanitation of all common areas (doors, light switches, bathroom, retail)
  • Keeping our snack bar stocked and clean (washing all dishes before leaving for the night, wiping down counters, removing all personal food containers from fridge)
  • Dusting around windows

THE DEAL:

Independent artists are paid up to 20% commission on their retail sales, this includes all collabs with local vendors.


Rental Rates:

Hair Chair 4 days a week : 1100 /month


Additional fees:


Color fee is pay-per-use and charged directly to your client and paid to the salon through the point of sale.

7$ Backbar fee is applied to cutting and coloring services and will automatically be deducted from your monthly revenue. (excludes bang trims, clipper cuts, or braiding).

(Back bar fees cover the cost of washes, rinses, styling products, towels, capes, extension removers and solvents)

Signing bonus: We know how scary moving your guests to a new home can be, and we want to ease this transition for you! For the first two months at Ten Fifteen Beauty we will reduce your rent to $600.

title: 3D Lighting Artist
description:
At Bardel, our greatest asset is our people. The 3D Lighting Artist works under the Lighting Lead and CG Supervisor. The artist is responsible for lighting, compositing and troubleshooting shots for TV & animated films, interpreting the color keys, and creating a 3D representation that reflects the original intent of the designer and director.
What you will be doing:

  • Light and Render CG Shots
  • Create and modify lighting scenes in Katana
  • Set up AOV's in Renderman
  • Ensure continuity across the shots in a sequence
  • Working with the supervisors and the leads to achieve the correct visual in Compositing
  • Comp shots to achieve the final look in Nuke.
  • Being able to project matte painting on cards or geometry in Nuke
  • Work with the Matte Painting Supervisor and understand what's being output by the DMP department and how to use it
  • Optimizes render settings in Renderman for the cleanest and fastest output on the renderfarm
  • Troubleshoot Katana files for technically related issues
  • Communicate problems and show stoppers to the lead or supervisor to get them resolved in a timely fashion
  • Execute the reviews requested by the Supervisor and the Director by showing an analytic and proactive mind
  • Quality Check your render layers to ensure a correct output to compositing
  • Maintain timing and production quotas given by the production coordinator by looking at a Shotgun Dashboard
  • Organize work and prepare dailies for presentation
  • Demonstrates good written and verbal communication, and exhibits a collaborative, supportive approach to working with other team members.
  • Capable of basic python scripting to make simple tasks more automatic
  • Mentor and offer support to less experienced artists. Providing them with guidance and instruction

What you bring with you:

  • Minimum 2+ years of working experience as a 3D Lighting Artist, in a film production environment / animation TV series or visual effects
  • Great Knowledge of Renderman, 3Dlite or Vray
  • Great Knowledge of Foundry* Katana*
  • Great Knowledge of Foundry Nuke
  • Keen eye to detail and knowledge of how the light works in the real world
  • Photography skills are a plus
  • Python Scripting knowledge is a plus
  • Bachelor of Fine Arts or CGI related Diploma is a plus

Why work at Bardel?
We've got great people here, and for good reasons. Bardel offers a generous benefit package, regular social events and ongoing development opportunities for employees to advance their careers through work on prominent and exciting industry projects. You will collaborate with other influential, career-minded creative professionals from around the world, and have the opportunity to grow in your career.
What we want to see in your application:
Tell us why YOU are the person for the position and how you meet the position's criteria. Forward us your current resume and samples of your work (eg. a link to your website or reel – don't hesitate to show off a little!).

How to apply:
Please apply below in this form or visit our Job Portal to apply.

Thank YOU!

  • All candidates must be BC residents and entitled to work in Canada. Those candidates applying outside of the province, must be willing to relocate to BC.

Job Types: Contract, Permanent
