title: Tech Artist
description:
Playtika Montreal is looking for a Tech Artist in a full-time position, to help us build highly engaging mobile apps with rich brand identities.
Are you passionate about art and technically savvy? Do you feel like your work is more impactful when working directly within the project? Do people tend to go to you to resolve technical issues? If so, this position is the opportunity for a tech artist who enjoy being the bridge between artists and programmers.
The Technical Artist position is part of the Art Department, report to the Lead Technical Artist and work with the Art and R&D teams in the studio.

Requirements:

As our ideal candidate, you need:

  • Minimum of 1 years of experience in the video game industry
  • Experience with Unity
  • The ability to customize and optimize art assets
  • Possession of Unity optimization and analysis tools
  • Be familiar with Unity UI and working with multiple aspect ratios
  • Understanding unity’s technical constraints
  • Collaboration mindset: As described above, this strategic position requires constant interaction with different teams.
  • Willingness to perfect and expand their skillset.

It’s a bonus if you have:

  • Basic knowledge with C#
  • Editor Scripting
  • DOTween
  • Visual scripting
  • Basic knowledge of After Effects
  • Experience in 3D (3DS Max, Blender, Maya)
  • Experience with Animation and VFX
  • Experience with Atlassian, Miro, and Monday.com

-

Playtika Montréal est à la recherche d’un(e) artiste technique pour un poste à temps plein. Le ou la titulaire du poste participera à la création d’applications mobiles attrayantes aux identités de marque riches.
Les arts et la technologie vous passionnent? Vous sentez que votre travail a une plus grande incidence lorsque vous faites partie intégrante du projet? Les gens ont tendance à vous consulter pour résoudre des problèmes techniques? Ce poste est l’occasion pour de faire le pont entre les artistes et les programmeurs.
L’artiste technique fait partie du service des arts, relève de l’artiste technique principal(e) et collabore avec les équipes artistiques et de recherche et développement du studio.
Généralités

  • Lire et comprendre les documents d’exigences relatives au produit.
  • Consulter JIRA quotidiennement pour être au fait des objectifs en matière de sprints.
  • Récolter et intégrer les actifs finaux conformément à la maquette incluse dans JIRA.
  • Créer des demandes d’extraction pour la validation des engagements.
  • Corriger les bogues liés aux éléments artistiques.
  • Transmettre des connaissances et apprendre de nouvelles technologies pour améliorer notre environnement.
  • Ajouter de l’information sur le WIKI Tech-Art au besoin.
  • Automatiser les tâches répétitives et participer à la création de modèles.

Flux de travail
Consulter JIRA:

  • Être au fait des tâches qui vous sont assignées.
  • Évaluer toutes vos tâches et pour vous assurer qu’elles s’intègrent à vos sprints.

Commencer une tâche

  • Marquer la tâche comme « en cours » et commencer à y travailler.
  • Créer une requête de triage pour chaque tâche.
  • Assigner la tâche à l’assurance qualité (AQ) une fois la requête de triage fusionnée (« Résolu par l’AQ » ou « Prêt pour l’AQ »).

Processus de travail

  • Intégrer des boîtes grises et des espaces réservés pour soutenir les développeurs et éviter les dépendances.
  • Intégrer des actifs artistiques au projet en créant des atlas d’images.
  • Mettre à l’essai et examiner l’intégration résultante dans le moteur du jeu et les appareils cibles, au besoin.
  • Suivre les changements et optimiser les actifs artistiques autant que possible à l’aide d’outils moteurs (Profiler, Frame Debugger, etc.) :
  • IPS des appareils cibles;
  • Appels de tirage;
  • Mémoire;
  • Débit de remplissage;
  • Performance globale;
  • Taille de l’image;
  • Suivi de la taille de la version dans TeamCity.

*
Réduire la taille des images et des atlas dans la mesure du possible tout en maintenant une qualité acceptable.

  • Créer des effets de police et de matériaux.
  • Créer des animations et des effets spéciaux aussi conformes que possible aux concepts approuvés.

LiveOps

  • Discuter avec les développeurs et l’équipe LiveOps et s’assurer que les actifs artistiques sont correctement intégrés pour faciliter les futures mises à jour.
  • Fournir de la documentation à l’équipe LiveOps pour s’assurer qu’elle peut mettre à jour efficacement les fonctionnalités (chemin vers les documents Photoshop, recadrages, etc.).

Responsabilités

  • Faire le pont entre programmeurs et les artistes.
  • Intégrer les actifs et s’assurer qu’ils correspondent au concept.
  • Créer des effets visuels et des animations.
  • Signaler aux artistes tout problème technique que les fonctionnalités pourraient présenter dès qu’il est cerné afin que les changements appropriés puissent être apportés.
  • Déboguer et optimiser le projet.
  • Collaborer avec plusieurs équipes.

Exigences
Le(la) candidat(e) idéal(e) répond aux critères suivants :

  • Posséder au moins un an d’expérience dans l’industrie du jeu vidéo.
  • Avoir de l’expérience avec Unity.
  • Être capable de personnaliser et d’optimiser les actifs artistiques.
  • Disposer des outils d’analyse et d’optimisation Unity.
  • Connaître l’interface utilisateur Unity et travailler avec des facteurs de forme multiples.
  • Comprendre les contraintes techniques d’Unity.
  • Adopter une approche collaborative : comme il est mentionné précédemment, le ou la titulaire de ce poste stratégique doit interagir constamment avec de multiples équipes.
  • Démontrer une volonté de perfectionner et d’élargir ses compétences.

Vous êtes un as si vous répondez aux critères suivants

  • Connaissance fondamentale de C#
  • Rédaction de scripts
  • Expérience avec DOTween
  • Programmation de scripts visuels
  • Connaissance de base de After Effects
  • Expérience en modélisation 3D (3ds Max, Blender, Maya)
  • Expérience de l’animation et des effets spéciaux
  • Expérience avec Atlassian, Miro et Monday.com

Business Unit:
Casino Innovation Center

Sub Department:
R&D

Job Family:
Creative - Artist

Website Group:
Creative

Responsibilities:

General

  • Read and understand the PRDs;
  • Consult JIRA on a daily basis to be up-to-date with the sprint goals;
  • Crop and integrate final assets according to the included mockup in JIRA;
  • Create pull requests for commit validation;
  • Fix bugs related to art;
  • Share knowledge and learn new tech to improve our pipeline;
  • Add information on the Tech-Art WIKI when needed.
  • Automate repetitive tasks and assist with the creation of templates.

Workflow:
Consult JIRA:

  • Be aware of the tasks assigned to you;
  • Estimate all your tasks and make sure they fit in your sprint.

Start task:

  • Mark the task as ''In Progress'' and start working on it.
  • Create a PR (Pull Request) for each task.
  • Assign the task to QA when PR is merged. (Resolved to QA or Ready for QA);

Work Process

  • Integrate grey boxing / placeholders assets to support developers and avoid dependencies;
  • Integrate art assets into the project by creating image atlases;
  • Test and review the resulting integration in the game engine and on target devices, whenever necessary;
  • Monitor changes and optimize art assets as much as possible using engine tools (Profiler, Frame Debugger, etc.):
  • Target device FPS;
  • Draw calls;
  • Memory;
  • Overdraw;
  • Overall performance;
  • Image size;
  • Monitor build size through TeamCity.

*
Reduce the size of the images/atlases whenever possible while maintaining an acceptable quality;

  • Create font effects and materials;
  • Create animations and special effects as close as possible to the approved concepts.

LiveOps

  • Discuss with developers/LiveOps team and make sure art assets are properly integrated to facilitate future updates;
  • Provide documentation to the LiveOps team to make sure they can update the feature efficiently (Path to PSDs, crops, etc.).

*_
What you’ll be doing: _*

  • Be the bridge between programmers and artists
  • Integrating assets and ensure they’re matching concept
  • Creating vfx and animation
  • Flag any technical issues that the feature might have to artists as soon as they are located so appropriate changes can be made
  • Debug and optimize the project
  • Working with multiple teams

title: Grooming Artist
description:
Are you a Grooming Artist interested in working with us in our Vancouver studio?! The Grooming Artist will be responsible for giving models the visual surface qualities that make them appear believable. Grooming is part of the Surfacing department. All Surfacing Artists are expected to produce high quality digital texture/surfacing work. This is a fulltime, contract role that reports to the Surfacing Supervisor and Artist Management.

What you'll get to do:

  • Create detailed hair and fur grooms rigs for a wide variety of assets using proprietary tools and/or Houdini
  • Create guide hairs and styling for character grooms, while adhering to technical and organisation standards
  • Create procedural grooms as required for the project, which may include cloth and/or instancing
  • Take direction from the Surfacing Lead and Supervisor, and present solutions or questions to creative or technical issues
  • Participate in reviews as required; be willing to show and discuss work in progress
  • Pro-actively escalate technical issues to Lead, Supervisor or TD's
  • Assume responsibility for ensuring assigned work is produced to appropriate standard quality within the scheduled timeframe and deadline
  • Provide leadership through example – has team spirit, highly motivated, takes initiative, is pro-active, and inspires the same in others
  • Assist with project clean up and archiving on an ongoing basis
  • Follow all department guidelines and common practices
  • Stay up-to-date on technology and the entertainment industry
  • May be asked to create photo-realistic textures, either hand painted or procedural, or sculpting, and UV layout
  • May be asked to build shading networks for photo-realistic (physically plausible) shading

What you bring:

  • 5+ years' experience on feature films, TV and/or animated feature working on high quality Surfacing with a focus on Grooming (preferably on photo-realistic assets)
  • Proficiency demonstrated through past project work and/or reel/portfolio
  • Production experience with grooming, hair/fur or instancing tools – preferably in Houdini
  • Knowledge of node-based procedural grooming
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Production experience in Maya and preferably Mari
  • Experience in a modern raytracing package
  • A passion for making beautiful looking photo-realistic hard surface cg objects by combining strong visual and technical skills
  • Strong written and verbal English language skills
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to efficiently organise and prioritise work across multiple areas
  • Excellence in problem solving and balancing quick turnaround with long term quality
  • Ability to work solo as well as collaboratively within a team environment
  • Ability to take direction and feedback and apply this to assets or shots

The following would be considered a bonus:

  • Experience in shading, texturing and look dev
  • Production experience with node-based procedural shading
  • Production experience with Substance Designer/Painter
  • An understanding of lighting and colour theory in feature film production
  • Sculpting experience – preferably with Mudbox
  • Experience scripting in Python
  • Experience with Nuke and Houdini
  • Completed education in a relevant field

VFX Artist in Montreal

Are you a VFX artist with an affinity for making eye-catching particle systems? Do you love music and want to help shape a beautiful visual experience for music lovers worldwide?

You’ll be joining a studio that is creating the future of the music industry through unique immersive social experiences and virtual reality. It’s an exciting time to join a growing company and work with world renowned artists!

VFX Artist Responsibilities:

Take personal responsibility for producing a wide range of particle effects using Niagara

Carry out R&D to maximise the effectiveness of the VFX tools being used

Oversee the VFX pipeline and contribute as needed

Work with the technical specifications provided to create appropriate visual effects

Requirements for this role in Montreal:

3 or more years of experience as a VFX using Real-Time

2 or more years of professional experience using Unreal Engine 4

Experience with Cascade or similar to create particle effects and with softwares such as Nuke, Fume and Realflow with your particle systems

Background of work using Niagara

Experience optimising a range of particle systems, materials and logic

Good knowledge of the whole game development process

Are you up for the challenge? Contact jm@skillsearch.com for more information.

Please be aware that while we would love to respond to every application we receive, due to high numbers we cannot guarantee this. We do however appreciate any time you invest into the application and will make sure to get in touch should anything in future more closely fit your skillset.

title: Surfacing Artist
description:
Are you a talented Surfacing Artist interested in working with us on our upcoming animated feature in Vancouver?

Surfacing Artists at Animal Logic are responsible for giving models the visual surface qualities that make them appear believable.

Surfacing at Animal Logic Vancouver can encompass texture painting, procedural texturing, building shading networks, grooming and occasional sculpting or UV layout, on animated feature films.

What you'll get to do:

  • Create high quality stylized (or occasionally photo-realistic) textures, either hand painted or procedural, to a level of detail necessary for production assets
  • Create stylized or photo-realistic shading, depending on project requirements
  • Create manual or procedural grooms as required, depending on the project and your area of focus
  • Take direction from the Surfacing Lead, and present solutions or questions to pro-actively improve asset quality
  • Share knowledge and communicate openly with other artists on your team
  • Pro-actively escalate technical issues to more senior artists or your Lead
  • Participate in reviews as required
  • Assist with resource management and project clean up on an ongoing basis

What you bring:

  • 3+ years' experience on feature films (vfx), animated features, or high-end episodics
  • Past experience, demonstrated via reel, of feature animation quality texturing, shading and surfacing (preferably on photo-realistic material)
  • Experience with node-based procedural shading
  • Experience with grooming, hair/fur or instancing tools
  • Production experience in Houdini (or Maya), and with a modern raytracing package
  • Production experience in Mari
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • A passion for making beautiful looking cg assets by combining strong visual and technical skills
  • Excellence in problem solving, and balancing quick turnaround with long term quality
  • Strong communication skills, and the ability to efficiently organise and prioritise work across multiple areas
  • Ability to work solo as well as collaboratively within a team environment
  • Ability to take direction and feedback and apply this to assets or shots; be willing to show WIP and take feedback

Bonus Skills:

  • Houdini production experience is a clear bonus
  • An interest in technical surfacing and proceduralism, and/or technical troubleshooting
  • Experience with Substance Designer
  • An understanding of lighting and colour theory in feature film production
  • Sculpting experience (preferably with Mudbox)
  • Experience scripting in Python
  • Experience with Nuke
  • Advanced degree or significant training in at least one or more of the following disciplines: computer graphics, computer science, digital media, filmmaking, photography, graphic design / illustration, foundation arts (drawing, painting, sculpture)

title: CG Supervisor
description:
POSITION PURPOSE


The CG Supervisor is essential to the final delivery of high quality digital effects for our clients. The CG Supervisor will work in partnership with the VFX Supervisor to ensure the creative and technical visions of our clients are realized. The CG Supervisor will familiarize themselves with all aspects of the show, the capabilities of Image Engine’s existing tools and capabilities of the team to assess what will be required to deliver exceptional quality work for our clients.


In addition, they will identify gaps in abilities and work with the R&D and Pipeline Teams to spec tools or methodologies to ensure our Artists can complete the brief. They will work with the VFX Supervisor and Producer to assess all needs during the pre-production schedule and ensure that they have the appropriate staff and workflow capabilities to get the job done.


In contrast to the VFX Supervisor who acts as the client facing creative Supervisor, the CG Supervisor will act as the internal facing technical Supervisor. They will provide supervision and support to various teams of artists/developers as well as delegate to department Leads/Supervisors. The CG Supervisor will provide both creative and technical problem solving approaches to their work.


The CG Supervisor will also contribute to the overall operation and improvement of Image Engine by setting and maintain Image Engine standards. This will include, but will not be limited to engaging in cross-department communication or training, keeping abreast of new technologies, documentation, taking part in interviews and participating in the buddy system for new employees.


DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES


  • Act as the primary technical leadership on the project
  • Manage the techniques used to generate and edit CG elements from asset creation to final composition
  • Work with Production to determine what information may be required from clients to ensure a smooth show setup and execution
  • Determines technical approaches needed to achieve desired look and behaviors of the production's assets within agreed technical pipeline
  • Work with R&D and Production to define future direction of technology development at Image Engine.
  • Work with pipeline to write, edit, install, and maintain show-specific configuration files and scripts. (Outputs configuration - dailies, videouts, color pipeline etc.)
  • Identifies, defines, prioritizes and oversees the implementation of tools that automate production tasks
  • Set up Workflow Templates (WFTs) at the show level
  • Provide references, recommendations or technical solutions for effective task completion
  • Review scope of work and assign tasks based on artist skills/abilities
  • Utilize effective communication skills to receive client notes and deliver instructions/feedback to the VFX Supervisor and artists
  • Install standardized show-level assets (such as AnimationExtras or MatchMoveExtras)
  • Assist the team in debugging problematic shots and assist in optimizing shots for efficiency
  • Evaluate artist workflow with an eye on improving productivity and automating processes
  • Deliver final shots that are creatively and technically excellent
  • Be actively involved in mentoring juniors throughout productions
  • Builds consensus among technology, creative and production management to create efficiencies
  • Serves as key technical expert on productions

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE


  • A minimum of 5 years CG experience in high-end film
  • 2 years of experience as a Supervisor
  • Is a proven leader in setting direction for a production and for inspiring and motivating production staff
  • Demonstrated experience teaching/mentoring co-workers and assume leadership role
  • Assess and optimize render performance to make optimal use of available renderfarm allocations

SKILLS AND ABILITIES


Technical skills

  • Strong ability in defining a cg strategy for a show considering team and time at disposal
  • Ability to lead and coach your various department leads about said cg technique and approach
  • Expert knowledge of Arnold or of a similar physically-based renderer
  • Proven experience with Maya and Nuke
  • Experience with programming/scripting languages (such as python, etc.) is a plus
  • Strong aptitude for technical workflow challenges such as directory structure, file formats, naming conventions, scripts, automation tools, automated dailies, etc.
  • Thorough understanding of a linear color-space workflow
  • Excellent eye for detail for quality control

Core skills

  • Strong leadership skills. Both in spoken and written form
  • Ability to complete bids; determine the timeframe and scope required for each brief
  • Ability to interface with Production staff about scheduling or resources challenges
  • Ability to troubleshoot and deal with competing priorities. Able to delegate as well
  • Capable of managing a full team of artists and technologists; setting high expectations, and encouraging and supporting the staff when in needs
  • Ability to assess Image Engine resources and talent pool to ensure workflow can be completed
  • Excellent time management and communication skills
  • Excellent problem solver who can focus on detail, while maintaining the whole picture

  • Candidates are required to be based in British Columbia.

title: newTechnical Artist: Animation
description:
Job reference

4706587003

Company Name

Rockstar Games San Diego & Toronto

Salary

Competitive

Location

Oakville, Canada

Country

Canada

Industry sector

Animation

Job start date

ASAP

Posted date

10/03/2022

Experience Level

Junior-Associate

Job type

Permanent | Full Time

Remote / Hybrid

No

At Rockstar Games, we create world-class entertainment experiences.

A career at Rockstar Games is about being part of a team working on some of the most creatively rewarding and ambitious projects to be found in any entertainment medium. You would be welcomed to a dedicated and inclusive environment where you can learn, and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.

Rockstar Games is looking for an experienced and passionate Technical Artist focused on Animation to help research and develop new technology for future titles as well as improve on existing technology and tools. This role will involve the development of new approaches and workflows within the scope of animation including core animation as well as facial motion capture (facial animation, tracking, and recognition). A person taking on this role will also be involved in improving pipelines currently in place as well as managing workflows for the very large number of files and assets that make up our games.

The ideal candidate will have at least 2 years of game or VFX industry experience in a similar role working in at least one of the typical "industry-standard" DCC packages (such as Motionbuilder or Maya), possessing a good foundation and core knowledge of object-oriented programming, and a strong background working on tools for animation. Bonus points for having a solid foundation in math as well as experience working with a facial motion capture pipeline.

In addition to technical skills, it is important that a candidate holds strong soft skills and can work well in a highly cooperative environment. This position involves working together with many others in different roles and the ability to work collaboratively as a trustworthy member of the team is essential.

WHAT WE DO


  • Collaborate with tech art team(s) to build, maintain, and improve tools across multiple pipelines.
  • Interact closely with gameplay, cinematic, and facial animation teams to support all efforts.
  • Support rigging and animation pipelines, including ongoing investigation to improve facial rig and animation solving solutions.
  • Work alongside animation programmers on developing and improving runtime solutions.
  • Continually innovate while solving technical problems throughout all phases of production.

RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Work closely with animators, automation, and other TAs to create tools and improve pipelines.
  • Help develop and build on the facial animation and recognition pipeline.
  • Manage facial pipeline and be heavily involved in working with face assets from motion capture.
  • Develop automated solutions to help process large amounts of animation data more efficiently.
  • Create production tools to support new pipelines and future tech.
  • Write documentation for pipelines/tools created.
  • Stay current with and research new technology solutions.

QUALIFICATIONS
  • Experience using 3D DCC software (Motionbuilder and/or Maya preferred).
  • Strong programming skills in Python.
  • Familiarity with coding UI using PySide/Qt.
  • Experience creating tools for animators.
  • Enthusiasm for R&D/future tech development.
  • Strong communication, self-management, and organizational skills.
  • Effective time management skills to meet deadlines.

PLUSES (Please note that these are desirable/bonus skills and are not expected when applying to the position.)
  • Experience with facial animation, facial motion capture, and/or facial tracking.
  • Experience using source control software (such as Perforce or Git).
  • Solid foundation in math (specifically 3D math).
  • Strong knowledge of character setup and good rigging standards.
  • C#/C++ programming skills.
  • Experience using MongoDB/SQL.

HOW TO APPLY

Please apply with a resume and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the skills above. If we would like to move forward with your application, a Rockstar recruiter will reach out to you to explain next steps and guide you through the process.

Rockstar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to hiring, promoting, and compensating employees based on their qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities.

If you've got the right skills for the job, we want to hear from you. We encourage applications from all suitable candidates regardless of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, belief, or race.

title: VFX Production Coordinator
description:
PIXOMONDO is an international visual effects company with a global network of facilities in the US, Germany, and Canada. We are recruiting for various positions in our Los Angeles office, where we would like to welcome anyone with the right experience to work in a fresh and challenging environment.

The Production Coordinator’s primary role is scheduling, communication and coordination for a specific group (discipline) of artists (or multiple groups) on any given project. This position reports to the Head of Production as well as the Project (“Show”) Producer and Production Manager. Coordinators are responsible for working with and delegating to the project Production Assistants (if applicable). Each Coordinator usually works closely with their specific group of artists’ Supervisor or Lead in crewing, scheduling, and managing that group’s body of work. Coordinators are central figures on on the show and need to be able to balance multiple needs, projects, and tasks at one time.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Work closely with your Production Manager, Department Supervisors and/or Leads in crewing, casting and scheduling your discipline’s body of work, keeping in mind the overall show schedule, client reviews, bids, and other discipline needs.
  • Establish a process for communicating discipline targets, assignments, and priorities to your artist crew, as well as the overall show crew. This should be daily and/or weekly.
  • Work with your Production Manager to schedule, track, and manage assigned work in Shotgun.
  • Ensure work is on schedule for each department and is meeting internal and external (client) deadlines. Check in with artists on a regular basis regarding workload, targets, needs, etc
  • Set up turnovers with discipline crew. Communicate turnover information to all artists assigned to asset(s) or shot(s).
  • Track client needs, reviews and deliveries to make sure your discipline hits their targets.
  • Serve as key communication liaison between all parties relevant to your work. Provide updates, priorities, reschedules, and status of all shots at any given moment.
  • Anticipate and communicate issues to leadership team(s) to reach solutions in a timely manner.
  • Supervise, delegate to, and train assigned Production Assistant(s).
  • Act as primary point person for organizing dailies/shot reviews throughout the day on behalf of your discipline Supe/Lead. Take notes regarding feedback and decisions made and enter any required information into Shotgun/communicate to all so as to provide updates to all others impacted.
  • Prioritization and escalation of technical support issues.
  • Perform special projects as needed.
  • Communicates with all parties on the project, from Supervisors to Production leadership and peers, to artists.

Education / Experience

  • Two years work experience in production to include strong working knowledge of post production techniques and terminology.

Required Skills / Competencies

  • Proficiency in Macs/PCs including Microsoft Word and Excel. Knowledge of UNIX and familiarity with Shotgun is preferred.
  • Must possess very strong organizational and communication skills and be able to handle a variety of tasks in an efficient manner while meeting deadlines.
  • Attention to detail, follow through and strong communication skills.

title: 3D Lighting Artist - ON
description:
At Mainframe Studios, we’re creators first. We eat creative and technical challenges for breakfast and come back for more. We’ve been doing this for 25+ years, and we’re still going strong. We’re lucky enough to have the best team in the business. From our artists to our technical and production folks, everyone is passionate about collaborating on some kickass projects. We’ve partnered with the biggest names in the business to create a huge library of content. With partners like Mattel, Netflix, DreamWorks, Sony, Silvergate, and Nickelodeon, it's no wonder we’ve established ourselves as a creative force to be reckoned with.
WE WANT YOU (and your mad skills)!
We are looking for Lighting Artists on a current production! Under the guidance of the Lighting Supervisor and/or Leads, on a CG animated film, the Lighting Artist is tasked with lighting shots from start to finish as they evolve from preliminary lighting through final renders.
Responsibilities and Duties

  • Under the leadership of the Lighting Supervisor and/or Leads, the Lighting Artist lights shots/sequences based on the rigs created by the Principal, Lead or Supervisor.
  • Ability to work within the lighting and rendering pipeline and capable of troubleshooting common rendering and lighting technical issues.
  • Interprets and implements notes and feedback form the Supervisor or Lead in a timely and quantitatively acceptable way.
  • Collaborates with Surfacing Team in achieving the desired look and establishing the production design complexity and lighting behavioural consistency as it pertains to characters, props and environments.
  • Collaborates with Effects Artists to test efficacy of the special effects, modifying lighting as necessary.
  • Delivers assignments per project’s schedule.
  • Adheres to digital file management protocols.
  • Aligns and engages with the values of Mainframe: a culture of community, connectivity, creativity and collaboration.
  • Interacts respectfully and professionally with colleagues, staff members and clients.

Qualifications and Skills

  • Degree and/or diploma in fine arts or animation or equivalent experience preferred.
  • 2-3+ years of experience working in a professional environment within their preferred.
  • Ability to hone in on crafting a variety of lighting styles as necessitated by shot/sequences in a given project. Experience in photography is an asset.
  • Strong understanding of principles of lighting (such as choice of light, placement of the light source, its direction and how to create the desired effect such as contrast and shadows). Knowledge of compositing a plus.
  • Ability to apply knowledge of digital 3D animation, special effects and lighting. A demonstrated understanding of compositing principles and compositing software such as Nuke.
  • Knowledge of Maya and rendering software such as Renderman, Redshift and/or Mentalray. Ability to script is an asset.
  • Maintains up-to-date knowledge in the areas of rendering, lighting, shading and compositing.
  • Ability to communicate ideas clearly and concisely.
  • Open to and encourages feedback and new initiatives. Shares information and techniques with team members.
  • Solid work ethic and positive attitude. Ability to work under pressure. Self motivated and pro-active. Consistently strives to expand knowledge base.
  • Makes decisions in a timely manner. Accepts accountability for own actions. Creatively solves problems, eliminates roadblocks and focuses on issue at hand.
  • Efficient and detail oriented.
  • Strong problem solving skills and ability to work collaboratively.
  • Ability to deliver lighting assignments per agreed upon specs and schedule.

-
Mainframe Studios is an Equal Opportunity Employer, which means we will not discriminate against any individual based on race, colour, sex, national origin, age, religion, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, military or veteran status, disability, or any factors prohibited by applicable law. This policy applies to every aspect of employment at Mainframe Studios, including recruitment, hiring, training, advancement, and termination. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and partners. Should you require accommodation throughout the recruitment process, please let us know your requirements when contacted.

title: newVR Animator / Rigger (Contractor)
description:
Duration: Contract, ongoing

Location: Work from home (remote). Preference given to those living in Canada or Vancouver

Salary: $20~$35 per hour

—

Hello! Metanaut is a small award-winning team of virtual reality enthusiasts who are passionate about building a better future. We’ve been creating VR apps & games for over 5 years now! Our focus is to develop VR experiences that spark a sense of wonder and make a positive impact on the world.

We’re expanding the size of our team to work on a brand new VR experience that will knock your socks off. We’re in the early phases of the project right now so we can’t disclose much but what we can say is: This is the job for you if you want to work on exciting, bleeding edge entertainment that pushes the boundaries of what’s possible in VR. This is a project that can only exist in VR and has never been attempted before, and we’re looking for candidates who have the chops to explore this unknown territory with us!

You’ll be rigging and animating a wide variety of realistically proportioned low poly environments, props, and characters. Successful candidates can replicate realistic and out-of-this-world movements in a Unity-based VR experience.

—

Responsibilities:

  • Implement animation control rigging systems for complex characters and environment props using your software of choice
  • Work with the production team to create the desired animation controls and qualities for objects and characters
  • Troubleshoot animation controls, rigging issues, and make adjustments as necessary throughout the production cycle as they arise
  • Set up rigs for low poly, realistically proportioned 3D models
  • Design, create, and maintain animation rigs for characters and props that are clean, efficient, and animation friendly
  • Proactively give feedback and suggestions to improve the current animation pipeline
  • Maintain a consistent level of productivity while meeting deadlines and producing high quality work
  • Adhere to file management protocols
  • Manage assigned tasks on Trello
  • Participate in 1-on-1 check-in meetings every week
  • Respond to Slack messages within 24 hours
  • Track tasks using Toggl

Requirements:

  • 3+ years of professional experience in animating & rigging 3D models for use in Unity games
  • 1+ years of experience as a freelancer / contractor
  • Excellent understanding of physical motion, weight, balance, form, human & animal anatomy
  • Excellent knowledge in Maya, Blender, or equivalent
  • Bachelor’s degree in Fine Arts, Computer Animation, or other relevant area of study
  • Good knowledge of the game production process and pipeline
  • Disciplined without needing constant supervision in a home environment
  • Ability to multitask, prioritize and manage time efficiently

Nice to haves:

  • Proficiency in drawing and sketching
  • Experience working on a VR game or Unity-based mobile game
  • Experience animating cameras, and a good eye for cinematics
  • Experience with Blender, Python, Mel, C++, and 3dsMax

About Metanaut:

Metanaut is one of the first VR studios in Canada, and has won some of the world’s largest VR grants & competitions. Our team has backgrounds in industrial design, engineering, interactive arts, and computer science—which helps us apply proven real-world design principles to unfamiliar virtual worlds.

Our studio is entirely independent and Canadian owned and will forever stay that way. We understand the importance of not sacrificing integrity and ideas for sake of profit.

We split our time between the metaverse and Vancouver, and we want you to join us in the journey!

Benefits:

  • Steady, ongoing work on a multi-year project
  • Possibility of joining our team as a permanent, full-time artist with the following staff benefits:
  • Be part of a close-knit and friendly team!
  • Wear different hats and never be bored of your work
  • Make important decisions that affect the company and our projects
  • 100% coverage of any health-related spending within an allowance that renews every year
  • Work from home
  • 3 weeks of vacation
  • All computer and VR hardware is provided for you
  • Diverse and inclusive team members who care about making the world a better place

To Apply:

Apply with the following:

  • Cover Letter
  • Resume
  • A link to your portfolio
  • Your hourly rate
  • Tell us where you found the job posting
  • Tell us one interesting fact about yourself!

IMPORTANT: We are a Unity-based studio. Candidates who apply but do not have Unity experience will be automatically rejected.

Work Remotely

  • Yes

Job Type: Freelance

Salary: $20.00-$35.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule
  • Work from home

Experience:

  • professional animation & rigging: 3 years (required)
  • freelancer / contractor: 1 year (required)

title: 3D FX Artist - ON
description:
At Mainframe Studios, we’re creators first. We eat creative and technical challenges for breakfast and come back for more. We’ve been doing this for 25+ years, and we’re still going strong. We’re lucky enough to have the best team in the business. From our artists to our technical and production folks, everyone is passionate about collaborating on some kickass projects. We’ve partnered with the biggest names in the business to create a huge library of content. With partners like Mattel, Netflix, DreamWorks, Sony, Silvergate, and Nickelodeon, it's no wonder we’ve established ourselves as a creative force to be reckoned with.

WE WANT YOU (and your mad skills)!

We are looking for talented FX Artists to join our team! Under the leadership of the FX Department Supervisor and/or Leads, on a CG animated series, the FX Artist designs all non-character related animation and/or applies FX animation per the shot’s requirements.

Responsibilities and Duties

  • Applies, completes and works on shots to be used by the FX department.
  • Interprets and implements notes and feedback from the Supervisor or Lead in a timely and qualitatively acceptable way.
  • Collaborates with Lighting and Compositing artists to test efficacy of the special effects, modifying the design/application as necessary.
  • Delivers assignments per project’s schedule.
  • Adheres to digital file management protocols.
  • Interacts respectfully and professionally with colleagues, staff members and clients.
  • Aligns and engages with the values of Mainframe: a culture of community, connectivity, creativity and collaboration.
  • Interacts respectfully with colleagues, staff members and clients.

Qualifications and Skills

  • Degree or diploma in fine arts or animation or equivalent experience is preferred.
  • 2+ years of experience working in a professional environment within their discipline is preferred however not required.
  • Ability to hone in on crafting a variety of FX designs as necessitated by shot/sequences in a given project.
  • Strong artistic vision, sense of design and composition.
  • Intermediate understanding of 3D animation, texturing, modeling, lighting and compositing.
  • Proficiency in using Maya and/or Houdini for particle simulations, expressions, soft body, rigid body, fluids, Bifrost & cloth dynamics.
  • Experience with python, VEX, hscripting, melscripting is an asset.
  • Maintains up-to-date knowledge in the areas of rendering, lighting, shading and compositing.
  • Ability to communicate ideas clearly and concisely. Practices attentive and active listening. Shares information, methodologies and ideas with others. Incorporates feedback and direction received from the Director/Supervisor.
  • Solid work ethic and positive attitude. Ability to work under pressure. Self-motivated and pro-active. Consistently strives to expand knowledge base.
  • Efficient and detail oriented.
  • Makes decisions in a timely manner. Accepts accountability for own actions.
  • Encourages open communication between the team and other departments.
  • Ability to deliver FX assignments per agreed upon specs and schedule.

-

Mainframe Studios is an Equal Opportunity Employer, which means we will not discriminate against any individual based on race, colour, sex, national origin, age, religion, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, military or veteran status, disability, or any factors prohibited by applicable law. This policy applies to every aspect of employment at Mainframe Studios, including recruitment, hiring, training, advancement, and termination. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and partners. Should you require accommodation throughout the recruitment process, please let us know your requirements when contacted.

title: Technical Artist
description:
We are looking for a Technical Artist to join our team in Vancouver! Great opportunity to be part of building the pipeline foundation! A great opportunity for an artist to take a leap to a more technical role.

This is an exciting and rare opportunity to be part of the formative years of a new studio in Vancouver. Our constantly increasing projects range from feature films to commercials. You will be working with artists with a wealth of experience on various productions. We are looking for talented artists who have the drive to keep up and contribute to this quickly growing company.

A Technical Artist is responsible for optimizing the artist's daily tasks. They identify and fix problems as they arise. Assist in the development and technical solutions for an advanced VFX pipeline. They identify and develop software tools that the team needs. Write necessary plugins and scripts for DCC packages. They have a complete understanding of how the VFX production pipeline works.

We offer extended health benefits, flexible hours, and an open creative environment for all our staff.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Meticulous nature with a self-critical eye, and high standards.
  • Strong problem-solving and identifying solutions without guidance
  • Work well under pressure. Excellent time management and work to tight deadlines.
  • Ability to give accurate time estimates for the project completions
  • Team player who excels in a collaborative environment
  • Highly motivated, and be able to work with the entire team/production.
  • Team player who is able to work independently with minimal supervision
  • Mentoring and advancing new junior TDs.
  • Communicate clear and concise
  • Positive attitude and excitement for new challenges in an intense production environment
  • Interview and help select new hires

  • Provide technical advice and support for artists
  • Maintain a professional level of knowledge about current developments regarding tools (Maya/Shotgrid/etc)
  • Provide recommendations and technical solutions
  • Responsible for ensuring the pipeline integrity
  • Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
  • R&D with supervisors to develop new Python tools and workflows and improve existing
  • Research and develop technical tools
  • Collaborate with other TDs and Leads/Supervisors to develop a stronger pipeline
  • Maintain and improve documentation

Education and Experience

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Graphics or a related subject
  • 2+ years experience as an Artist TD
  • 5+ years VFX pipeline or a related industry
  • Strong understanding of the VFX pipeline
  • Proven ability to manage and mentor a team
  • Expert knowledge in Python & Mel
  • Knowledge in Shotgun Desktop & Shotgrid
  • Expert Knowledge of Maya
  • Knowledge of 3d Equalizer, Syntheyes, and Nuke a plus
  • Proficiency with Linux

Why work at Track VFX?

  • Benefits after 3 months! (contracts must be 6 months or longer to be eligible)
  • We pay overtime after 40 hours!
  • Only Matchmove company in North America
  • Training seminars. Provide many in-house tutorials
  • Great clients and ability to work closely with them!
  • Amazing artists and supportive production team
  • Ability to work closely with Supervisors
  • Help make an impact in the future of Matchmove
  • Career Progression
APPLICATION

Please apply once. Only re-apply if your details have recently changed.

title: Compositor (VFX)
description:
Rocket Science is an Emmy nominated boutique visual effects studio collaborating with filmmakers to create stunning visual imagery utilizing artistry, science and technology. Located in Toronto, Canada, notable credits include Eric Kripke’s Emmy nominated superhero series THE BOYS (Amazon), the epic video game adaptation HALO (Paramount +), the BAFTA winning mini-series TITANIC (iTV), six seasons of Naren Shankar’s sci-fi series THE EXPANSE (Amazon), and features such as Neil Jordan’s GRETA (Sidney Kimmel, John Leonetti’s WISH UPON (Broad Green Pictures) and David Cronenberg’s upcoming Cannes release CRIMES OF THE FUTURE.

RSVFX’s current productions include Tim Burton’s WEDNESDAY (Netflix), THE BOYS S3 (Amazon), Steve Blackman’s UMBRELLA ACADEMY S3 (Netflix) and LOCKE AND KEY S3 (Netflix) from Carlton Cuse and Meredith Averill.

Visit us @ rsvfx.com

Responsibilities:

  • Seamlessly integrate 2D, 3D and live action elements with an eye for photorealism and a strong aesthetic sensibility.
  • Solve creative and technical problems under tight deadlines and fast turnaround.
  • Keying; colour grading; tracking; paint; 3D render layer integration, look development, shot finalling.
  • Take direction from Senior Compositor, Compositing Supervisor and VFX Supervisors; execute compositing tasks based on that direction.
  • Determine shot methodology for sequence work.
  • Work within a collaborative team environment.
  • Stay up to date with compositing software and trends.

Qualifications:

  • 3+ years' experience in a live-action VFX Environment.
  • NUKE, Photoshop, Shotgun.
  • Expert understanding of the Nuke 3D environment and projection mapping.
  • Extensive experience with multi pass 3D renders; ability to create a “look”.
  • Firm understanding of colour space and LUTs
  • Knowledge of Maya, Houdini, Mocha, are a plus.
  • A thorough understanding of both feature film and television VFX production pipelines.
  • A strong eye for detail, composition, colour and lighting. An ability to make shots look great.
  • Ability to multitask, prioritize and problem solve in a fast paced environment.
  • A team player with excellent communication skills.

Rocket Science VFX is an equal opportunity company which values diversity in the workplace. We would be happy to accommodate individual needs in keeping with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If you require accommodation in order to participate in our recruitment process, please contact us to make your needs known in advance. We are always interested in meeting artists.

Thank you for your interest in Rocket Science VFX. Please note that only those who meet the requirements will be contacted for an interview. No Phone Call Please. We are always interested in meeting motivated and talented artists.

title: Lead Artiste 3D/Lead 3D Artist
description:
Lead Artiste 3D – Lead 3D Artist


Nous recherchons un Lead artiste 3D qui relèvera du producteur de l’équipe. Le Lead Artiste 3D sera responsable de gérer la création des personnages, des objets et des environnements pour nos applications mobiles. Avec l’utilisation de la méthode agile, il travaillera étroitement avec son équipe et contribuera à faire progresser la vision et l'esthétique des projets en cours. Nous privilégions la diversité, la créativité, la bonne organisation, la motivation et l'esprit d'équipe. Si vous avez les compétences et le désir de réussir, nous souhaitons que vous fassiez parti de cette période de croissance excitante.


Responsabilités :


  • Assurer un haut niveau de fidélité en termes de modélisation de l'environnement, des personnages, de la qualité des textures et de l'optimisation;
  • Résoudre les problèmes et limitations techniques en utilisant des solutions créatives et efficace en termes des ressources;
  • Travailler avec le producteur pour assigner, estimer et prioriser la production des composantes artistiques du projet;
  • Gérer les objectifs de son équipe pour le sprint courant, savoir identifier les problèmes et aider à les résoudre.
  • Être responsable du respect des échéances du projet, des livrables établies et de la gestion des tâches et des objectifs de son équipe;
  • Travailler avec les artistes de l'équipe pour exécuter et maintenir la direction artistique et l'animation en validant les tâches du sprint;
  • Partager les connaissances et l'expérience avec l'équipe et participer à la création d'un environnement de travail positif;
  • Mettre en place une équipe artistique performante, responsable et autonome;
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec le VP créatif pour définir le style visuel du projet;
  • Collaborer avec le gestionnaire de produits pour assurer un développement artistique maximal par rapport au public cible et à l’économie du jeu;
  • Collaborer avec le directeur technique pour développer des stratégies d’intégration d’art;
  • Travaillez en collaboration avec le concepteur de jeu pour s’assurer que l'art produit est conforme avec l’intention de conception du jeu;
  • Collaborer avec l’équipe technique sur des outils et des techniques pour les artistes;
  • Former et recruter les nouveaux membres de l'équipe artistique;
  • Participer activement à l'élaboration des meilleures pratiques, établir des directives de formation sur une base continue pour les artistes du studio;


Pour remplir ce rôle avec efficacité, vous aurez besoin :


  • D’inspirer et de motiver une équipe d’artiste ;
  • Avoir une sensibilité artistique et au niveau « du gameplay » ;
  • Avoir une passion pour les jeux et une bonne compréhension de ce qui rend un jeu visuellement attrayant, intuitif et amusant à jouer;
  • Être en mesure d'établir de bonnes relations de travail avec l'équipe artistique et les autres départements ;
  • Être en mesure de gérer par l’exemple et être un représentant hors pair du management du projet et du studio;
  • Démontrer des aptitudes à bien gérer son stress et à bien gérer et communiquer le changement;
  • Être capable de communiquer clairement avec les cadres supérieurs, les designers de jeu, les programmeurs, les testeurs et le personnel dans leur propre langage;
  • Avoir d'excellentes aptitudes en communication, y compris le tact et la diplomatie ;
  • Avoir une connaissance avancée de la modélisation et animation 3D et connaissance suffisante en illustration 2D et en animation 2D ;
  • Comprendre la technologie utilisée dans le jeu et le développement, ses capacités et ses limites;
  • Avoir une excellente connaissance technique de tous les outils / logiciels utilisés pour produire tous « les assets » artistiques et d’animation ;
  • Avoir une excellente connaissance du pipeline de production d'art en ce qui concerne spécifiquement les aspects artistiques et techniques ;
  • Au moins 2 ans d'expérience dans le développement de jeux vidéo en tant que Lead artiste 3d;
  • Expérience en développement de jeu mobile est un atout.


Lead 3D Artist


We are looking for a Lead 3D Artist, reporting to the Producer, the Lead 3D Artist will help us build amazing characters, props, and environments for ours mobile apps. The Lead 3D Artist will work with the core team to help drive the vision and esthetic forward. We favor diversity, creativity, drive and team spirit. If you’ve got the skills and the desire to succeed, we want you to be a part of this exciting growth period.


Responsibilities:


  • Ensure a high level of fidelity in terms of environment and character modeling, texturing quality, and optimization;
  • Problem solve any technical limitations and issues using creative and resource-efficient solutions;
  • Work with the Producer to breakdown, estimate, prioritize art asset production;
  • Monitor weekly team sprint objectives to raise flags and help resolve them;
  • Be responsible for meeting project deadlines, setting milestones, and managing the team’s weekly tasks and goals;
  • Work with the Artists on the team to execute and maintain the art and animation by validating in progress sprint tasks;
  • Share knowledge and experience with the team and be part of driving a positive work environment;
  • Set up an efficient, empower and autonomous artistic team;
  • Work closely with the Creative VP to establish a project’s visual style;
  • Collaborate with Product Manager to ensure a maximal artistic development vs the targeted audience and the game economy;
  • Collaborate with the technical director to develop art integration strategies;
  • Work alongside the Game Designer to ensure the art properly executes the design intentions;
  • Collaborate with the tech team on tools and techniques for Artists;
  • Train and onboard new art team members;
  • Participate actively in the development of best practices, establish training guidelines on an ongoing basis for the Artists in the studio;


To perform this role efficiently you will need:


  • To inspire and motivate a team of creative talent;
  • To have strong artistic skills and gameplay sensibility;
  • To have a passion for games and a good understanding of what makes a game visually appealing and fun to play;
  • To be able to build good working relationships with the art team and other departments;
  • To be able to lead by example and be an outstanding ambassador of the studio and project management;
  • To be able to manage stress and changes and to communicate those changes effectively;
  • To be able to communicate clearly with senior managers, designers, programmers, testers and other personnel in their own language;
  • To have excellent communication skills, including tact and diplomacy;
  • To have strong knowledge of 3d modelling environment and characters and 3d animation and enough knowledge in 2D illustration and 2D animation;
  • To understand the technology used in gaming and development, the capabilities and the limits;
  • To possess conflict resolution and problem-solving skills;
  • To have excellent technical knowledge of all the tools / software used to produce all the art assets and animation;
  • To have excellent knowledge of the art production pipeline specifically with regards to the artistic and technical aspects;
  • A minimum of 2 years of experience in mobile video game industry development as a Lead 3D Artist;
  • Experience in mobile game development is an asset.

title: SmartStyle Hair Salon Hair Stylist
description:
Overview:


Stylist – SmartStyle

You are an artist. You also don’t like to be limited on what you can do. Where you can go. What you can become.

As a stylist, you also have options – heck, the beauty industry is full of opportunities. That’s part of why you became a stylist. Make sure you invest your talent where you know you will be successful.

When you join the team at SmartStyle, you’ll start making money on day one. Our salons are conveniently located within Walmart stores which means 5,000 people walking by the salon every single day! You will have an endless opportunity to build your business and earn commission on retail sales!

And that’s just the start of the list of “why you should already be here.” There’s also this:
  • Work-life balance with a flexible schedule, including evenings and weekends.
  • Ongoing development opportunities and monthly education topics to keep you on trend with the latest styles and techniques.
  • Product and tool discounts to help maximize your skill and creativity.
  • Clips, cuts, colors, texture, styles, and waxing – you get to do it all.
  • A salon environment with peers who lift each other up.

Make the move to SmartStyle by Regis and take your career further than you thought possible!

SmartStyle is proud to be part of Regis Corporation, the world's largest and leading hair salon company, dedicated to making people look good and feel beautiful. Salons that are part of the Regis Family of brands use Opensalon, our proprietary, online traffic-driving platform.

A current state cosmetology or barber license is required for this position or you must currently be enrolled in school to obtain the required license.
skills: ['Ongoing development opportunities and monthly education topics to keep you on trend with the latest styles and techniques.']

title: newTechnical Artist
description:
Job reference

ZjoYjtkav5jX1_crt:1647259465597

Company Name

Sumo Digital Ltd.

Salary

Competitive

Location

Vancouver, Canada

Country

Canada

Industry sector

Animation

Job start date

ASAP

Posted date

14/03/2022

Experience Level

Junior-Associate

Job type

Permanent | Full Time

Remote / Hybrid

No




Who are Timbre Games?

Timbre Games are a Vancouver based early-stage game development studio with over 100 years of founding leadership. We believe culture drives creative, where we draw on community and diversity to build truly unique experiences.

Our mission is to build a world class network of Game Studios; to provide accessible awesomeness to our players, to our team, to the world.

Everyone has a story. Come write yours!

Who you are:

As a human, you're a visionary explorer, a pursuer of fun, and focused on building community. You see an opportunity within games to do more and to have more than " just a job". You've had unique experiences both at work and personally that have expanded your curiosities to seek the root of a problem, to seek out issues, and work with people to explore solutions! Your experiences have made you who you are, and that has led to you understanding the importance of diversity in both thinking and in people. Oh, and games... You may like those, too!

Who you are at work:

You lead with humility in all that you do. When you have a problem that leaves you scratching your head, you lean in for support from your team and collaborate to solve that problem. You connect with people through humour and curiosity and use that communication style to take high level ideas from others and create what they're thinking! You are excited at being on the cutting edge of technology, bringing products to life and being the voice for Technical Art.



What impact will you have as a Technical Artist at Timbre:


  • Being our first Technical Artist, you'll bring strategy and direction to our Technical Art department as we start integrating assets into our first game
  • Build customizable procedural generation tools within Unreal, that makes the lives of our Art team so much easier!
  • Be the key bridge between Artists and Engineers, understanding their needs to build out unique Timbre solutions
  • Provide recommendations for tools that optimize and improve the creative process
  • Document pipeline and tools development process for now and future Timbre teammates!



Your track record may include:
  • 4+ years of experience working within the creative industries
  • Highly skilled communication, both verbally and digitally, to different disciplines within the studio
  • Deep understanding of 3D art pipeline tools (Maya, Houdini, etc)
  • Past experience building shaders and procedurally generated custom tools
  • Development experience in Python, JavaScript or other scripting languages
  • A beautifully crafted gaming experience!


About Timbre Games:

Timbre Games are headed up by industry veterans in beautiful Vancouver, BC. Our experience stretches through mobile to AAA (think Gears of War, the Sims, SSX, FIFA, Age of Empires, among others!). We're excited to build a 'playoff ready' studio that is centered on creativity, humour and diversity. We can't wait to share our first project that we're secretly working away on, and we welcome your application with open arms as we grow a world-class studio here in Canada!

BENEFITS:

  • Competitive salary & benefits

  • Annual bonus & RRSP matching

  • 20 days paid vacation, plus Christmas week off

  • Remote / Work from home / Flexible hours

  • Open door policy with direct access to leadership

  • Industry veterans with a wealth of knowledge to share

Timbre Game's Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Timbre recognizes the importance of creating an environment where all our employees feel included and empowered. We believe that culture drives creative, we value each employee's unique experiences and perspectives across our company and recognize that it is both the smart and right thing to foster diversity, equity, and inclusion within our organization.

By diversifying our workforce, increasing equality, and ensuring that our individual differences are valued, we are better able to deliver an experience that reflects, inspires, and connects with our audience... because games are for everyone!

DO I NEED TO MEET ALL CRITERIA TO APPLY?

Definitely not! If you share our mission of creating games that are accessible for everyone, we'd love to meet you and see what is possible!

If you believe you are who we're looking for, contact us at: work@timbregames.com

Please upload a link to your portfolio/github for us to review if applicable!

title: BC, VFX Associate Producer
description:
VFX Associate Producer

This position is based in Vancouver. All applicants must reside in the United States or British Columbia/Ontario if applying within Canada.

Zoic Studios is an Award winning VFX company made up of accomplished artists and producers who understand story, process and relationships. Partnership, integrity and enthusiasm are our key founding principles. We have three locations, Los Angeles, New York City and Vancouver, Canada. Recent credits include: Sweet Tooth, Legends of Tomorrow, Stargirl, Superman & Lois and The Haunting of Bly Manor.

"Visual Evolution" is our mission; we invest in constantly improving our technological and studio processes so that our artists can focus on being creative even in the lightning fast paced world of visual effects. We apply these principles to our work on some of the most VFX intensive film and television projects out there. We like a challenge. Do you?

Our Vancouver, BC location is currently seeking an experienced VFX Associate Producer.

The VFX Associate Producer is the co-pilot to the producer and also reports to our HOPs. The position is a combination of coordinator and producer tasks for those tracking into a producer position. Zoic heavily utilizes Shotgun in production, and our Associate Producers will need to be familiar with it coming in.

The ideal candidate will have previous coordination and production management experience, a deep understanding of the VFX pipeline and must work well in a team environment with tight deadlines. The right candidate must be able to handle high-pace and high volume work.

Responsibilities:

  • Schedule preliminary resources and ensure sufficient artists are booked and alert Producer of resource deficiencies
  • Ensure on-set Supervisor has all art department files for upcoming episodes
  • Work with Producer to manage the look development and asset creation
  • Organize all concept art and files, and distribute accordingly
  • Organize requests for onset references and HDRI with Supervisor and On Set Supervisors
  • Work with the Producer to update the Resource Manager weekly with resource requirements
  • Primary responsibility is to ensure client and internal deliveries are met each day
  • Schedule meetings including concept, production and spotting sessions
  • Update Shotgun with bid hours and schedule as required
  • Update budget breakdowns and assignments daily
  • Work with Producer and Leads to establish “battle plan” for each episode and coordinate resources
  • Keep Resource Manager updated with resource schedule revisions and needs
  • Communicate with coordinators to maintain up-to-date information on what each artist is doing at all times. Follow up on tasks and assignments throughout the day as needed
  • Coordinate and prioritize reviews with Creative Director and/or VFX Supervisor
  • Assist with note taking. Make sure notes are distributed properly and entered into Shotgun
  • Ensure Actuals and Projections are updated daily
  • Flag any major issues to Producer and/or HOP
  • Manage and oversee coordinators including making sure they are posting accurate shot versions and caveats
  • Ensure new artists are accustomed to show including pipeline and time billing
  • Work with coordinators to ensure proper files and shot versions are deleted, reference sheets and overcuts are updated for vault
  • Other production related duties and reasonable duties as assigned
  • Leadership and performance management of artists as needed

Requirements:

  • 4 + years of coordination experience on television and/or feature production
  • Production experience with Shotgrid (formerly Shotgun)
  • Experience with Excel and Microsoft Office
  • Organized and highly detail oriented
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Expert relationship building and client management skills
  • Understanding of 3D/2D VFX pipelines
  • Thrives in a fast-paced, creative environment
  • Editing experience is a plus
  • Cinesync or similar dailies session experience
  • Project management experience
  • Artist management experience
  • Budget and script breakdown experience a plus

Additional information

  • Candidates MUST be located in the United States, British Columbia or Ontario. This is a remote (work from home) position.
  • Zoic does not cover relocation costs.
  • This job description contains the basic requirements for the position and is NOT intended to be a complete list of responsibilities; other duties may be assigned.
  • Due to the volume of applications we receive across our different openings we regret that only those selected to interview will be contact.

title: Coordinator, VFX
description:
For over two decades, Ghost VFX has collaborated with the very best to create award-winning, innovative visual effects. With contributions to over 100 feature films, episodics and interactive, we are a full-service, global visual effects house. Our talented and dedicated teams around the world make the impossible, possible, fulfilling the dreams of clients and artists alike. With roughly 150 artists and production professionals, we try every day to produce imagery that quietly speaks for itself.


We are looking for a talented VFX Coordinator to join our dynamic team! Apply now to join us.


VFX Coordinator

Ghost VFX


Responsibilities:

  • Works directly with the VFX Supervision team in a support role, coordinating projects in a fast-paced environment.

  • Track and maintain VFX workflow for revisions, omits, and short-length changes and notify the pertaining team members as needed.

  • Follow up with artists daily to ensure task deliveries remain on schedule, communicate any scheduling changes to appropriate artists, supervisors, and production team.

  • Attend VFX meetings, provide consultation/feedback, and update documents accordingly.

  • Collaborates with VFX Supervisors and artists in order to troubleshoot any complications that may arise.

  • Prepare all necessary reference materials for on-set guidance.

  • Provides administrative support to the VFX team.


Required Skills:

  • Minimum 3-5+ years of experience in a similar role; preferably within the VFX or post-production industry

  • Strong communication, problem-solving, and time management skills

  • Ability to communicate creative and technical thoughts and ideas clearly and effectively


Preferred Skills:

  • Prior experience working in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment

  • Strong understanding of VFX technologies


Education:

  • High School education or equivalent required.

  • BA/BS in applicable field preferred.


Ghost VFX is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

title: Technical Artist
description:
Snowed in Studios is a game development studio based in Ottawa, Canada. As part of Keywords Studios’ engineering service line, we provide programming support to some of the most important and exciting games being made today. You’ll have the chance to make a global impact, working in a studio known for shipping some of the most prestigious household names in gaming.

Employee satisfaction is at the top of our priority list. We understand that you work your best when you’re happy. This is why we were recently recognized as one of the Top 10 Places to Work in Ottawa and one of the Best Places to Work in Canada by gamesindustry.biz!

We are currently looking to add an experienced Technical Artist to our already amazing team. As a “Snowmie” tech artist you will be responsible for developing features & content for our UI/UX production pipeline using scripting/coding, profiling, and multiple tools on a proprietary C++ game engine for a triple-A title.

Using your previous expertise and knowledge you will be the go-to person for integrating the latest tools technologies into the UI workflow, leveraging different UX techniques to their full potential and focusing on what makes an amazing user experience that supports gameplay.

Some of the cool stuff you’ll be doing
  • Maintain and improve the production pipeline and content library.
  • Work directly in a custom C++ game engine and with home-grown C# pipeline tools to create content and implement features for the UX team
  • Build new features and content based on product roadmap
  • Identify and help develop new process flows and tools to optimize the UI/UX pipeline
  • Work directly with UI/UX production artists and developers to help implement their vision
  • Target and address any art-related technical issues
What you’ll bring to the table:
  • Strong understanding of UI/UX production, C# and C++
  • Experience working and communicating with production artists in a mixed PC and Mac environment; experience with Sketch is a major plus
  • The ability to adapt to and innovate with new technologies
  • Ability to create technical documentation on production pipeline and art contents
  • Prior experience in custom C++ based engines and/or Unreal Engine
  • Up to date knowledge of current art techniques and development processes
  • Strong collaborative nature to partner with artists, art directors and developers
  • You’re user-focused, passionate, and innovative
  • Prior experience in UX architecture and workflow
  • Passion for videogames and extensive knowledge of different game genres across all platforms


We want to hear about the cool experience that you bring to the table to help build the gaming industry in Ottawa. We want to hear from you!

What’s in it for you?
  • The chance to work in triple-A, in a no-crunch modern studio with a relaxed atmosphere and a variety of work
  • Comprehensive benefits package that covers Dental Care, Health Care (including out of country coverage), Vision Care, Long Term Disability, Physio, Massage etc.
  • Generous leave policies including 3 weeks paid vacation (plus 1 week over the Holiday Season), unlimited sick leave and 2 paid personal days. We also provide parental leave top-up and an Employee and Family Assistance Plan that offer 24/7 free and confidential help with your physical and mental health.
  • RRSP Matching and Employee Stock Purchase Programs
  • A dynamic and supportive team environment with a range of experience and an amazing culture – we have board game nights, movie, nights, arcade tournaments, and more to help blow off steam and hang out together.
  • The opportunity to build or expand your career the way you want to, in a smaller studio connected to a global studio family
  • A way-cool hoodie!


Snowed In Studios is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environments. Please let us know of any accommodations needed to ensure you have access to a fair and equitable process.

title: newFX Supervisor
description:
Company Description


As a company founded and run by an artist, it's our mission to provide talented artists with the freedom and resources they need to deliver quality work and to thrive in a fun and creative environment.


Job Description


The FX Supervisor is responsible for the work that comes out of their department, ensuring their team meets the high quality standards and specifications of the project. Working closely with the VFX Supervisor and CG Supervisor, they establish an approach that accounts for technical challenges, the Rodeo FX pipeline, and which respects the client's creative vision.

They are responsible for ensuring fluid communication with Production and the FX Artists, as well as delegating appropriate workloads. Acting as an artistic and technical resource, they coach, train and provide feedback to FX Artists.

Main responsibilities:

  • Work with the Head of Department and the Production team to plan and establish the workflow and methodology that will be applied throughout the project for their specialty, ensuring the best creative and technical approach to meet project requirements, budgets and deadlines;
  • Make recommendations as to potential tool development required and participate in the creation of tools for their speciality. Ensure that tools are tested before their integration and that clear documentation is available;
  • Participate in the casting of artists on projects. In conjunction with Production, assign shots and sequences to artists, taking into account their abilities and level;
  • Communicate the creative vision and objectives to their team, ensuring individual and/or team responsibility for results are understood;
  • Direct the artists in their work throughout the project and closely monitor the quality of work produced. Run dailies sessions, review assets and shots and make sure work follows proper methodology and corresponds with client’s artistic vision;
  • Participate or work on complex shots or sequences;
  • Resolve visual, artistic and technical issues throughout the project, working with other supervisors and/or the CG Supervisor, escalating to the Head of Department as needed;
  • Monitor upcoming milestones and keep the project team informed of the status of work, issues to be resolved, ramifications of problems encountered and potential solutions;
  • Intervene rapidly with team members who do not meet the set objectives, ethics or work methods, by proposing solutions and clarifying expectations. Notify the Head of Department of any repetitive or serious issues;
  • Actively monitor the work climate in the team, ensure the maintenance of a positive work environment and adherence to company values;
  • Communicate any staffing shortages to the Head of Department, as well as any artists who may not have enough work. May assist in finding alternative tasks (training, R&D pipeline tools, etc);
  • Mentor members of their team by providing training and sharing knowledge. Communicate any specific training needs to the Head of Department. May participate in preparing training materials or giving group training sessions;
  • Complete mid & post mortem reviews for the artists on their team. Participate in annual reviews of artists by providing feedback to the Head of Department;
  • May assist the Head of Department with hiring functions (screening and interviewing);
  • May assist the production team with bidding for shows;
  • Maintain up-to-date knowledge of their specialty and be on the lookout for the latest technological advances in methods and approaches.

Qualifications
  • Experience in a similar position, within the VFX industry;
  • Knowledge of English and French - should be fluent in one of these languages, functional in the other;
  • Excellent understanding of proceduralism and SideFX Houdini knowledge (sop, flip, pyro, rbd, vellum);
  • Good knowledge of Nuke and Arnold;
  • Good knowledge of Shotgun;
  • Good sense of physics and timing;
  • Excellent understanding of the VFX production pipeline;
  • Ability to stay calm under pressure and act as a positive role model and mentor.

Additional Information
  • Full-time, Permanent Contract;
  • 5 paid sick days;
  • 2 additional statutory holidays in the winter holidays;
  • Group Insurance, access to Dialogue online support and to an Employee Assistance Program (EAP);
  • RRSP with employer contribution;
  • Discounts with Bixi, Nautilus Plus and many more local businesses.

Diversity is a core value at Rodeo FX. We are passionate about building and sustaining an inclusive and equitable work environment where diversity is celebrated and valued. We believe every member on our team enriches our work by exposing us to a broad range of ways to perceive and interact with the world, identify challenges, and to design and deliver projects.
