May assist in finding alternative tasks (training, R&D pipeline tools, etc);']

title: newEnvironment Artist
description:
ABOUT US: Archiact Interactive is a Vancouver-based Virtual and Augmented Reality (VR/AR) Studio that develops new and unique ways for people to play games and interact with each other. We partner with IP holders, large publishers, and tech brands to create and deliver immersive, high-end game experiences across multiple platforms with a special focus on building new tools for cutting edge emerging technology.

OUR GAMES: Recent titles include DOOM 3: VR Edition (on PSVR), FREEDIVER: Triton Down (on PC, PSVR and Oculus Quest), and MARVEL: Dimension of Heroes (a smartphone-powered Superhero experience built for Lenovo Mirage AR). We are currently in the early pre-pro stages of a new and highly innovative AAA project with leading industry partners and are searching for the best and the brightest to help us transform the world of VR and AR game development. Interested? Read on.

OUR VALUES: At Archiact, diversity is developed and directed by our employees. Inclusion is the way we show our commitment to this core value. Diversity in all areas of our workforce helps us build innovative and immersive experiences that are accessible to everyone. From our community to our games, we are committed to respecting the rights and self-determination of all people. Our goal is simple: we seek to build a diverse team, and to nurture a safe, inclusive work environment where our teammates, especially those who are marginalized, can thrive. At Archiact, equity, diversity, and inclusivity is more than a statement, it is a core value which we continually strive to uphold through our words and our actions. We do not see that commitment as a milestone to be passed, but as a constant, ever-evolving process to be actively pursued, reviewed, and improved upon.

*
ROLE OVERVIEW: * This is a permanent position. We are looking for an Environment Artist to join our World team on an incredibly exciting new project. You will be part of a small team of AAA vets who believe that VR’s time is now and want to make the next big VR game event.
We are a Vancouver-based studio but are happy to consider candidates from all over Canada to work remotely. We also offer relocation assistance to foreign workers.
If you are shortlisted, you may be asked to perform an art test.

*
ABOUT YOU: *You enjoy working in a close-knit and collaborative team with a wide range of skill sets. You are a good communicator, well-balanced and inspiring to work with. You understand the basics of making game-ready asset art and are familiar with the latest software and modeling techniques. You live to raise the quality bar and passionately care about game art and how you can contribute to it.

RESPONSIBILITIES: Working closely with the Lead World Artist, you will be responsible for creating props, player items, environments and other elements that make up our game world.

REQUIREMENTS:

*
MUST HAVE: *

  • 2+ years of game dev experience on shipped titles.
  • Proficient with 3D modeling software and able to build low/high poly art assets.
  • A professional portfolio demonstrating the above.
  • Demonstrated above skills and experience with world hero assets like ships, weapons, world assets and foliage (characters and creatures a plus).
  • Proficient in all stages of the development of a game-ready asset (prototyping, modelling, UV-unwrapping, baking, texturing).
  • Experience creating tileable materials.
  • Experience creating and using trim sheet and modular system for the architecture.
  • Familiar with game art best practices with a keen eye on its limitations as well as its future visual potential.
  • A good communicator and fast learner with a passion for improving your art.
  • Experience working in Unreal Engine on a shipped project.
  • A team-player attitude with the ability to collaborate effectively with various stakeholders in a fast-paced environment.

NICE TO HAVE:

  • Game dev experience in VR.
  • Experience working with shaders.
  • Proficient in Z-brush, Substance Designer/Painter, and other like software.
  • Experience working with VR/AR hardware.

BENEFITS & PERKS - WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?:

  • A competitive base salary.
  • Comprehensive extended health and wellness benefits.
  • Generous annual vacation time and sick days.
  • Additional bonus holidays throughout the year.
  • Flexible work schedule and remote working.
  • Relocation assistance for candidates outside of BC, Canada.
  • Fully equipped onsite gym.
  • An opportunity to work on a high-profile IP.
  • The chance to be part of an experienced, high-achieving and fun team.
  • An international and diverse atmosphere.
  • The opportunity to help pave the way for the future of VR/AR gaming

Job Type: Full-time

title: On-Call Beauty Advisor - MAC - Gatineau, QC
description:
*Position Summary
*
As one of our highly skilled make-up artists you will combine your creative and technical expertise and passion for people to provide a welcoming, inspirational and personalized in-store experience which educates and delights our customers.
You will also like working as part of a high performing team to create impact with in-store events and to ensure that the store always achieves our high standards of visual merchandising to stand out against our competitors.
If you are a dynamic self-starter looking for a progressive career opportunity then this could be the perfect role for you and the first step of your career with a leader in prestige beauty.
While certification in make -up artistry and/or previous retail make up experience is desirable we also welcome applicants with amateur level experience.
As a leader in prestige beauty with a culture that values diversity of thought and people, we offer excellent training and development and a competitive remuneration and benefits package.
Qualifications
Qualifications

  • While a qualification in make-up artistry/previous retail make up experience is preferred, we welcome applicants with amateur level experience who are able to demonstrate a high level of creative and technical expertise
  • All applicants must be able to demonstrate the ability to provide inspirational, authentic and personalized customer service
  • Ability to work retail hours including days, nights, weekends and special events in a fast-paced work environment
  • Previous experience with retail point-of-sale software
  • Applicants must be able to provide proof of right to live and work in the country if invited to attend for interview

title: Animation Content Production Coordinator
description:
Company Description


Artist-driven company by nature, it’s our mission to give talented artists the freedom and resources they need to deliver quality work and to thrive in a fun and creative environment.


Job Description


The Production Coordinator is the main level of support for the entire Animation Content production team throughout the course of a project, from pre-production to final delivery.

Main responsibilities:

  • Responsible for tracking artwork, shot/sequence status, artist assignments, and artists’ output;
  • Whenever there are any changes on the status of the script or artwork, update information immediately and share with the team;
  • Understand all relevant project objectives; communicate them to the crew and ensure all production planning is aligned to the objectives;
  • Set and track targets for the week with the Director and Production Manager; make sure artists are clear on their targets;
  • Enter bid days directly into the production tracking system, include the name of the artist currently assigned to the work, the date the assignment started, the expected due date, and the date when their work is approved;
  • Monitor, track and document completion of tasks and artists' progress on a day-to-day basis to ensure their completion within allocated person days and deadlines;
  • Report on quota evaluations and re-project your department’s progress on a weekly basis in concert with the production manager;
  • Anticipate and raise any concerns about targets, deadlines, etc. based on daily artist activity;
  • Evaluate and validate all work with the Directors to make sure they are approved, and notes are distributed to relevant crew;
  • Ensure proper preparation for all meetings and reviews. Record and publish notes from meetings and reviews that accurately reflect action items;
  • Maintain accurate and up to date documentation recording all submissions and communications to and from the studio, director or other relevant third parties;
  • Focus on developing good working relationships with the artists. Being straightforward about deadlines and the overall production schedule is essential in order for artists to be given a chance to complete their assignments on time;
  • When work is subcontracted, act jointly with the production manager on the preparation of the materials required for them to fulfill their services. Act as the contact person for the sub-contracting studio, facilitating all their production needs as quickly as possible;
  • Get the artists joining the team setup by providing creative reference materials;
  • Ensure a conscientious upkeep of ShotGun;
  • Provide guidance, instruction, and mentorship to Production Assistant(s) and Production Intern(s). Assign, delegate, and oversee projects and tasks.

Qualifications
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience in a similar position in feature-animation or short-animation film production or VFX production;
  • Excellent communication skills in English and French, written and spoken;
  • Strong understanding of CG-based workflows and their dependencies;
  • Strategic scheduling experience with an adaptive approach to meeting deadlines;
  • Excellent knowledge of GSuite and Microsoft Office. Strong knowledge of Excel;
  • Strong interpersonal and organizational skills.

Additional Information
  • Full-time, Permanent Contract;
  • 5 paid sick days;
  • 2 additional statutory holidays in the winter holidays;
  • Group Insurance, access to Dialogue online support and to an Employee Assistance Program (EAP);
  • RRSP with employer contribution;
  • Discounts with Bixi, Nautilus Plus and many more local businesses.

Diversity is a core value at Rodeo FX. We are passionate about building and sustaining an inclusive and equitable work environment where diversity is celebrated and valued. We believe every member on our team enriches our work by exposing us to a broad range of ways to perceive and interact with the world, identify challenges, and to design and deliver projects.

title: Assistant Animation Director
description:
Company Description


With a team of more than 500 creative, passionate and innovative talents, Ubisoft Quebec continues to grow and expand. Founded in 2005, the Quebec City studio has carved out a place for itself among the leaders in the video game industry. Involved in several of Ubisoft's flagship franchises, it has acquired solid expertise, positioning it in the development of major AAA games. Involved in the Assassin's Creed franchise since 2010, the Quebec City team has assumed leadership of Assassin's Creed Odyssey, Immortals Fenyx Rising as well as the new crossover stories of Assassin's Creed Odyssey and Valhalla.


Job Description


When you’re an Assistant Animation Director at Ubi QC, your role is centred around inspiration: from the top-down and the bottom-up.

After inspiring the overall animation vision of a game, you define the direction of its characters narratively or in gameplay. And then empower a group of animators to see it through.

Though you communicate a clear direction, you stay open to its evolution, fostering an environment of creative freedom that allows every animator to come up with ideas that fit the feel of the game and enhance its visual identity.

Throughout production, you shift your focus from the micro-details to the big picture, keeping an eye on how everything comes together and holds as a whole. The ultimate goal? A rich, cohesive, immersive world for players to discover.

What you’ll do

  • Help set out the animation direction through research in collaboration with the animation director.
  • Communicate content and quality expectations to your team + connect members to inspirational and relevant visual references and documentation to guide them.
  • Present and explain concepts to artists to connect them to the vision and orient them.
  • Regularly meet with your team to give (and receive) feedback, share suggestions, set benchmarks, find balance between artistic aspects and technical constraints, etc.
  • Team up with other directors to review and validate in-game content to achieve quality + ensure a consistent, unified direction.
  • Carry out hands-on production tasks for a portion of the time.

Human Management

  • Mentor the employees under their responsibility
  • Meet with employees under their responsibility regularly to give them feedback and help them progress
  • Participate in the recruitment of new members of the team and ensure the integration of new employees
  • Develop a culture of sharing and push for continuous improvement within its trade community
  • Address conflict situations and behavioral issues by seeking support from the HR team or the team's production manager as needed
  • Write the annual report and the end-of-project report of the employees under their responsibility and help them identify their growth path
  • Help create a healthy, inclusive and positive work environment and escalate issues that could affect employees or the project as needed.

Qualifications


What you bring

  • Around 5 years of animation experience in the video game industry (or other relevant experience) + 2 years of leadership
  • Knowledge of animation software like Motion Builder, 3DS Max, and Maya
  • Knowledge of game engines (e.g. Unity or Unreal) and their limitations
  • A degree in 3D Animation or Computer Graphics (or related training)
  • Excellent interpersonal and presentation skills
  • Open-mindedness: you’re receptive to new ideas and fresh perspectives
  • Effective cross-departmental communication: you have the know-how to comfortably communicate with all disciplines (programming, design, animation, and so on)
  • The ability to make a vision accessible and ensure that it is well understood by all

Additional Information


What to send our way

  • Your CV, highlighting your experience, education, skills, and any games shipped
  • Feel free to share a portfolio of your best work (attach images or send us a link to your personal website or online portfolio).

Working at Ubisoft means

  • Have access to benefits that make a real difference in your day-to-day life :
  • A hybrid and flexible work mode, 6 weeks of vacation in your first year, an enriched parental leave, a Ubi gym directly in our offices, a complete group insurance program, access to complete Dialogue telemedicine services, an RRSP with a contribution from Ubisoft, an advantageous bonus program, concrete measures to ensure the right to disconnect, the option of working part-time and much more. Click here for all the details.
  • Joining a team of 21,000 Ubisoft employees working across more than 40 locations around the world, are boundby a common mission to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their dedication and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin's Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come;
  • Working for an equal opportunity employer who believes that diversity of backgrounds and perspectives is essential to creating worlds where gamers and their teams can thrive and express themselves. It's about taking on exciting challenges, being at the forefront of cutting-edge technology and being part of the future of entertainment.

title: Esthetician
description:
As a wellness pioneer, Life Time is reshaping the way consumers approach their health by integrating where we move, work and live – digitally and physically – all with the primary goal of helping people lead healthy, happy lives. Life Time is committed to an inclusive culture that welcomes and respects everyone. We promote an inviting community that supports all people on their path to a healthy way of life.

WE ARE CONFIDENCE. It’s what we offer to every client we help look and feel amazing, and it’s how we exemplify ourselves as a community built on love, loyalty and a healthy way of life. LifeSpa is the largest full-service salon and spa in the nation, and we’re looking for talented artists to join us. What does it mean to join our team? Continued investment in your education, industry-leading compensation, flexible scheduling, a built-in book of leads, an incredible benefits package and free membership to Life Time – including yoga, Pilates and group fitness classes.

Position Summary

The LifeSpa Esthetician provides various skin and facial services and treatments that improves the guest’s overall sense of well-being and enhances the club experience. This includes services such as facials, waxing, eyebrow and eyelash tinting, and make-up application that exceed the guest’s expectations.

Job Duties and Responsibilities

  • Provides individualized skin and facial services and treatments that meet the clients’ needs and expectations
  • Educates clients on LifeSpa and Salon products, services and treatments
  • Discusses options with clients to determine the individual needs of each client
  • Maintains LifeSpa and Salon appearance and cleanliness
  • Serves as an expert in skin analysis and maintenance regimens
  • Promotes all LifeSpa and Salon products, services and treatments
  • Remains current on certifications and new trends in the industry


Position Requirements

  • High School Diploma or GED
  • Esthetician License in state where work is performed
  • Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest and commissions
  • Ability to stand, walk, feel, reach and lift up to 50 pounds

Preferred Requirements

  • 2 years of cosmetology experience
  • 6 months of sales experience
  • Knowledge in Salon Biz software


If you are contacted regarding a job opportunity, please let us know of any accommodations needed to meet your accessibility needs during the recruitment process. Any accommodation information will be treated as confidential and only used for the purpose of enabling you to have an accessible candidate experience.

Life Time is a place for everyone. As an organization, we are committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace that respects and celebrates the unique contributions of each individual while ensuring we remain an equal opportunity employer that recruits, hires, trains and promotes based on merit and qualifications.

title: VFX Coordinator
description:
FuseFX has an opening in Vancouver! We have an opportunity at our studio for an experienced and talented VFX Coordinator.

This position supports the VFX Producers and VFX Supervisors in keeping projects operating in an organized and efficient manner. Coordinators are information share points that hold teams together while being able to balance multiple needs, projects and tasks at one time.

FuseFX is an award-winning Visual Effects Studio providing visual effects services for episodic television, feature films, commercials, virtual productions, and VR. Founded in 2006, the company employs 1200+ personnel across ten studio locations and three brands. Our flagship studio is in Los Angeles, CA, with locations in New York City, Vancouver, BC., and Atlanta. Our Montreal, Toronto, and Bogota studios are serviced by FOLKS VFX, who joined FuseFX in 2020. The Adelaide, Australia studio is serviced by Rising Sun Pictures, who joined FuseFX in 2021.

Responsibilities:

  • Assists VFX Producers, Supervisors, Leads and Artists to ensure every project is handled efficiently while maintaining company quality standards.
  • Communicates information between crew and departments quickly and succinctly, while maintaining a positive attitude and professional approach.
  • Pays close attention to details and is thorough in handling project related deliveries.
  • Organizes regular reviews/ dailies, desk rounds.
  • Oversees data movement for projects, ensuring data is accurate and up to date
  • Executes client deliveries with a sharp eye for QC.
  • Tracks artists task progress, ensuring that internal and external targets are met.
  • Anticipate challenges and communicate those to VFX Producers and Supervisors.
  • Takes detailed and comprehensive notes in reviews and meetings; ensures that Nucelus database is up to date.
  • Looks for opportunities to streamline and improve the flow of information between departments.

Traits of a successful VFX Coordinator:

  • Must be a team player that thrives on problem solving.
  • Able to maintain a positive and professional attitude no matter the challenges put in front of them.
  • Previous experience as a VFX PA or coordinator in feature films, TV or commercials (at least 2 years).
  • Experience with shot production tools / software (Shotgun, Filemaker Pro, etc.)
  • Clear communicator, with great problem solving skills and strong initiative
  • Excellent written and verbal skills with a high level of attention to detail.
  • Basic understanding of common file formats and resolutions.
  • Full understanding of the VFX pipeline and workflows.

Nothing in this job description restricts the Company’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. The Company prohibits discrimination in employment against otherwise qualified applicants because of a physical or mental disability and will make reasonable accommodations to enable qualified persons with known disabilities to perform the essential functions of their job consistent with applicable law. The Company will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable law.

title: Intermediate/Senior FX Artist
description:
ABOUT THIS POSITION

Digital Extremes is seeking an experienced Intermediate/Senior FX Artist to join our team. You will be utilizing traditional art training and knowledge of 3D art, design and computer graphics software to build efficient, high quality special effects while keeping in mind technical specifications relating to memory usage and gameplay speed. You will need to have an excellent understanding of what makes real time special effects work in addition to an understanding of game engines, tools, pipelines and development processes. Preferred extras include experience working with Maya, AfterEffects, Houdini, and Photoshop, as well as a thorough knowledge of the game development process. An understanding of scripting languages such as Python or Lua is also an asset.

RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Utilize traditional art training and knowledge of 3D art, design and computer graphics software to build efficient, high quality special effects, keeping in mind technical specifications relating to memory usage and gameplay speed
  • Keep up-to-date with contemporary effects techniques and research new effects technologies and solutions
  • Cooperate closely with art, design, audio and development department to deliver first class visual effects that exceed the state of the art
  • Work under the creative guidance of the Art Director
  • Deliver work on time and according to schedule as prepared by the Art Director
  • Actively participate in the feedback loop including accepting feedback from and providing feedback within the art and level design team as required, staying current on the scope and understanding of the project
  • Multitask effectively, prioritize competing demands, and follow through on details
REQUIREMENTS
  • 2+ years’ previous experience creating high quality VFX for film or video games
  • Excellent understanding of what makes special effects work - particle systems, postprocessing effects and shaders (specular and normal maps)
  • University degree in visual arts with specialization in graphic design, commercial art, graphic communications or cartooning or completion of a college diploma program in graphic arts
  • Understanding of game engines, tools, pipelines and development processes
  • Working knowledge of a commercial 3D package
  • Good communication skills across multiple disciplines; ability to follow direction and to collaborate successfully with others
  • Ability to handle and prioritize multiple tasks, to meet deadlines and to excel under production conditions
  • Strong work ethic, self-direction and artistic vision, dedicated work ethic
  • Have a genuine enthusiasm and interest in video games
ABOUT DIGITAL EXTREMES

Founded in 1993 by James Schmalz, Digital Extremes ranks as one of the world's top independent video game development studios. Originating with the co-creation of Epic Games' multi-million unit selling Unreal® franchise including Unreal and Unreal Tournament, Digital Extremes went on to develop Dark Sector®, BioShock® for the PlayStation®3, the BioShock 2 multiplayer campaign, and The Darkness® II.

The studio has reached its greatest critical and commercial success with the free-to-play action game, Warframe®, boasting a global community of 50 million registered players on PC, PS4™, Xbox One and Nintendo Switch™.

For more information about Digital Extremes, visit www.digitalextremes.com. To sign up for Warframe, visit www.warframe.com.

WHY WORK AT DIGITAL EXTREMES

Our culture is centered on providing great opportunities to our employees so that everyone feels they are making a meaningful impact. Developing new and existing talent is our long-term focus. We are honored that our work environment has been consistently recognized as one of “Canada’s Top 100 Employers”. We summon you to join our elite team!

The rewards of a career with Digital Extremes include:
  • Competitive salary with bonus opportunities
  • Excellent benefits and paid time off
  • Matching RRSP plan
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Virtual access to Dialogue, our mental wellness and healthcare services app
  • Professional development and career support
  • Work-life balance fitness subsidies
  • Employee recognition program to celebrate personal success through an online platform
  • Be part of “Giving Back” through a multitude of fundraising venues at DE
  • Virtual events such as team building exercises, Games night, Live band performances, Adult and separate children’s holiday and summer parties for global teams!
JOIN US

Digital Extremes is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment process. We thank you for your interest, however, only those candidates selected for the next steps in the hiring process will be contacted.

title: Director, Product Management, Visual Effects
description:
The opportunity

Millions of creators harness Unity to reach billions of players and consumers. Unity is accelerating the development and investment in tools and features for Artists, with products such as Weta Digital Tools, Ziva Dynamics, SpeedTree, ArtEngine, and more to be announced, to make the entire process of crafting real-time, interactive graphics, content, and experiences more intuitive and accessible to creators and artists.

As a Director of Product Management within our Professional Artistry team, you will lead a team responsible for delivering a major part of Unity's solutions for artists. You will work across multiple teams within Unity to influence and implement strategy and decisions while balancing needs and commonalities across multiple services and product lines.

In this role, manage a group of Product Managers who drive the strategic direction of products and services within the Professional Artistry team, as well as the roadmap and development of features for creators to connect, share, and collaborate. You and your team will work closely with product leaders in other areas within Unity and with engineers, designers, marketers, and other Product Managers to understand the target audience and drive products and systems to support interoperability with open standards while delivering an outstanding user experience.

What you'll be doing

  • Develop Go-to-Market strategies with clear plans, critical metrics, and methods for tracking success and risks!
  • Work with industry professionals to build product insight and feedback, as well as staying up to date with industry trends
  • Collaborate with engineering teams to define solutions to the problems users face, and validate these ideas throughout the development process.
  • Collaborating with other teams across Unity to craft and improve Unity's overall product strategy
  • Communicate successes and challenges upwards and outwards throughout the entire product lifecycle

What we're looking for

  • Experience leading product managers to deliver interconnected products and services that provide an excellent user experience and workflow
  • Strong product management skills related to user research, roadmap development, cross-organizational and cross-functional alignment, and go-to-market activities
  • Strong capabilities in collaboration and driving alignment across teams who may have differing goals and priorities
  • Comfort in communicating your strategy and goals with third-party vendors, partners, and internal teams
  • Strong focus on user first, with proven experience in simplifying sophisticated technologies into simple workflows
  • Outstanding interpersonal skills and ability to work collaboratively with other product and functional teams

You might also have

  • Experience navigating major new technology shifts or transitions
  • Experience with compute and storage-intensive cloud applications
  • Technical knowledge applicable to cloud platforms and SaaS
  • Knowledge of Unity engine, editor, and platform

Life at Unity

Unity (NYSE: U) is the world's leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity is the foundation upon which the world's most powerful digital content is created. Specifically, Unity's platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices.

In the fourth quarter of 2021, Unity had, on average, 3.9 billion monthly active end users who consumed content created or operated with its solutions. The applications developed by these creators were downloaded, on average, five billion times per month in 2021. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.

Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations or accommodations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

title: PT Clinique Beauty Advisor
description:
LocationEDMONTON,Alberta,Canada
CategoryStores
Job OpenedFebruary 11th, 2022
EducationHigh School Diploma/GED
Job Number220000XM
Job TypePart-Time w/o Benefits
RemoteNo

job description

What This Position is All About
You are a friendly, customer-focused individual who understands the importance of always being ready to serve the customer. You are a team player who has earned the respect of your peers through commitment, partnership and effective communication. You organize and prioritize your workload in a way that always puts the customer first and delivers the operational standards that are required. In a dynamic fast-paced environment you are self-motivated, adaptable and decisive ensuring the best outcome for the customer and the business.
Who You Are:
  • Acts with customers in mind, great networking and relationship management.
  • Puts the needs of internal and external customers first. Seeks customer information when improving products and services.
  • Often goes above and beyond their goals. Is consistently a top performer and elevates the performance of others
  • Sees ahead clearly, is knowledgeable and has a capability for a big picture perspective.
You Also Have:
  • Knowledge of skin/body care treatments with 2-5 years of work experience in Cosmetics
  • Certified Make-up Artist
  • Must have experience in a commission and clientele selling environment
  • Full flexibility with schedule (including evenings and weekends)
As The Counter Manager of Cosmetics, You Will:
  • Analyze business metrics to develop action plans that address opportunities and positively impact the business
  • Build your client base through the Preferred Customer Program
  • Observe staff on the selling floor and their interaction with customers, co-workers and overall customer service level
  • Achieve daily / weekly / monthly sales goals based on the department's goal and are expected to track their sales
  • Deliver World-class service through client communication, product knowledge, fashion direction and solution-based selling at the highest-level
  • Work with Vendor Partners to maximize sales opportunities through suggestive selling, store events / seminars and wardrobe clients
How Often You May Travel:
  • NA
Your Life and Career at HBC:
  • Be part of a world-class team; work with an adventurous spirit; think and act like an owner- operator!
  • Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities, from retail to supply chain, to digital or corporate.
  • A culture that promotes a healthy, fulfilling work/life balance
  • Benefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, vision and dental).
  • An amazing employee discount
Thank you for your interest with HBC. We look forward to reviewing your application.
HBC provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, HBC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
HBC welcomes all applicants for this position. Should you be individually selected to participate in an assessment or selection process, accommodations are available upon request in relation to the materials or processes to be used.

title: Production Designer, RBC Ventures (Ownr)
description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Production Designer, RBC Ventures (Ownr)

Job Description

RBC Ventures is a new kind of business – one that marries the strength of one of the world’s most trusted and successful financial institutions with a mission to reimagine the role we play in people’s lives – to move RBC ‘beyond banking’. We’re building a world-class organization focused on designing exceptional experiences, exploring new business models and creating exponential value. In 2020, we were named by Fast Company as one of the 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators – a distinction that only three Canadian companies received – is proof of our deep commitment to innovation.

One critical component of RBC Ventures is Strategic Design (SD). SD leverages the best people to conduct in-depth consumer research, design extraordinary customer experiences, build memorable and unique brands and effective marketing campaigns, transforming how consumers experience our Ventures and RBC.


About Ownr

Ownr is an RBC Ventures company with the ambitious mission to help entrepreneurial Canadians start, maintain and grow their businesses. We take the difficulty out of registering and maintaining sole-proprietorships and corporations, letting incredible business owners save time and money to focus on what matters — building their business. We’ve already helped start over 50,000 companies, and we’re just getting started. As an RBC Ventures company, we are both a start-up and a part of Canada’s largest bank, enjoying the benefits of each. We chart our own course in developing the technology our clients need, delivering frequently and continually improving our application and pipeline. At the same time, we have direct access to the technical resources, expertise and opportunities of one of the world’s leading financial institutions.


What is the opportunity?

Ownr is hiring a Production Designer to apply branding guidelines to develop marketing assets, and generate creative digital solutions across marketing and product. This person will work directly with marketing, product, and design team members. The ideal candidate is detail oriented, organized, and has strong time management skills.

What will you do?

  • Create marketing assets, including websites, digital and social campaigns, digital publications, videos, illustrations, ebooks, presentation decks and other marketing material
  • Develop and/or leverage existing brand guidelines to prepare and deliver assets
  • Work closely and collaboratively with the ventures product and marketing teams
  • Collaborate with art directors, designers, production artists, and writers to execute campaigns and digital solutions
  • Effectively rationalize and communicate ideas and designs


Must Haves

  • 1-3 years of experience working in digital, design or marketing firms/agencies
  • BA/BS degree in Design (e.g. advertising, interaction, graphic, visual communications, product, industrial) or related field, or the equivalent work experience
  • A portfolio that demonstrates your design skills
  • Strong aesthetic skills and a demonstration of graphic design core principles with respect to typography, layout/composition, photography, iconography, etc.
  • A clear understanding of graphic design core principles with respect to typography, layout/composition, grid systems, colour, photography, iconography, etc.
  • Ability to source authentic, compelling, candid, stock photography
  • Experience with Adobe Creative Suite
  • Ability to embrace feedback and continue to iterate and improve your work
  • Ability to communicate and present rationales
  • Ability to multitask and adapt in a fast paced environment


Nice-to-Haves

  • Experience working in start-up environments
  • Experience in video production, editing and animation
  • Experience in Figma, or a similar tool


What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options

RBC Ventures

VSDESIGN

Due to COVID-19 Guidelines, this role is 100% remote/work from home until further notice. We are closely monitoring the evolving situation and will continue to make the health and safety of our team a top priority.


RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

Job Summary

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

2022-03-24-07:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.

We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

Join our Talent Community

Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

title: VFX Editor
description:
POSITION PURPOSE


VFX Editors at Image Engine play a very important role in the initial setup and continued management of all editorial material, setup and control of internal daily sessions, and quality control of all shot outputs for our clients. VFX Editors are also responsible for all editorial work relating to show demo reels and any additional promotional pieces.


VFX Editors work in conjunction with the Executive Producers and Central Production Manager to ensure all tasks are managed to meet client show delivery requirements. In addition, VFX editors will work with the Marketing Manager to develop demo reels to help promote Image Engine’s work and secure new business. They will ensure that all work completed is brand aligned and highlights the areas of work specified by the Executive Producer/Marketing Manager.


DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES


  • Setting up a show’s editorial components, and working with pipeline/workflow team to ensure correct client show specs are in place
  • Help ingest and setup/process all client editorial material, including client cuts, Avid bins, VFX line-up sheets, plates, CDLs, etc.
  • Set up Shotgun with all editorial related information from client VFX line-ups, such as frame ranges, retimes, and all other client editorial information, then communicate and manage this information for a show’s duration
  • Set up editorial references for artists to match retimes, repositions, and other client editorial vfx indications, and provide additional details where required
  • Update sequences with any changes to the cut from client editorial and clearly communicate these changes to the team
  • Keep cuts updated with latest VFX versions of shots, and create review media of these cuts for team and supervisor review on a regular basis
  • Maintain databases and logs of work progress as required to efficiently track the status of all work and provide easy updates to managers and coordinators
  • QC all shot deliveries to client and other material, such as plates for outsource vendors
  • Setup and run RV for dailies and additional screenings (remote and/or theatre reviews)
  • Create and update demo reels of VFX material for specific needs as assigned by Marketing and Production
  • Other duties and responsibilities consistent with your position as may be assigned to you from time to time

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE


  • Minimum 2 years of film editing experience
  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent technical school certification in film editing or computer graphics, or equivalent work experience (Experience must be in animation, film or digital effects)

SKILLS AND ABILITIES


Technical skills


  • Advanced knowledge of Avid Media Composer
  • Familiarity with RV, Resolve, Nuke, Adobe Premiere (+CS) is an asset
  • Good understanding of Autodesk Shotgun production tracking system
  • Comfortable using Windows, Linux, and Mac operating systems

Core skills

  • Ability to work well in a team environment in a professional manner within tight deadlines
  • Effective troubleshooting skills and ability to deal with competing priorities and projects
  • Able to manage multiple projects and tasks efficiently and accurately
  • Capable of learning new workflows quickly and accurately, and adapting workflows to fit new project needs.
  • Able to make independent decisions and exercise creative judgment in the development of projects
  • Ability to adapt quickly to new technologies and applications
  • Excellent time management and communication skills
  • A passion for editing

  • Candidates are required to be based in British Columbia.

title: Senior Hard Surface Artist (Apex Legends)
description:
Founded in 2010 by the original creators of the Call of Duty Franchise, Respawn was created with the philosophy that when talented people have creative freedom, they'll make extraordinary games that achieve the unexpected. From our roots as an indie studio to joining the expansive roster of studios at Electronic Arts, this remains our guiding principle. We truly love what we do and want to share our passion with players worldwide. Our shipped titles include critically acclaimed multi-platform games Apex Legends, Titanfall, Titanfall 2, Star Wars™ Jedi: Fallen Order and Medal of Honor: Above and Beyond. Join us for the opportunity to create groundbreaking games with some of the best developer talent in the industry.

You can learn more about our studio and values at respawn.com/studio.

Apex Legends is looking for outstanding Senior Hard Surface artists to come join us in fleshing out the Apex Universe. Whether it's experience managing others and owning areas to develop, setting visual targets, or just excelling at environmental storytelling and craft, there could be a role for you!

Responsibilities

  • Hard Surface creation – assets including Weapons, Character kits, Props, and a variety of assets not limited to hard surface modeling for Apex Legends.
  • Works independently – operates effectively with minimal guidance from Art Director (AD) and Lead.
  • Feature Owner – Point of contact for high tier assets, keeping an open line of communication with AD and Lead while working closely with other discipline.
    Task includes rapid prototyping, building proxy, simple animation, proof of concept to name a few.
  • Leading other junior artists for collaborative tasks - running meetings and taking notes, setting goals and task for peers, reviewing and maintain quality.
  • Team support – capable of assisting other team member with challenges such as tech issues, workload support, and other general needs that may come up in a moment notice.
  • Technical support – assist AD and Lead in contributing to quality-of-life improvements for workflows and documentation. Testing new tools and providing feedback.
  • Operating proprietary tools – can work proficiently with in house tools and game engine.
  • Mentors junior and mid-level artist.

Qualifications

  • 8+ years of production experience primarily as a Hard Surface Artist
  • Proficient 3D modelling with emphasis in Hard Surface
  • Have experiences shipping an AAA FPS as a Hard Surface Artist
  • Building asset not just aesthetically but in consideration of design, function, gameplay, and optimization
  • Experiences working in collaboration with other discipline extensively
  • Communicates effectively with Email, Slack, and Zoom
  • Substance Painter and Marmoset for bakes and texture
  • Maya as a primary 3D application
  • Understanding of mechanical design
  • Strong understanding of PBR
  • Comprehensive knowledge of some mainstream or proprietary game engine
  • Proficient in at least a secondary modeling program for high-res modelling such as Blender, Zbrush, 3DS Max, or equivalent

Portfolio Requirements

  • Examples of professional hard surface work
  • Understanding of weapon design and general mechanical designs
  • Bakes, UV layout, Mesh flow


Bonus

  • Rigging and animation
  • Game scripts
  • Lighting and Rendering

Electronic Arts is an innovative tech company that creates incredible experiences for millions of players around the world. But what matters most is our people who inspire us, and the world, to play. As we bring new forms of entertainment to people around the world, we need innovative, collaborative, diverse and adaptable people to keep making Electronic Arts better.

title: Lead Artist / Artiste Principal | 3D Character Artist / Pers...
description:
Title: 3D Lead Character Artist

Level: Project Management

Type: Remote, Home-Working

Location: Anywhere in Canada

We are extensively growing our Global Art Team

The role of Lead Artist is to lead and motivate a team of talented 3D Artists in delivering astounding characters and AAA quality assets. This position entails a great deal of responsibility and opportunity to drive further the development of strong team and for which your artistic, technical and managerial expertise are with great importance. As a 3D Lead Character Artist your job is to plan, organize, follow-up and evaluate their work in order to ensure that they meet the production objectives in terms of time and quality. In this role you are required to anticipate and find solutions on team and production level in order to deliver stunning visual experience of the project.

Requirements

Job Responsibilities

  • Lead artistic team in development of AAA quality characters and assets
  • Participate in the scheduling of his part of the project and maintain planning foresight
  • Maintains effective informational flow to the team to ensure the team members are aligned with the project objectives
  • Provide regular review and feedback on teams work in a clear and constructive manner
  • Encourage creativity and participation from all team members
  • Maintain efficient collaboration between the team members and other dependent teams
  • Achieving the creative vision of the production.
  • Maintain close working relationship with your direct manager, producers, leads, directors and other teams to push project quality
  • Raise the bar for the project by demanding high results from self and team members
  • Actively participate to the constant improvement of work methods and pipelines
  • Share knowledge and recommend best practices in your area of operation
  • Ensure that produced and integrated assets respect the artistic vision of the game and meet the quality standards
  • Creating art while following instructions to support creative production processes and is responsible for producing sketches or artwork, and drawing sketches from different angles
  • Create concept art to enable the visualisation of characters
  • Previous experience of creating art for 3D characters, including the creation of low-poly art, concepting new assets for real-time virtual experiences
  • A passion for virtual reality architecture and a proven understanding of what makes virtual reality visually appealing and how this can affect user experience
  • Really good self-motivation, self-organisation and a personal commitment to succeed
  • Great presentation, influencing and communication skills, so you can explain concepts and user stories with confidence

Qualifications

  • Previous experience as a Senior or Lead Artist in the games industry
  • Passion for games development and strong game culture
  • Experience in the video game industry will be considered an advantage
  • Experience in team leadership and management
  • Excellent knowledge of 2D & 3D software (3DS Max, Zbrush, with excellent knowledge in Photoshop or other equivalent packages)
  • Good knowledge in game engines
  • Strong artistic skills
  • Excellent communication skills and teamwork oriented attitude
  • Problem solving attitude
  • Able to drive change and inspire others to generate new ideas

Benefits

  • Competitive basic salary
  • Excellent Holiday entitlement plus public holidays
  • Dynamic and entrepreneurial culture
  • You get to work with the latest technologies
  • You will be working for one of the worlds leading providers of specialist services to the games industry.

Who we are

PTW is a video games services company which supports video game developers and publishers through outsourced production services. We started 25 years ago and since then, have grown exponentially year-on-year to where we are today. Our history is in gaming, and we are gamers at heart. In our time within the games industry, we have worked on over 1500 titles across all genres and all platforms, including 8 out of the past 10 Game-Of-The-Year-winning titles.

We have grown rapidly over the past few years and now have 35 sites spanning the globe. The PTW umbrella of companies includes 1518 studios, SIDE and Orange Rock. SIDE works at the cutting edge of interactive media as a provider of audio services for the global entertainment market. Orange Rock is our in-house game and product development studio.1518 is our global award-winning art studio.

Welcome to 1518

title: ANIMATEUR.TRICE 3D SÉNIOR/ SENIOR 3D ANIMATOR
description:
Frima, entreprise fièrement québécoise, œuvre dans le développement de jeux vidéo sur différentes plateformes en collaboration avec les plus grands joueurs de l’industrie depuis 2003. Joins-toi à une équipe performante de professionnels qui a l’ambition de toujours exceller auprès de ses partenaires et d’offrir des productions d’une qualité digne des plus grands producteurs de jeux de l’industrie.

Chez Frima, nous cultivons l’audace créative! Avec fierté, nous avons été nommés parmi les meilleurs employeurs de jeux vidéo au Canada en 2021 selon GamesIndustry.biz!

À titre d’animateur 3D, vous êtes responsable de production d’animations 3D destinées au jeu vidéo, incluant les séquences cinématiques et les animations in-games. Vous êtes également chargé de faire le suivi des tâches en lien avec la production artistique sur le projet et de participer à son évaluation. Vous participerez au développement et au maintien de la vision de l’animation en travaillant en étroite collaboration avec la direction artistique, les designers, les artistes, les programmeurs, etc. Vous agirez comme mentor auprès des animateurs de votre équipe en les assistant dans leurs tâches quotidiennes et en les aidant à grandir au sein du studio.

Ce qui comblera vos journées :

  • Créer, prioriser, assigner et suivre régulièrement les tâches et l'avancement du travail sur son projet en ce qui concerne les livrables;
  • Accompagner le lead, lorsque requis, pour la révision, la rétroaction et, la correction des travaux de l'équipe d’animation;
  • Travailler avec les leads et directeurs pour assurer des communications claires et une bonne collaboration entre les métiers;
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les autres animateurs ainsi que les autres corps de métier afin de maximiser le potentiel des animations;
  • Résoudre les problèmes d’ordre créatif et technique au fur et à mesure qu’ils se présentent;
  • Ajuster le niveau de détail et les effets d’animation aux besoins et contraintes techniques du projet;
  • Faire des corrections et des ajustements, lorsque nécessaire, et être capable de donner et de recevoir des commentaires;
  • Faire preuve de créativité et d’adaptation aux différents styles de jeu et styles graphiques;
  • Assurer la qualité, la structure et l’optimisation du contenu et des pratiques d'animation 3D sur son projet;
  • Mentorer les artistes moins expérimentés sur son équipe projet afin de les faire progresser.
  • Soutenir le lead animateur 3D, lorsque requis, dans la gestion du projet;
  • Participer aux appels avec les clients lorsque requis;
  • Agir à titre de personne-ressource pour tous les aspects de l'animation 3D sur son projet, autant à l’interne qu’à l’externe;
  • Analyser et proposer des idées visant la mise en place des meilleures pratiques dans son champ d'expertise ainsi que l’amélioration de sa direction;
  • Participer à l'accueil des nouveaux animateurs 3D sur son projet.

Votre profil ressemble à ceci :

  • Formation collégiale en animation 3D, multimédia ou tout autre domaine pertinent combiné avec une expérience de travail équivalente;
  • Minimum de six (6) ans d’expérience pertinente dans l’industrie du jeu vidéo;
  • Connaissance avancée de tous les aspects de l’animation 3D (physique, animation de personnages, timing, diversité stylistique (réalistes et/ou cartoon), etc.);
  • Connaissance des bases en art et animation traditionnelle 2D;
  • Excellente connaissance de Maya ou 3DS Max, Motion Builder (un atout);
  • Une connaissance en rigging et FX, modélisation (un atout);
  • Expérience avec les engins Unity et Unreal (un atout);
  • Bilinguisme anglais-français.

Ces habiletés vous définissent bien :

  • Aptitude à travailler dans une équipe multidisciplinaire;
  • Aptitudes pour le mentorat;
  • Bonne gestion du temps et respect des échéanciers de production;
  • Bonne culture artistique (jeu, multimédia, cinéma, etc.);
  • Autonomie, débrouillardise, organisation et rigueur;
  • Passion pour le développement de jeux vidéo.

Chez Frima, on s’occupe de notre monde :

  • Environnement de travail reconnu par GamesIndustry.biz comme l’un des meilleurs endroits pour travailler au Canada;
  • Toute la flexibilité grâce à un mode de travail hybride (télétravail et présentiel);
  • Politique de vacances flexible avec possibilité d’aller jusqu’à 7 semaines annuellement;
  • Large gamme d'avantages sociaux (assurance collective complète, télémédecine, épargne collective flexible, journées de maladie, journées personnelles, horaire flexible, programme d'aide aux employés et à la famille);
  • Programme de mobilité (laissez-passer mensuel RTC, allocation de stationnement, abonnement à Communauto, stationnement intérieur pour vélo);
  • Frima santé (allocation pour achat d’équipements ergonomiques, massages sur chaise, fruits frais et collations, gym sur place, activités sportives);
  • Ambiance unique (bel environnement de travail, accès à une terrasse, nombreuses activités sociales, quartier animé et en pleine effervescence).

*Le masculin est utilisé comme un genre neutre. Ce poste est ouvert à tous les genres.*
________________________________________________________________


Frima, a proudly Quebec-based company, has been developing video games on various platforms in collaboration with the industry's biggest players since 2003. Join a high-performance team of professionals whose ambition is to always excel with its partners and to offer productions of a quality worthy of the greatest game producers in the industry.

At Frima, we cultivate bold creativity! We are proud to have been named one of the best video game employers in Canada in 2021 by GamesIndustry.biz!

As a 3D animator, you are responsible for the production of 3D animations for video games, including cinematic sequences and in-game animations. You will also be responsible for following up on tasks related to the artistic production of the project and participating in its evaluation. You will participate in the development and maintenance of the animation vision by working closely with the artistic direction, designers, artists, programmers, etc. You will act as a mentor to the animators on your team by assisting them in their daily tasks and helping them grow within the studio.

What will fill your days:

  • Create, prioritize, assign and regularly monitor tasks and progress of work on his project with respect to deliverables;
  • Accompany the lead, when required, in the review, feedback and correction of the animation team's work;
  • Work with leads and directors to ensure clear communication and collaboration between the teams;
  • Work in close collaboration with other animators and related artists to maximize the potential of the animations;
  • Resolve creative and technical issues as they occur;
  • Adjust the level of detail and animation effects to the technical needs and constraints of the project;
  • Make corrections and adjustments, when necessary, and be able to give and receive feedback;
  • Demonstrate creativity and adaptability to different game and graphic styles;
  • Ensure the quality, structure and optimization of 3D animation content and practices on the project;
  • Mentor less experienced artists on the project team to help them progress;
  • Support the lead 3D animator, when required, in the management of the project;
  • Participate in calls with clients when required;
  • Act as a resource person for all aspects of 3D animation on the project, both internally and externally;
  • Analyze and propose ideas for the implementation of best practices in his field of expertise and the improvement of his management;
  • Participate in the welcoming of new 3D animators to the project.

Your profile looks like this:

  • College education in 3D animation, multimedia or other relevant fields combined with equivalent work experience;
  • Minimum of six (6) years of relevant experience in the video game industry;
  • Advanced knowledge of all aspects of 3D animation (physics, character animation, timing, stylistic diversity (realistic and/or cartoon), etc.);
  • Basic knowledge of traditional 2D art and animation;
  • Excellent knowledge of Maya or 3DS Max, MotionBuilder (an asset);
  • Knowledge in rigging and FX, modeling (an asset);
  • Experience with Unity and Unreal (an asset);
  • Bilingual (English/French).

These skills define you well:

  • Ability to work in a multidisciplinary team;
  • Mentoring skills;
  • Good time management and respect of production deadlines;
  • Good artistic culture (gaming, multimedia, cinema, etc.);
  • Autonomy, resourcefulness, organization and thoroughness;
  • Passion for video game development.

At Frima, we take care of our people:

  • Work environment recognized by GamesIndustry.biz as one of the best places to work in Canada;
  • All the flexibility of a hybrid work mode (work from home and in person);
  • Flexible vacation policy with the possibility of having up to 7 weeks annually;
  • Wide range of benefits (complete group insurance, telemedicine, flexible group savings, sick days, personal days, flexible schedule, employee and family assistance program)
  • Mobility program (monthly RTC pass, parking allowance, Communauto subscription, indoor bike parking);
  • Frima Health (allowance for the purchase of ergonomic equipment, chair massages, fresh fruit and snacks, on-site gym, sports activities);
  • Unique atmosphere (beautiful work environment, access to a terrace, numerous social activities, lively and vibrant neighborhood).

*The masculine is used as a neutral gender. This position is open to all genders.*

title: 3D Lighting/Comp Artist - Senior
description:
At Bardel, our greatest asset is our people. The 3D Lighting Artist - Senior works under the Lighting Lead and CG Supervisor. The artist is responsible for lighting, compositing and troubleshooting shots for TV & animated films, interpreting the color keys, and creating a 3D representation that reflects the original intent of the designer and director.

What you will be doing:

  • Light and Render CG Shots
  • Create and modify lighting scenes in Katana
  • Set up AOV's in Renderman
  • Ensure continuity across the shots in a sequence
  • Working with the supervisors and the leads to achieve the correct visual in Compositing
  • Comp shots to achieve the final look in Nuke.
  • Being able to project matte painting on cards or geometry in Nuke
  • Work with the Matte Painting Supervisor and understand what's being output by the DMP department and how to use it
  • Optimizes render settings in Renderman for the cleanest and fastest output on the renderfarm
  • Troubleshoot Katana files for technically related issues
  • Communicate problems and show stoppers to the lead or supervisor to get them resolved in a timely fashion
  • Execute the reviews requested by the Supervisor and the Director by showing an analytic and proactive mind
  • Quality Check your render layers to ensure a correct output to compositing
  • Maintain timing and production quotas given by the production coordinator by looking at a Shotgun Dashboard
  • Organize work and prepare dailies for presentation
  • Demonstrates good written and verbal communication, and exhibits a collaborative, supportive approach to working with other team members.
  • Capable of basic python scripting to make simple tasks more automatic
  • Mentor and offer support to less experienced artists. Providing them with guidance and instruction

What you bring with you:

  • Minimum 4+ years of working experience as a 3D Lighting Artist, in a film production environment / animation TV series or visual effects
  • Experience mentoring Junior artists
  • Great Knowledge of Renderman, 3Dlite or Vray
  • Great Knowledge of Foundry Katana
  • Great Knowledge of Foundry Nuke
  • Keen eye to detail and knowledge of how the light works in the real world
  • Photography skills are a plus
  • Bachelor of Fine Arts or CGI related Diploma is a plus

Why work at Bardel?

We've got great people here, and for good reasons. Bardel offers a generous benefit package, regular social events and ongoing development opportunities for employees to advance their careers through work on prominent and exciting industry projects. You will collaborate with other influential, career-minded creative professionals from around the world, and have the opportunity to grow in your career.

What we want to see in your application:

Tell us why YOU are the person for the position and how you meet the position's criteria. Forward us your current resume and samples of your work (eg. a link to your website or reel – don't hesitate to show off a little!).


How to apply:

Please apply below in this form or visit our Job Portal to apply.


Thank YOU!

Candidates applying from outside of British Columbia must be willing and able to relocate to British Columbia, Canada (either working in-studio or remote in BC). Bardel's talent mobility program offers support to candidates in obtaining proper work authorization and residency. Note, employment prior to relocation begins as independent contracts.

title: Burberry Counter Manager
description:
LocationEDMONTON,Alberta,Canada
CategoryStores
Job OpenedApril 18th, 2022
EducationHigh School Diploma/GED
Job Number2200028L
Job TypeFull-Time
RemoteNo

job description

What This Position is All About
You are a friendly, customer-focused individual who understands the importance of always being ready to serve the customer. You are a team player who has earned the respect of your peers through commitment, partnership and effective communication. You organize and prioritize your workload in a way that always puts the customer first and delivers the operational standards that are required. In a dynamic fast-paced environment you are self-motivated, adaptable and decisive ensuring the best outcome for the customer and the business.
Who You Are:
  • Acts with customers in mind, great networking and relationship management.
  • Puts the needs of internal and external customers first. Seeks customer information when improving products and services.
  • Often goes above and beyond their goals. Is consistently a top performer and elevates the performance of others
  • Sees ahead clearly, is knowledgeable and has a capability for a big picture perspective.
You Also Have:
  • Knowledge of skin/body care treatments with 2-5 years of work experience in Cosmetics
  • Certified Make-up Artist
  • Must have experience in a commission and clientele selling environment
  • Full flexibility with schedule (including evenings and weekends)
As The Counter Manager of Cosmetics, You Will:
  • Analyze business metrics to develop action plans that address opportunities and positively impact the business
  • Build your client base through the Preferred Customer Program
  • Observe staff on the selling floor and their interaction with customers, co-workers and overall customer service level
  • Achieve daily / weekly / monthly sales goals based on the department's goal and are expected to track their sales
  • Deliver World-class service through client communication, product knowledge, fashion direction and solution-based selling at the highest-level
  • Work with Vendor Partners to maximize sales opportunities through suggestive selling, store events / seminars and wardrobe clients
How Often You May Travel:
  • NA
Your Life and Career at HBC:
  • Be part of a world-class team; work with an adventurous spirit; think and act like an owner- operator!
  • Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities, from retail to supply chain, to digital or corporate.
  • A culture that promotes a healthy, fulfilling work/life balance
  • Benefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, vision and dental).
  • An amazing employee discount
Thank you for your interest with HBC. We look forward to reviewing your application.
HBC provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, HBC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
HBC welcomes all applicants for this position. Should you be individually selected to participate in an assessment or selection process, accommodations are available upon request in relation to the materials or processes to be used.

title: Animator
description:
Rocket Science is an Emmy nominated boutique visual effects studio collaborating with filmmakers to create stunning visual imagery utilizing artistry, science and technology. Located in Toronto, Canada, notable credits include Eric Kripke’s Emmy nominated superhero series THE BOYS (Amazon), the epic video game adaptation HALO (Paramount +), the BAFTA winning mini-series TITANIC (iTV), six seasons of Naren Shankar’s sci-fi series THE EXPANSE (Amazon), and features such as Neil Jordan’s GRETA (Sidney Kimmel, John Leonetti’s WISH UPON (Broad Green Pictures) and David Cronenberg’s upcoming Cannes release CRIMES OF THE FUTURE.

RSVFX’s current productions include Tim Burton’s WEDNESDAY (Netflix), THE BOYS S3 (Amazon), Steve Blackman’s UMBRELLA ACADEMY S3 (Netflix) and LOCKE AND KEY S3 (Netflix) from Carlton Cuse and Meredith Averill.

Visit us @ rsvfx.com

CG Animator

Job Description:

  • Create high-quality and realistic animations of characters, vehicles, props and cameras.
  • Solve creative and technical problems under tight deadlines and fast turnaround.
  • Use a variety of rigging systems and animation plugins. Stay up to date with animation software and trends.
  • Take direction from CG Supervisor and VFX Supervisors; animate and revise based on that direction.
  • Work within a collaborative team environment.

Requirements:

  • 4+ years of working experience in VFX or an extraordinary demo reel.
  • Excellent knowledge in Maya.
  • Thorough understanding of realistic motion and physics.
  • A small amount of scripting knowledge - Mel or Python preferred.
  • An understanding of Rigging.
  • Strong shot composition capability.
  • 3D tracking capability is a plus.
  • An understanding of both feature film and television VFX production pipelines.
  • Must be detail oriented, organized, have good communication skills, and be able to independently handle a variety of tasks in an efficient manner.
  • Experience with Shotgun.
  • A strong eye for detail, composition, colour and lighting.
  • Eligible to work in Canada*

Rocket Science is an equal opportunity company which values diversity in the workplace. We would be happy to accommodate individual needs in keeping with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with the Disabilities Act. If you require accommodation in order to participate in our recruitment process, please contact us to make your needs known in advance.

Thank you for your interest in Rocket Science VFX. Please note that only those who meet the requirements will be contacted for an interview. No Phone Call Please. We are always interested in meeting motivated and talented artists.
