title: 2D Animation Director
description:
At Brown Bag Films our motto is simple: “We love animation.” In fact, we love it so much we trademarked it! ‘We Love Animation™.’ That means we put our artists at the heart of everything we do! We are looking someone to join our team who shares our vision and will bring with them a passion for creating high quality content.


Reporting to the Series Director and Producers the Animation Director is responsible for the quality of the animation, keeping animation on schedule and for delivering consistent performances by the entire animation team. The Animation director will Guide, supervise and review the work produced by the Animation Leads and Animators ensuring the animation is kept on model (in style) throughout the production. By maintaining a keen eye on schedules and budgets the Animation Director will play a critical role in the success of the production.

Key Responsibilities

Assign work to the Animation team in a fair manor, focusing on strengths within the team

Interpret decisions and to communicate them to the animation crew

Support and mentor animation team to complete work in accordance with the style of the show

Work closely with the Director to ensure through understanding all the ins and outs of the show and the Directors creative vision

Work with the Design Supervisor and Rigging Supervisor to help create user friendly rigs for animation

Work with the Director and come up with an efficient and effective animation style that will work with the style of the series and be easy to animate

Work the producers and help to problem solve scheduling and crew issues

Monitor Animation leads/supervisors and team progress to ensure the production is staying on schedule and on budget

Study the animatic and develop a thorough understanding of the episode to help in creating a look and style of the show

Review animation completed by the team and determine which revisions are required, review all revisions prior to submitting to the Director

Ensure creative revisions are completed as call by the Series Director and Clients

Proactively communicate any issues with animation, status or budget with Producers and Director

Resolve problems or concerns within the Animation department in a productive and positive manner

Call Animation Reshoot before sending to Director for review

Ensure that all internal and external deadlines are met

Key Requirements

5+ years’ animation experience with a good eye for character performance and nuances

Above average communication and interpersonal skills

Exhibit strong leadership skills and the ability to manage and motivate a team

Highly effective Project Management skills – deadline and budget driven while striving to maintain creative integrity whenever possible

Expert/Master technical knowledge of software being used throughout the pipeline (Harmony/After Effects/Shotgun)

Display a calm and professional demeanor when working under time constraints and pressure

Strong hands on knowledge of MS Office (excel, word)

Able to multi-task and to proactively work efficiently with multiple stakeholders

Professional and positive attitude

Able to handle sensitive, confidential information appropriately



- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Why work with us?

Perks! Perks! Perks! Not only is Brown Bag Films an amazing place full of artists, animators and creators from all corners of the industry, but we focus on helping staff grow and develop in their careers and make them long time team members. Along with a great work environment we offer first-rate health + dental benefits, summer hours, paid Health and Wellness Days, vacation periods that multiply with tenure, and more! We may love animation, but we love our employees even more!

Our Toronto office can be found in the cool and trendy Liberty Village with over 200 artists working on award winning animated children’s content. You will benefit from a competitive compensation package, interesting work and a fun/supportive work environment.


Applicants need to be legally eligible to work in Canada and have Ontario residency.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.



9 Story Media takes diversity and inclusion seriously and we are committed to ensuring equity in the recruitment process. Candidates from diverse backgrounds, including but not limited to, Indigenous

peoples, Racialized and LGBT2SQ+ communities, candidates from a range of ages and religious beliefs and people with disabilities, are encouraged to apply.

As a company, we deliver high-quality kids' content, and we seek to have diverse characters so that all our audience feels represented. We also want the same for our own workforce, and 9 Story Media is committed to looking for all kinds of talent to build a diverse workforce in which all identities are represented and respected.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application and interview process to be successful in performing essential job functions. We’d love to know how we can support your requirements for accommodation.

title: Lead Compositor
description:
Rocket Science is an Emmy nominated boutique visual effects studio collaborating with filmmakers to create stunning visual imagery utilizing artistry, science and technology. Located in Toronto, Canada, notable credits include Eric Kripke’s Emmy nominated superhero series THE BOYS (Amazon), the epic video game adaptation HALO (Paramount +), the BAFTA winning mini-series TITANIC (iTV), six seasons of Naren Shankar’s sci-fi series THE EXPANSE (Amazon), and features such as Neil Jordan’s GRETA (Sidney Kimmel, John Leonetti’s WISH UPON (Broad Green Pictures) and David Cronenberg’s upcoming Cannes release CRIMES OF THE FUTURE.

RSVFX’s current productions include Tim Burton’s WEDNESDAY (Netflix), THE BOYS S3 (Amazon), Steve Blackman’s UMBRELLA ACADEMY S3 (Netflix) and LOCKE AND KEY S3 (Netflix) from Carlton Cuse and Meredith Averill.

Visit us @ rsvfx.com

The Lead Compositor will work directly with the Compositing Supervisor while monitoring a team of Compositors. Ensure quality and technical excellence, while working closely with the Compositing Supervisor, VFX Supervisor and Art Directors to oversee all Compositing aspects of our Television and Feature projects.

Responsibilities:

  • Seamlessly integrate 2D, 3D and live action elements with an eye for photorealism and a strong aesthetic sensibility.
  • Solve creative and technical problems under tight deadlines and fast turnaround.
  • Take direction from Compositing Supervisor and VFX Supervisors; execute compositing tasks based on that direction.
  • Determine shot methodology for sequence work.
  • Supervise junior employees; work within a collaborative team environment.
  • Stay up to date with compositing software and trends.
  • Keying; color grading, tracking, paint, 3D render layer integration, look development, shot finaling.
  • Collaborate with the Lighting Department to meet Compositing Department objectives
  • Work closely with the VFX Supervisor, CG Supervisor and Producer to delegate the project’s Compositing needs to the team to ensure good continuity and internal communication with the production teams.
  • Proficiency in Nuke, After Effects, Photoshop and Shotgun

Qualifications:

  • 4+ years’ experience in a live-action VFX Environment.
  • Expert understanding of the Nuke 3D environment and projection mapping.
  • Extensive experience with multi pass 3D renders; ability to create a “look”.
  • Firm understanding of color space and LUTs.
  • Knowledge of Maya, Houdini, Mocha, PFTrack are a plus.
  • A thorough understanding of both feature film and television VFX production pipelines.
  • A strong eye for detail, composition, colour and lighting. An ability to make shots look great.
  • Ability to multitask, prioritize and problem solve in a fast paced environment
  • A team player with excellent communication skills.

Rocket Science VFX is an equal opportunity company which values diversity in the workplace. We would be happy to accommodate individual needs in keeping with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with the Disabilities Act. If you require accommodation in order to participate in our recruitment process, please contact us to make your needs known in advance.

Thank you for your interest in Rocket Science VFX. Please note that only those who meet the requirements will be contacted for an interview. No Phone Call Please. We are always interested in meeting motivated and talented artists.

title: Lead Artist / Artiste Principal | Environment-Props / Enviro...
description:
Title: 2D Lead Environments & Props Artist

Level: Project Management

Type: Remote, Home-Working

Location: Anywhere in Canada

We are extensively growing our Global Art Team

The role of Lead Artist is to lead and motivate a team of talented 2D Artists in delivering immersive worlds and AAA quality assets. This position entails a great deal of responsibility and opportunity to drive further the development of strong team and for which your artistic, technical and managerial expertise are with great importance. As a Lead Artist your job is to plan, organize, follow-up and evaluate their work in order to ensure that they meet the production objectives in terms of time and quality. In this role you are required to anticipate and find solutions on team and production level in order to deliver stunning visual experience of the project.

Requirements

Job Responsibilities

  • Lead artistic team in development of AAA quality environments and assets
  • Participate in the scheduling of his part of the project and maintain planning foresight
  • Maintains effective informational flow to the team to ensure the team members are aligned with the project objectives
  • Provide regular review and feedback on teams work in a clear and constructive manner
  • Encourage creativity and participation from all team members
  • Maintain efficient collaboration between the team members and other dependent teams
  • Achieving the creative vision of the production
  • Maintain close working relationship with your direct manager, producers, leads, directors and other teams to push project quality
  • Raise the bar for the project by demanding high results from self and team members
  • Actively participate to the constant improvement of work methods and pipelines
  • Share knowledge and recommend best practices in your area of operation
  • Ensure that produced and integrated assets respect the artistic vision of the game and meet the quality standards
  • Creating art while following instructions to support creative production processes and is responsible for producing sketches or artwork, and drawing sketches from different angles
  • Create concept art to enable the visualisation of characters, environments and background
  • Previous experience of creating art for 3D environments, including the creation of low-poly art, concepting new spaces and scenes for real-time virtual experiences
  • A passion for virtual reality architecture and a proven understanding of what makes virtual reality visually appealing and how this can affect user experience
  • Really good self-motivation, self-organisation and a personal commitment to succeed
  • Great presentation, influencing and communication skills, so you can explain concepts and user stories with confidence

Qualifications

  • Previous experience as a Senior or Lead Artist in the games industry
  • Passion for games development and strong game culture
  • Experience in the video game industry will be considered an advantage
  • Experience in team leadership and management
  • Excellent knowledge of 2D & 3D software (3DS Max, Zbrush, etc.)
  • Excellent knowledge in Photoshop or other equivalent packages
  • Good knowledge in game engines
  • Strong artistic skills
  • Excellent communication skills and teamwork oriented attitude
  • Problem solving attitude
  • Able to drive change and inspire others to generate new ideas

Benefits

  • Competitive basic salary
  • Excellent Holiday entitlement plus public holidays
  • Dynamic and entrepreneurial culture
  • You get to work with the latest technologies
  • You will be working for one of the worlds leading providers of specialist services to the games industry.

Who we are

PTW is a video games services company which supports video game developers and publishers through outsourced production services. We started 25 years ago and since then, have grown exponentially year-on-year to where we are today. Our history is in gaming, and we are gamers at heart. In our time within the games industry, we have worked on over 1500 titles across all genres and all platforms, including 8 out of the past 10 Game-Of-The-Year-winning titles.

We have grown rapidly over the past few years and now have 35 sites spanning the globe. The PTW umbrella of companies includes 1518 studios, SIDE and Orange Rock. SIDE works at the cutting edge of interactive media as a provider of audio services for the global entertainment market. Orange Rock is our in-house game and product development studio.1518 is our global award-winning art studio.

Welcome to 1518

title: Clarins Counter Manager
description:
LocationEDMONTON,Alberta,Canada
CategoryStores
Job OpenedApril 19th, 2022
EducationHigh School Diploma/GED
Job Number2200029G
Job TypeFull-Time
RemoteNo

job description

What This Position is All About
You are a friendly, customer-focused individual who understands the importance of always being ready to serve the customer. You are a team player who has earned the respect of your peers through commitment, partnership and effective communication. You organize and prioritize your workload in a way that always puts the customer first and delivers the operational standards that are required. In a dynamic fast-paced environment you are self-motivated, adaptable and decisive ensuring the best outcome for the customer and the business.
Who You Are:
  • Acts with customers in mind, great networking and relationship management.
  • Puts the needs of internal and external customers first. Seeks customer information when improving products and services.
  • Often goes above and beyond their goals. Is consistently a top performer and elevates the performance of others
  • Sees ahead clearly, is knowledgeable and has a capability for a big picture perspective.
You Also Have:
  • Knowledge of skin/body care treatments with 2-5 years of work experience in Cosmetics
  • Certified Make-up Artist
  • Must have experience in a commission and clientele selling environment
  • Full flexibility with schedule (including evenings and weekends)
As The Counter Manager of Cosmetics, You Will:
  • Analyze business metrics to develop action plans that address opportunities and positively impact the business
  • Build your client base through the Preferred Customer Program
  • Observe staff on the selling floor and their interaction with customers, co-workers and overall customer service level
  • Achieve daily / weekly / monthly sales goals based on the department's goal and are expected to track their sales
  • Deliver World-class service through client communication, product knowledge, fashion direction and solution-based selling at the highest-level
  • Work with Vendor Partners to maximize sales opportunities through suggestive selling, store events / seminars and wardrobe clients
How Often You May Travel:
  • NA
Your Life and Career at HBC:
  • Be part of a world-class team; work with an adventurous spirit; think and act like an owner- operator!
  • Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities, from retail to supply chain, to digital or corporate.
  • A culture that promotes a healthy, fulfilling work/life balance
  • Benefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, vision and dental).
  • An amazing employee discount
Thank you for your interest with HBC. We look forward to reviewing your application.
HBC provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, HBC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
HBC welcomes all applicants for this position. Should you be individually selected to participate in an assessment or selection process, accommodations are available upon request in relation to the materials or processes to be used.

title: Layout Artist
description:
Introduction

We are currently looking for top talent to join our exciting and diverse team!


Above.Land

Above.Land is an AAA open world metaverse. Set in a magical world above the clouds, humans and mythological creatures attempt to find a way to co-exist. A place where technology and fantasy blend together, new world meets the old and epic adventures await around every corner. Players must find a way to free and liberate creatures that have been corrupted by a powerful evil, and return them to their majestic forms that they once were. Players must master techniques, upgrade their gear and craft their battle plans in order to save their world. Are you up for the challenge?


Position

Above.Land is expanding and looking for an experienced Layout Artist to join us as soon as this Spring 2022.

The Layout Artist is responsible for executing the staging, blocking and camera work that makes up the foundation of a successful shot and/or sequence of shots within a cinematic. Provide creative solutions to aesthetic problems in a fast paced, CG environment.

If you are seeking to be a part of an exciting project and team-based environment, we’d love to hear from you.


Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with the Creative Director/Leads/Director of Photography to explore and develop the visual story
  • Attend Layout Reviews, Launches and Approvals with Production
  • To create, revise and modify layouts/shots as indicated by the Director or creative team
  • To organize and manage timelines to ensure all work is completed and submitted on time and in adherence with the production schedule
  • To support colleagues; this may include troubleshooting and/or obtaining appropriate resolution to any technical issues as they arise to keep production moving forward
  • To ensure quality control via verifying that all shots follow studio policies and guidelines prior to moving into next stage of production
  • Responsible for adhering to the complexity of the project
  • Communicate in a timely fashion with Production for all inter-department concerns


Requirements

  • Understanding of cinematography is a must
  • Bachelor’s degree or diploma in Animation, Film, Art, relevant field or equivalent experience desired
  • A good working knowledge of the principles of cinematic staging, blocking and camera work
  • Excellent working knowledge of animation for both cameras and CG characters
  • Basic CG modeling skills desired
  • Must be able to work in a collaborative environment and take direction easily and be willing to participate; as a member of a team as well as to work independently
  • Knowledge in scene, shot, camera, and character composition is preferred
  • Knowledge of the animation pipeline is desired
  • Excellent communication, organizational skills and attention to detail


Benefits‍

  • Great company culture, with a team that is very technically proficient, highly motivated & excited to work on projects that will change the industry.
  • Competitive health and dental benefits
  • Casual dress-code


Above.Land is committed to providing an inclusive work environment that celebrates the diversity of its employees. We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, gender identity, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodation upon request for candidates taking part in the recruitment process.


We thank you for your interest, however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted

title: MAC Beauty Advisor
description:
*Position Summary
*
As one of our highly skilled make-up artists you will combine your creative and technical expertise and passion for people to provide a welcoming, inspirational and personalized in-store experience which educates and delights our customers.
You will also like working as part of a high performing team to create impact with in-store events and to ensure that the store always achieves our high standards of visual merchandising to stand out against our competitors.
If you are a dynamic self-starter looking for a progressive career opportunity then this could be the perfect role for you and the first step of your career with a leader in prestige beauty.
While certification in make -up artistry and/or previous retail make up experience is desirable we also welcome applicants with amateur level experience.
As a leader in prestige beauty with a culture that values diversity of thought and people, we offer excellent training and development and a competitive remuneration and benefits package.
Qualifications
Qualifications

  • While a qualification in make-up artistry/previous retail make up experience is preferred, we welcome applicants with amateur level experience who are able to demonstrate a high level of creative and technical expertise
  • All applicants must be able to demonstrate the ability to provide inspirational, authentic and personalized customer service
  • Ability to work retail hours including days, nights, weekends and special events in a fast-paced work environment
  • Previous experience with retail point-of-sale software
  • Applicants must be able to provide proof of right to live and work in the country if invited to attend for interview

title: Hairstylist
description:
At Chatters, Style Happy is all about encouraging your artistic self-expression. Igniting your passion for providing that unforgettable customer experience. That’s why you continually have loyal clients that keep coming back. You have what it takes to ensure that our customers leave looking and feeling their best.

If you like having fun and making a difference; bring your Styling skills that are unparalleled to Chatters. Our Elite ongoing education and training opportunities will compliment your already mastered skills.


We’re on the hunt for a talented, trend setting, Hairstylist at our Sevenoaks retail salon.

A little about who you are:

  • An artist at heart, your creativity keeps them coming back!
  • A natural trend setter, you do that colour, cut or style the best in the business
  • You have years of experience in a Stylist role
  • Mad multi-tasker with a passion to provide the best possible experience
  • You are flexible with relentless ambition to succeed and make those around you better
  • You are positive and build lasting relationships with your Style Happy family
  • You have a warm and welcoming manner that makes our guests feel comfortable from start to finish

A little about what you’ll do:

  • Deliver on our philosophy that the “Experience is Everything”, make a connection with each guest.
  • Use your super-styling powers for good, always looking to improve and succeed through advanced education.
  • Speak their language. You recognize that everyone has a different approach to beauty and are able to effectively communicate in a way that everybody understands
  • Be a pro. Maintain a high level of competence and professionalism when representing Chatters at all times
  • Have fun!
  • Must have flexibility to work days, evenings, weekends.

A little about what we offer:

We know that great employees deserve great benefits, like:

  • Competitive pay in a high-traffic salon, with up to 54% commission
  • Discounted products and salon services
  • Flexible hours
  • Medical and dental, including employer RRSP contributions
  • Elite education by industry leaders

Plus, lots of opportunities to learn and grow!

Want to get to know us a little better? Come check us out at https://www.chatters.ca

title: VFX Coordinator
description:
For over two decades, Ghost VFX has collaborated with the very best to create award-winning, innovative visual effects. With contributions to over 100 feature films, episodics and interactive, we are a full-service, global visual effects house. Our talented and dedicated teams around the world make the impossible, possible, fulfilling the dreams of clients and artists alike. With roughly 150 artists and production professionals, we try every day to produce imagery that quietly speaks for itself.

We are looking for a talented VFX Coordinator to join our dynamic team! Apply now to join us.


VFX Coordinator

Ghost VFX


Responsibilities:
  • Works directly with the VFX Supervision team in a support role, coordinating projects in a fast-paced environment.
  • Track and maintain VFX workflow for revisions, omits, and short-length changes and notify the pertaining team members as needed.
  • Follow up with artists daily to ensure task deliveries remain on schedule, communicate any scheduling changes to appropriate artists, supervisors, and production team.
  • Attend VFX meetings, provide consultation/feedback, and update documents accordingly.
  • Collaborates with VFX Supervisors and artists in order to troubleshoot any complications that may arise.
  • Prepare all necessary reference materials for on-set guidance.
  • Provides administrative support to the VFX team.

Required Skills:
  • Minimum 3-5+ years of experience in a similar role; preferably within the VFX or post-production industry
  • Strong communication, problem-solving, and time management skills
  • Ability to communicate creative and technical thoughts and ideas clearly and effectively

Preferred Skills:
  • Prior experience working in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment
  • Strong understanding of VFX technologies

Education:
  • High School education or equivalent required.
  • BA/BS in applicable field preferred.

Ghost VFX is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

title: VFX Supervisor
description:
Company Description


As a company founded and run by an artist, it's our mission to provide talented artists with the freedom and resources they need to deliver quality work and to thrive in a fun and creative environment.


Job Description


The VFX Supervisor ensures leading creative and technical approaches are used to realize the creative vision of the project. They oversee the work of their project team, make decisions as to the workflow while monitoring the progress and adherence to the client’s creative vision. They will maintain positive relationships with the client, presenting work, finding solutions to creative issues and reporting on progress as needed.

Main responsibilities:

  • Spearhead the creation of a strategy and establishment of a global vision that will be applied throughout the VFX project to ensure the best creative and technical approach to meet the client’s needs;
  • In collaboration with the VFX Producer and the Executive Producer, assist in the completion of bids;
  • Communicate the creative vision and objectives to the project team, ensuring individual and/or team responsibility for results are clearly understood;
  • Find creative ways to ensure that the artistic vision of the client is respected and that projects are delivered on time and on budget, meeting Rodeo FX’s high quality standards. Communicate progress regularly to the VFX Producer;
  • Closely monitor the overall creative process, including performing daily reviews of assets and shots, providing regular feedback and guidance to team members. Assist the team to solve issues that arise during production. Conduct in-person turn-overs with artists and the VFX team;
  • Be present on set for the filming of VFX sequences, when requested by Production;
  • In collaboration with the VFX Producer, ensure that all assigned projects have a well-defined production schedule, adequate and appropriate resources, performance targets and milestones;
  • Alongside the VFX Producer, maintain regular communication with the client on the status of projects. Ensure the maintenance of ongoing positive and collaborative working relationships with clients;
  • In conjunction with the VFX Producer, monitor project budgets on a regular basis. Review any discrepancies with Production, finding creative solutions to keep projects on time and within budget;
  • Actively monitor the work climate in his/her team, taking steps to maintain a positive work environment and adherence to company values;
  • Review results of mid and post-mortem assessments, identify areas for improvement and ensure that all issues are addressed going forward;
  • Maintain up-to-date knowledge and seek the latest technological advances and work methods within the VFX industry;
  • Positively represent Rodeo FX within the VFX and related communities, both locally and in the worldwide market, to further grow the company’s reputation as an industry leader. This can include giving conferences, participating in panels and actively participating in industry events.

Qualifications
  • Minimum of 10 years of experience in visual effects;
  • Minimum of 3 years of supervisory experience;
  • Fluent in English, written and spoken. Functional french (or willingness to learn);
  • Good knowledge of Shotgun project management software;
  • Excellent knowledge of the VFX Production process from concept to delivery;
  • Must be available for occasional international travel.

Additional Information
  • Full-time, Permanent Contract;
  • 5 paid sick days;
  • 2 additional statutory holidays in the winter holidays;
  • Group Insurance, access to Dialogue online support and to an Employee Assistance Program (EAP);
  • RRSP with employer contribution;
  • Discounts with Bixi, Nautilus Plus and many more local businesses.

Diversity is a core value at Rodeo FX. We are passionate about building and sustaining an inclusive and equitable work environment where diversity is celebrated and valued. We believe every member on our team enriches our work by exposing us to a broad range of ways to perceive and interact with the world, identify challenges, and to design and deliver projects.

title: Counter Manager Estee Lauder
description:
LocationEDMONTON,Alberta,Canada
CategoryStores
Job OpenedApril 6th, 2022
EducationHigh School Diploma/GED
Job Number2200022O
Job TypeFull-Time
RemoteNo

job description

What This Position is All About
You are a friendly, customer-focused individual who understands the importance of always being ready to serve the customer. You are a team player who has earned the respect of your peers through commitment, partnership and effective communication. You organize and prioritize your workload in a way that always puts the customer first and delivers the operational standards that are required. In a dynamic fast-paced environment you are self-motivated, adaptable and decisive ensuring the best outcome for the customer and the business.
Who You Are:
  • Acts with customers in mind, great networking and relationship management.
  • Puts the needs of internal and external customers first. Seeks customer information when improving products and services.
  • Often goes above and beyond their goals. Is consistently a top performer and elevates the performance of others
  • Sees ahead clearly, is knowledgeable and has a capability for a big picture perspective.
You Also Have:
  • Knowledge of skin/body care treatments with 2-5 years of work experience in Cosmetics
  • Certified Make-up Artist
  • Must have experience in a commission and clientele selling environment
  • Full flexibility with schedule (including evenings and weekends)
As The Counter Manager of Cosmetics, You Will:
  • Analyze business metrics to develop action plans that address opportunities and positively impact the business
  • Build your client base through the Preferred Customer Program
  • Observe staff on the selling floor and their interaction with customers, co-workers and overall customer service level
  • Achieve daily / weekly / monthly sales goals based on the department's goal and are expected to track their sales
  • Deliver World-class service through client communication, product knowledge, fashion direction and solution-based selling at the highest-level
  • Work with Vendor Partners to maximize sales opportunities through suggestive selling, store events / seminars and wardrobe clients
How Often You May Travel:
  • NA
Your Life and Career at HBC:
  • Be part of a world-class team; work with an adventurous spirit; think and act like an owner- operator!
  • Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities, from retail to supply chain, to digital or corporate.
  • A culture that promotes a healthy, fulfilling work/life balance
  • Benefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, vision and dental).
  • An amazing employee discount
Thank you for your interest with HBC. We look forward to reviewing your application.
HBC provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, HBC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
HBC welcomes all applicants for this position. Should you be individually selected to participate in an assessment or selection process, accommodations are available upon request in relation to the materials or processes to be used.

title: Animation Technical Director
description:
At Tuque Games, a Wizards of the Coast studio, our mission is simple:

Build great games and have fun doing it!

We are passionate game developers working on original high quality AAA games while enjoying a healthy studio culture. Our ambition is guided by strong values such as respect, honesty and humbleness. We truly believe in the power of a diverse team in which each individual has the opportunity to deploy their full potential and contribute to our collective success.

That speaks to you? Join us!

Job description

Tuque Games is looking for an Animation Technical Director. This role will be part of the core design team, collaborating with other designers, artists, and engineers to be the glue between vision and implementation.

What You'll Do:

  • Collaborate with game leadership to develop the overall vision & determine technical feasibility;

  • Build up and maintain detailed documentation for all owned features, leaving no pathways unexplored.

  • Evaluate the game's vision, design and technical needs and identify risks and mitigation plans

  • Work closely with programmers to assess existing animation and rigging tools + occasionally design custom ones to improve pipelines;

  • Support animators, game designers, and riggers with their technical needs + informatively and constructively explain the root causes of risks, blockers, etc.

  • Train team members on tools and techniques + raise awareness of new processes;

  • Resolve complex, escalated issues & make technical validations;

  • Work with engineers to assess animation and rigging tools

  • Anticipate technological advancements and stay up to date on market trends to define our best practices + share them with our studios and the industry;

  • Responsible for performance metrics with regards to animation

  • Evaluate, design and develop the pipelines within the animation team and between other departments for ingame integration and cinematics

  • Support technical development across all animation driven systems (gameplay, cinematics, ingame events etc)

  • Regularly play the game, providing constructive feedback and suggestions to other members of the team.

What You'll Bring:

  • 10+ years experience developing AAA titles

  • 5+ years of experience as an Animation Technical Director on AAA titles

  • Proficient with MotionBuilder, cinematics workflows & Unreal Engine

  • Strong analytical skills and a love for efficient problem solving.

  • Positive, direct, collaborative communication to improve our shared vision.

  • Flexible, adaptable approach with a constant appetite for new knowledge and experiences.

  • Self-sufficient and self-motivated, able to manage a feature from start to finish but also know when to ask for mentorship or help.

  • Ability to program or edit scripts.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

Tuque Games commits to offer equal working chances to every individual, without regard based on the following: age, sex, sexual orientation, physical disability, race, religion, citizenship, native country or any other possible particularities. We sincerely believe in a respectful and open-minded work environment, in which everyone can fully contribute to

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Principal Technical Artist
description:
WHY YOU SHOULD WORK WITH PGI:
  • Flexible Schedules & Remote Working Arrangements
  • People-focused Events & Initiatives
  • Comprehensive Benefits
  • Competitive Compensation
RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Oversees the Technical Art Team, assigns personnel to projects & directs their activities, and evaluates their work & performance.
  • Participates in the recruitment of department staff and provides input into hiring decisions.
  • Works closely with the Art Director and Engineering/Technical Director in developing innovative solutions and incorporating new technology, while keeping the visual quality intact from technical constraints.
  • Identifies and defines workflows, streamlines processes and develops tools/frameworks for CG characters, environments, animation and VFX.
  • Understands advantages and limitations of technology, and develops strategies for maximizing performance.
  • Optimizes levels to meet specifications such as memory and performance gains.
  • Develops content creation guidelines, documentation, and tutorials for technical processes, tools & production pipelines for future references.
  • Actively accepts and provides feedback on the technical aspects to the Art team, and the Production team at large.
  • Communicates risks and obstacles on pipeline matters to the Art Director and Project Manager and proactively works towards solutions for them.
  • Ensures technical specifications are adhered to by the art team.
  • Keeps up with the latest industry trends by investigate new techniques, implementing them and training the team.
  • Spearheads developing a smooth pipeline to get assets from outsourcing partners integrated into the game engine.
  • Perform other ad-hoc responsibilities as requested.
REQUIREMENTS:
  • Minimum 5-7 years of experience in game development serving in a Technical Artist role with at least 2 shipped AAA titles on consoles and/or PC. Prior supervisory experience preferred.
  • Experienced with creating assets within art pipelines including rigging, scripting, shader development, lighting, and visual effects.
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities at once.
  • Contribute to setting priorities within a game feature.
  • Demonstrates dedication, adaptability and accountability in own work.
  • Collaborates effectively with others within the same discipline and across disciplines.
  • Proven problem-solving skills, along with the ability to create rapid prototypes resulting creative production solutions.
  • Deep understanding of the technical requirements of real-time content development.
  • Strong knowledge of Unreal Engine.
  • Knowledge of physical based rendering techniques (texture creation, lighting, and shaders).
  • Knowledgeable of game production methodologies.
  • Strong ability to streamline workflow practices, debug and optimize content.
  • Comprehensive knowledge of 3ds Max.
  • Demonstrated initiative and relentless motivation to tackle complex technical challenges.
  • Proficient with coding and scripting languages such as Python, c#, Javascript, MaxScript, & Blueprints.
ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:
  • A solid grasp of traditional and digital art styles and techniques.
  • Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development environment.
  • Experience working with Unreal’s engine code is a plus.
Want to know more? Submit your application and let us tell you about working at Piranha and why we love it!

Founded in 2000, Piranha Games is an action gaming studio with unparalleled experience developing licensed products for big-name franchises, including AAA licensed titles such as; Need for Speed: Undercover and Duke Nukem Forever. Best known for the Free-to-Play game title MechWarrior Online, PGI is as committed as ever to creating world-class action-based games, having most recently released MechWarrior 5: Mercenaries. Piranha Games is part of the Enad Global 7 group. For more information please visit www.piranhagames.com

Piranha Games is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to fostering an inclusive environment for all employees. Formal education is not always required. All team members are hand-picked because they are skilled in their individual fields, immensely creative and hard workers. We hire avid gamers and mold them to the standards we believe make amazing products.

Should you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at recruiting@piranhagames.com (mailto: recruiting@piranhagames.com)

We thank you for your interest in this position. Due to the amount of applications, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Senior Rendering and Shader Technical Artist / Artiste Techn...
description:
The opportunity

The Unity Solutions Games team is a group of highly skilled Software Development and Technical Art Consultants with deep expertise in the Unity platform, whose main goal is to help our customers improve their projects and internal workflows and assist them in the resolution of challenging technical problems. To do this, we provide a series of short-term and long-term consulting and development services that can range in duration from one week to eighteen months and beyond.

Our customers range from small indie developers up to globally known brands. They need their art pipelines optimized, their visual targets met, and timely advice on how best to use Unity. If you're technically skilled, passionate about visual rendering, customer-focused, and curious, this job will suit you.

Your day-to-day work will include interacting with customers, researching and delivering the answers to their questions, developing solutions and examples, and striving to ensure that their projects succeed.

This role may involve periodic travel to customers and other Unity offices (up to 25%). Travel is subject to your interests, responsibilities and local health policies.

We're committed to maintaining a diverse team, and we welcome and encourage applicants with diverse experiences and backgrounds.

What you'll be doing

  • Push graphical quality to the highest level, given target platform constraints.
  • Investigate, profile, suggest performance improvements, and optimize rendering workflow of customer projects.
  • Build sample shaders, material and rendering technique for our partners or Unity customers in general with quality methodologies in mind.
  • Develop and maintain art production workflows and pipelines by writing scripts and tools to aid artists in the creation of content.
  • Work closely with the engineers to build new features or improve current ones.

What we're looking for

  • Experience in writing and optimizing shaders for real-time rendering engines and using tools such as Max/Maya/Blender or Houdini in a professional capacity. Understanding of HLSL and C# or scripting languages.
  • Deep understanding of rendering passes, lighting, and post effects.
  • Familiarity with profiling tools such as Pix, Nsight, Render Doc, or Snapdragon Profiler.
  • Effective communication skills and ability to work efficiently on shared projects with engineers, designers, artists, testers, and other developers.
  • 5+ years of game development experience with titles shipped on PC, console or mobile.

You might also have

  • Experience with Unity, Unreal, Cry Engine or other 3D game engines.
  • Experience with outsourcing.

Life at Unity

Unity (NYSE: U) is the world's leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity's platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices.

Unity is at the forefront of development by working alongside partners to ensure optimized support for the latest releases and platforms. Apps developed by Unity creators were downloaded more than five billion times per month in 2020. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.

Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations or accommodations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

L'opportunité

L'équipe Unity Solutions Games est un groupe de conseillères et de conseillers spécialisés dans le développement de logiciels et l'art technique. Dotés d'une expertise approfondie de la plateforme Unity, ils ont pour principal objectif d'aider nos clients à améliorer leurs projets et leurs processus internes et à résoudre des problèmes techniques complexes. Pour ce faire, nous proposons une série de services de conseil et de développement à court et à long terme, dont la durée est comprise entre une semaine et dix-huit mois, voire plus.

Nos clients comprennent aussi bien des petits développeur(se)s indépendants que des marques mondialement reconnues. Ils ont besoin d'optimiser leurs pipelines artistiques, d'atteindre leurs objectifs graphiques et d'obtenir des conseils pertinents sur la meilleure façon d'utiliser Unity. Vous êtes curieux(se), habile avec la technologie, passionné(e) par les rendus visuels et soucieux(se) de la clientèle? Ce poste est fait pour vous.

Au quotidien, vous aurez à interagir avec les clients, à trouver des réponses, à élaborer des solutions et des exemples, et à accomplir le nécessaire afin d'assurer le succès de leurs projets.

Ce rôle peut impliquer des déplacements périodiques chez les clients et vers d'autres bureaux de Unity (jusqu'à 25 % de votre temps). Les voyages sont subordonnés à vos besoins, à vos responsabilités et aux politiques sanitaires locales.

Nous sommes déterminés à maintenir une équipe diversifiée, et nous accueillons et encourageons des candidat(e)s aux expériences et aux parcours multiples.

Ce que vous allez faire

  • Pousser la qualité des graphismes à leur plus haut niveau, en tenant compte des contraintes de la plateforme cible
  • Enquêter, établir le profil, suggérer des améliorations de performance et optimiser le processus de rendu des projets des clients
  • Créer des échantillons de nuanceurs, de matériaux et de techniques de rendu pour nos partenaires ou les clients de Unity en général, en tenant compte des méthodologies de qualité
  • Développer et maintenir le pipeline et le processus de la production artistique en rédigeant des scripts et des outils qui aideront les artistes à créer des contenus
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les développeur(se)s pour créer de nouvelles fonctionnalités ou améliorer celles qui existent déjà

Ce que nous recherchons

  • Une expérience dans l'écriture et l'optimisation de nuanceurs pour les moteurs de rendu en temps réel et l'utilisation d'outils comme Max, Maya, Blender ou Houdini à titre professionnel. Une compréhension de HLSL, de C# ou de langages de script.
  • Une compréhension approfondie des passes de rendu, de l'éclairage et des effets de post-traitement
  • Une connaissance des outils de profilage, notamment Pix, Nsight, Render Doc ou Snapdragon Profiler
  • D'excellentes aptitudes à la communication et une capacité à travailler efficacement sur des projets partagés avec des développeur(se)s, des concepteurs, des artistes, des testeurs et d'autres développeurs
  • Plus de cinq ans d'expérience dans le développement de jeux vidéo avec des titres livrés sur PC, sur console ou sur appareil mobile

Vous avez peut-être également

  • Une expérience avec Unity, Unreal, CryEngine ou d'autres moteurs de jeux 3D
  • Une expérience dans la sous-traitance

La vie chez Unity

Unity (NYSE: U) est la plateforme la plus utilisée au monde pour la création et l'exécution interactive de contenu 3D en temps réel (RT3D). Des créateur(rice)s, notamment des développeur(se)s de jeux vidéo, des artistes, des architectes, des concepteur(rice)s automobiles, des cinéastes et bien d'autres professionnel(le)s, utilisent Unity pour donner vie à leurs projets. Unity constitue la base sur lesquelles sont créés les contenus numériques les plus remarquables au monde. Plus précisément, la plateforme de Unity offre un ensemble complet de solutions logicielles pour créer, exécuter et monétiser du contenu interactif 2D et 3D en temps réel pour les téléphones mobiles, les tablettes, les ordinateurs, les consoles et les appareils de réalité augmentée et de réalité virtuelle.

Au quatrième trimestre de l'année 2021, Unity comptait en moyenne 3,9 milliards d'utilisateurs finaux actifs mensuels ayant consommé du contenu créé ou exploité au moyen de ses solutions. Les applications développées par ces créateurs ont été téléchargées en moyenne cinq milliards de fois par mois en 2021. Pour en savoir davantage, veuillez consulter le site www.unity.com.

Unity est un employeur axé sur l'égalité des chances qui s'engage à favoriser un environnement inclusif et innovateur avec les meilleurs employés. Par conséquent, nous fournissons des opportunités d'emploi sans tenir compte de l'âge, la race, la couleur, l'ascendance, l'origine nationale, la religion, le handicap, le sexe, l'identité sexuelle ou l'expression, l'orientation sexuelle ou tout autre statut protégé. S'il y a des préparatifs ou des ajustements que nous pouvons faire afin de vous aider à avoir une expérience d'entrevue confortable et positive, veuillez-nous le faire savoir.

Les chasseurs de têtes et les agences de recrutement ne peuvent pas soumettre résumes/CV par ce site Web ou directement aux superviseurs. Unity n'accepte pas des chasseurs de têtes non sollicités et des résumés (CV) d'agence. Unity ne payera pas d'honoraires à aucune agence tierce ou entreprise qui n'a pas signé d'ententes avec Unity.

#LI-TY1 #SEN

title: VFX Producer
description:
Company Description


As a company founded and run by an artist, it's our mission to provide talented artists with the freedom and resources they need to deliver quality work and to thrive in a fun and creative environment.


Job Description


The VFX Producer ensures proper management of the budget and production schedule for every show for which they are responsible. Working with various departments, the VFX Producer ensures ongoing adherence to the schedule and budget established between production and the client.

This includes working with the VFX Supervisor and other Supervisors to establish and communicate plans and milestones for each project, communicating with clients on changes and closely following project budgets.

Main responsibilities:

  • In collaboration with the VFX Supervisor and Business Development, participate in the evaluation of costs and bidding for potential projects;
  • In conjunction with the VFX Supervisor, create a strategy and establish a global vision that will be applied throughout the VFX project, ensuring client satisfaction, cost efficiency and profit generation;
  • Communicate regularly with clients on the status of projects, creating a positive and collaborative working relationship;
  • Recommend and provide solutions and bids for new shots or client changes throughout the project all while ensuring respect of deadlines and budgets;
  • Oversee scheduling and preparation of project plans, including performance targets and milestones. Initiate, approve and budget overtime, as needed;
  • In consultation with departments, assign key talent to projects, ensuring the right mix of skills and experience to meet the project requirements. Confirm any additional necessary resources needed throughout the completion of projects;
  • Responsible for supervising the progress and efficiency of projects, keeping a thorough tracking of the schedule and budget, ensuring Shotgun is up to date at all times. Ensure it is in line with the initial quote, the project plan and that it meets client requirements;
  • Prepare any budget reports that may be required. Forecast scheduling and budgeting issues along with client changes that may arise.
  • Maintain regular communication with the Production team on all necessary information relating to the project;
  • Ensure in-person turn-overs with artists and the VFX team are completed by the Supervisors;
  • Perform mid and post-mortem meetings and assessments, identify areas for improvement and ensure that all issues are addressed;
  • Provide leadership to drive continuous improvement, make recommendations of best practices, suggest ways to improve, design processes to increase efficiency and ensure implementation.
  • Mentor members of their team by providing training and sharing knowledge. Communicate any specific training needs to the Head of Department. May participate in preparing training materials or giving group training sessions;
  • Review the performance of their production team and ensure that they receive feedback on a regular basis through the mid and post mortem process. Conduct annual performance reviews and make recommendations for salary reviews;
  • In conjunction with Department Managers, responsible for the management of performance of their production team including deciding on promotions (levels and/or positions), disciplinary or performance issues, and terminations.
  • Actively monitor the work climate in his/her team, taking steps to encourage and ensure the maintenance of a positive work environment and adherence to company values;
  • Ensure VFX Breakdowns are created for every project;
  • Positively represent Rodeo FX within the VFX and related communities, both locally and in the worldwide market, to further grow the company’s reputation as an industry leader.

Qualifications
  • Minimum of 10 years of production experience in visual effects;
  • Fluent in English, written and spoken. Functional french (or willingness to learn);
  • Excellent knowledge of GSuite and Microsoft Office;
  • Strong knowledge of Shotgun project management software;
  • Excellent knowledge of the VFX Production process from concept to delivery;
  • Excellent organizational and planning skills;
  • Excellent sense of prioritization and respect of deadlines and budgets;
  • Must be available for occasional international travel.

Additional Information
  • Full-time, Permanent Contract;
  • 5 paid sick days;
  • 2 additional statutory holidays in the winter holidays;
  • Group Insurance, access to Dialogue online support and to an Employee Assistance Program (EAP);
  • RRSP with employer contribution;
  • Discounts with Bixi, Nautilus Plus and many more local businesses.

Diversity is a core value at Rodeo FX. We are passionate about building and sustaining an inclusive and equitable work environment where diversity is celebrated and valued. We believe every member on our team enriches our work by exposing us to a broad range of ways to perceive and interact with the world, identify challenges, and to design and deliver projects.

title: NARS Counter Manager
description:
LocationLAVAL,Quebec,Canada
CategoryStores
Job OpenedMarch 19th, 2022
EducationHigh School Diploma/GED
Job Number220001RG
Job TypeFull-Time
RemoteNo

job description

What This Position is All About
You are a friendly, customer-focused individual who understands the importance of always being ready to serve the customer. You are a team player who has earned the respect of your peers through commitment, partnership and effective communication. You organize and prioritize your workload in a way that always puts the customer first and delivers the operational standards that are required. In a dynamic fast-paced environment you are self-motivated, adaptable and decisive ensuring the best outcome for the customer and the business.
Who You Are:
  • Acts with customers in mind, great networking and relationship management.
  • Puts the needs of internal and external customers first. Seeks customer information when improving products and services.
  • Often goes above and beyond their goals. Is consistently a top performer and elevates the performance of others
  • Sees ahead clearly, is knowledgeable and has a capability for a big picture perspective.
You Also Have:
  • Knowledge of skin/body care treatments with 2-5 years of work experience in Cosmetics
  • Certified Make-up Artist
  • Must have experience in a commission and clientele selling environment
  • Full flexibility with schedule (including evenings and weekends)
As The Counter Manager of Cosmetics, You Will:
  • Analyze business metrics to develop action plans that address opportunities and positively impact the business
  • Build your client base through the Preferred Customer Program
  • Observe staff on the selling floor and their interaction with customers, co-workers and overall customer service level
  • Achieve daily / weekly / monthly sales goals based on the department's goal and are expected to track their sales
  • Deliver World-class service through client communication, product knowledge, fashion direction and solution-based selling at the highest-level
  • Work with Vendor Partners to maximize sales opportunities through suggestive selling, store events / seminars and wardrobe clients
How Often You May Travel:
  • NA
Your Life and Career at HBC:
  • Be part of a world-class team; work with an adventurous spirit; think and act like an owner- operator!
  • Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities, from retail to supply chain, to digital or corporate.
  • A culture that promotes a healthy, fulfilling work/life balance
  • Benefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, vision and dental).
  • An amazing employee discount
Thank you for your interest with HBC. We look forward to reviewing your application.
HBC provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, HBC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
HBC welcomes all applicants for this position. Should you be individually selected to participate in an assessment or selection process, accommodations are available upon request in relation to the materials or processes to be used.

title: Hair Stylist
description:
You are an artist. You also don't like to be limited on what you can do. Where you can go. What you can become.

As a stylist, you also have options heck, the beauty industry is full of opportunities. That's part of why you became a stylist. Make sure you invest your talent where you know you will be successful.

When you join the team at SmartStyle, you'll start making money on day one. Our SmartStyle salon is conveniently located within Walmart store which means over 5,000 people walking by the salon every single day! You will have an endless opportunity to build your business and earn commission on retail sales!

And that's just the start of the list of why you should already be here. There's also this:
* Work-life balance with a flexible schedule, including evenings and weekends.
* Ongoing training and development opportunities to keep you on-trend with the latest styles and techniques.
* Product and tool discounts to help maximize your skill and creativity.
* Clips, cuts, colors, texture, styles, and waxing you get to do it all.
* A salon environment with peers who lift each other up.
* Benefit options are available.
Make the move to SmartStyle by Regis and take your career further than you thought possible!

SmartStyle franchise is proud to be part of Regis Corporation, the world's largest and leading hair salon company, dedicated to making people look good and feel beautiful.

Candidate must be Licensed (Certificate of Qualification) in the Province of Ontario or nearing the completion of an accredited cosmetology school.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent, Apprenticeship

Salary: From $14.25 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Commission pay
  • Overtime pay
  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Day shift

Work remotely:

  • No

title: CG Supervisor
description:
ABOUT THE JOB

BRON Digital, is a state-of-the-art virtual production and service company, that utilizes the Unreal Engine to develop and produce long-form animation for series television, short-form content, and motion pictures. This division leverages BRON’s extensive experience producing traditional CGI animation to apply and adapt the best practices of linear animation pipelines and marry those with Unreal Engine centered, virtual production workflows. The move allows BRON to broaden and expand its production and produce high quality content with much faster turnarounds.

As we are ramping up for our third BRON Digital Animated series, we are looking for a CG Supervisor to join our team.

This position is fully remote.

Requirements

Role & Responsibilities

  • Collaboratively define the creative vision of the digital content, with the Director, Production Designer and other show creative leadership.
  • Work with artists and engineers to implement and optimize the necessary materials, particle systems, procedural systems and post-process effects.
  • Define and drive the execution strategy of the production.
  • Broker and decide creative and technical choices made in order to deliver the best production quality within the allocated budget and schedule.
  • Work with departmental creative leads to define how to execute the creative goals.
  • Plan artistic execution of deliverables for each department.
  • Execute a project through the production pipeline successfully.
  • Evaluate the creative requirements of the project, determine the technical implications and makes high-impact operational decisions.
  • Work with the Pipeline Tools group on project-specific strategic initiatives for new tools, processes, or methodologies and ensures timely delivery of those initiatives relative to the milestones of a production.
  • Study patterns and trends, identifies current technical challenges, and forecasts future requirements for critical pipeline resources such as network storage, render nodes, and software licensing.
  • Manage time and balance priorities, often amidst the pressures of busy, deadline-driven production.
  • Demonstrate ability to make creative and aesthetic judgment calls with a strong aesthetic sense.
  • Promote a positive environment in the workplace.

Qualifications

  • 10+ years in Visual Effects and 3D Animation
  • Bachelor of CS or Fine Arts related field or equivalent experience
  • Strong preference for development experience with Unreal Engine 4
  • Solid previous experience as a CG Supervisor a must
  • Experience in leadership roles in Visual Effects
  • Strong communication skills
  • Strong artistic eye
  • Strong technical skills
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Proven digital production track record on high end 3D Animation/Visual Effects

title: Senior Character Artist
description:
Who are Timbre Games?
Timbre Games are a Vancouver based early-stage game development studio with over 100 years of founding leadership. We believe culture drives creative, where we draw on community and diversity to build truly unique experiences.

Our mission is to build a world class network of Game Studios; to provide accessible awesomeness to our players, to our team, to the world.

Everyone has a story. Come write yours!
Who you are:
As a human, you’re a visionary explorer, a pursuer of fun, and focused on building community. You see an opportunity within games to do more and to have more than “ just a job”. You’ve had unique experiences both at work and personally that have expanded your curiosities to seek the root of a problem, to seek out issues, and work with people to explore solutions! Your experiences have made you who you are, and that has led to you understanding the importance of diversity in both thinking and in people. Oh, and games… You may like those, too!

Who you are at work:
You lead with humility in all that you do. You showcase passion for your craft through the work you produce and the service you give to others. It brings a smile to your face seeing concepts turn into beautiful 3D art. You connect with people through humour and curiosity and these elements make up some of the foundation in your approach to communication.
At Timbre, we take mentoring seriously, and as a lead, we want you to as well. We are here to make amazing games and grow the next generation of game industry people – two goals that are at the heart of who we are.

What impact will you have as a Senior Character Artist at Timbre:

  • You’ll be hands-on and involved in all aspects of creating visually stunning 3D characters: modelling, rigging, texturing
  • You’ll work cross functionally with all your fellow Timbreoos to identify priorities and produce characters that enhance player experience
  • You’ll identify solutions in our production pipeline and work with Tech Art to improve tools and pipelines
  • Your passion for creation will be infectious across Timbre Games and elevate the team from prototyping through production
  • Iterate artistic styles and support your reports to adhere to those principles and standards
  • Work closely with recruitment to improve our recruitment process and bring in value aligned people
  • Onboard and nurture current and future Art teammates

Your track record might include:

  • 5+ years character development experience
  • Previous experience as an Intermediate Artist within a game production environment.
  • A portfolio of delivered digital projects and games that showcases quality and diversity of character modelling skills
  • Highly skilled communication, both verbally and digitally, to different disciplines within the studio as well as external partners where required
  • Strong modelling, rigging, UV and material skills with an ability to create high-poly as well as engine efficient assets
  • Taking 2D concept art and realizing it in a 3D software tool
  • Ability to give as well as embrace constructive feedback and iterate efficiently
  • Ability to scope workload and identify efficiencies
  • Experience working with a team where people come first and culture isn’t defined by a cheesy poster on the wall
About Timbre Games:
Timbre Games are headed up by industry veterans in beautiful Vancouver, BC. Our experience stretches through mobile to AAA (think Gears of War, the Sims, SSX, FIFA, Age of Empires, among others!). We’re excited to build a ‘playoff ready’ studio that is centered on creativity, humour and diversity. We can’t wait to share our first project that we’re secretly working away on, and we welcome your application with open arms as we grow a world-class studio here in Canada!

BENEFITS:

  • Competitive salary & benefits
  • Annual bonus & RRSP matching
  • 20 days paid vacation, plus Christmas week off
  • Remote / Work from home / Flexible hours
  • Open door policy with direct access to leadership
  • Industry veterans with a wealth of knowledge to share
Timbre Game’s Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
Timbre recognizes the importance of creating an environment where all our employees feel included and empowered. We believe that culture drives creative, we value each employee’s unique experiences and perspectives across our company and recognize that it is both the smart and right thing to foster diversity, equity, and inclusion within our organization.

By diversifying our workforce, increasing equality, and ensuring that our individual differences are valued, we are better able to deliver an experience that reflects, inspires, and connects with our audience... because games are for everyone!
DO I NEED TO MEET ALL CRITERIA TO APPLY?
Definitely not! If you share our mission of creating games that are accessible for everyone, we’d love to meet you and see what is possible!

If you believe you are who we’re looking for, contact us at: work@timbregames.com

Please upload a link to your portfolio/github for us to review if applicable!

title: On-Call MAC Artist - MAC Richmond - Richmond, BC
description:
Position Summary

As one of our highly skilled make-up artists you will combine your creative and technical expertise and passion for people to provide a welcoming, inspirational and personalized in-store experience which educates and delights our customers.


You will also like working as part of a high performing team to create impact with in-store events and to ensure that the store always achieves our high standards of visual merchandising to stand out against our competitors.


If you are a dynamic self-starter looking for a progressive career opportunity then this could be the perfect role for you and the first step of your career with a leader in prestige beauty.
While certification in make -up artistry and/or previous retail make up experience is desirable we also welcome applicants with amateur level experience.


As a leader in prestige beauty with a culture that values diversity of thought and people, we offer excellent training and development and a competitive remuneration and benefits package.


Qualifications
Qualifications
  • While a qualification in make-up artistry/previous retail make up experience is preferred, we welcome applicants with amateur level experience who are able to demonstrate a high level of creative and technical expertise
  • All applicants must be able to demonstrate the ability to provide inspirational, authentic and personalized customer service
  • Ability to work retail hours including days, nights, weekends and special events in a fast-paced work environment
  • Previous experience with retail point-of-sale software
  • Applicants must be able to provide proof of right to live and work in the country if invited to attend for interview


Job: Retail - Store
Primary Location: Americas-CA-BC-Richmond
Job Type: Standard
Schedule: Contingent
Shift: On Call
Job Number: 226297

We are an equal opportunity employer. Minorities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities are available on request.

title: Rotoanim Artist - Senior
description:
We are looking for a Senior Rotoanim Artist to join our team in Vancouver!

Do you want to influence the future of matchmove and be a part of a team that appreciates the craft of Matchmove + Rotoanim in all aspects, come join the family!

This is an exciting and rare opportunity to be part of the formative years of a new studio in Vancouver. Our constantly increasing projects range from feature films to commercials. You will be working with artists with a wealth of experience on various productions. We are looking for talented artists who have the drive to keep up and contribute to this quickly growing company.

Check out our Youtube Track channel full of awesome tutorials!
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCjm__bwnllKzKy1qA_RnV8w

We offer extended health benefits, flexible hours, and an open creative environment for all our staff.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Ability to Rotoanim a 3D character rig precisely to match actors. Including facial animation
  • Decent Camera/Object matchmove. Ability to hand-key cameras/objects in Maya
  • Ability to model environments with or without lidars, measurements, and camera information. UV objects when necessary.
  • Strong layout skills, including camera track overs.
  • Meticulous nature with a self-critical eye, and high standards. Able to QC own shots
  • Strong problem-solving and identifying solutions without guidance
  • Ability to give accurate time estimates as well as provide bidding hours with production
  • Highly motivated, and be able to work with the entire team/production. Mentor all artists, especially junior artists
  • Communicate clear and concise issues to the Matchmove Leads & Supervisor
  • To be able to follow directions and take ownership of your tasks.
  • Maintain a professional level of knowledge about current developments in matchmove tools for computer graphics
  • Work well under pressure. Excellent time management and work to tight deadlines. Handle client revisions in a timely manner
  • Positive attitude and excitement for new challenges in an intense production environment
  • Team player who excels in a collaborative environment

Education and Experience

  • Degree in computer graphics or a related subject
  • 5+ years experience as a Rotoanim Artist
  • Proven ability to manage and mentor a team
  • Expert knowledge in focal lengths, film backs, lens distortions, rolling shutter etc.
  • Decent level skills in Syntheyes and/or 3de
  • Strong Knowledge of Maya
  • Basic Nuke
  • Soft tracking a plus (vertice animation with no rig)
  • The ability to script in MEL and Python is a plus
  • MMSolver a plus
  • Syntheyes - Geo H a plus
  • Keentools a plus, will be required to learn

Required software knowledge

  • Maya
  • Nuke
  • Shotgun

Recommended software knowledge

  • Syntheyes and/or 3de
  • MM Solver
  • Keentools
  • Russian3dScanner
  • Blender
  • Python/Mel

Why work at Track VFX?

  • Benefits after 3 months! (contracts must be 6 months or longer to be eligible)
  • We pay overtime after 40 hours!
  • Only Matchmove company in North America
  • Training seminars. Provide many in-house tutorials
  • Great clients and ability to work closely with them!
  • Amazing artists and supportive production team
  • Ability to work closely with head Supervisors
  • Help make an impact in the future of Matchmove
  • Career Progression
APPLICATION

Please apply once. Only re-apply if your details have recently changed.
