title: Counter Manager, Clinique
description:
LocationPICKERING,Ontario,Canada
CategoryStores
Job OpenedMarch 29th, 2022
EducationHigh School Diploma/GED
Job Number220001X4
Job TypeFull-Time
RemoteNo

job description

What This Position is All About
You are a friendly, customer-focused individual who understands the importance of always being ready to serve the customer. You are a team player who has earned the respect of your peers through commitment, partnership and effective communication. You organize and prioritize your workload in a way that always puts the customer first and delivers the operational standards that are required. In a dynamic fast-paced environment you are self-motivated, adaptable and decisive ensuring the best outcome for the customer and the business.
Who You Are:
  • Acts with customers in mind, great networking and relationship management.
  • Puts the needs of internal and external customers first. Seeks customer information when improving products and services.
  • Often goes above and beyond their goals. Is consistently a top performer and elevates the performance of others
  • Sees ahead clearly, is knowledgeable and has a capability for a big picture perspective.
You Also Have:
  • Knowledge of skin/body care treatments with 2-5 years of work experience in Cosmetics
  • Certified Make-up Artist
  • Must have experience in a commission and clientele selling environment
  • Full flexibility with schedule (including evenings and weekends)
As The Counter Manager of Cosmetics, You Will:
  • Analyze business metrics to develop action plans that address opportunities and positively impact the business
  • Build your client base through the Preferred Customer Program
  • Observe staff on the selling floor and their interaction with customers, co-workers and overall customer service level
  • Achieve daily / weekly / monthly sales goals based on the department's goal and are expected to track their sales
  • Deliver World-class service through client communication, product knowledge, fashion direction and solution-based selling at the highest-level
  • Work with Vendor Partners to maximize sales opportunities through suggestive selling, store events / seminars and wardrobe clients
How Often You May Travel:
  • NA
Your Life and Career at HBC:
  • Be part of a world-class team; work with an adventurous spirit; think and act like an owner- operator!
  • Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities, from retail to supply chain, to digital or corporate.
  • A culture that promotes a healthy, fulfilling work/life balance
  • Benefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, vision and dental).
  • An amazing employee discount
Thank you for your interest with HBC. We look forward to reviewing your application.
HBC provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, HBC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
HBC welcomes all applicants for this position. Should you be individually selected to participate in an assessment or selection process, accommodations are available upon request in relation to the materials or processes to be used.

title: Surfacing Artist (Technical)
description:
Are you a Technical Surfacing Artist interested in engaging in technical troubleshooting, developing workflows and prototyping complex looks?!

Surfacing Artists at Animal Logic are responsible for giving models the visual surface qualities that make them appear believable.

Surfacing at Animal Logic Vancouver can encompass texture painting, procedural texturing, building shading networks, grooming and occasional sculpting or UV layout, on animated feature films.

What you'll get to do:

  • Delve into the technical side of surfacing, supporting the creation of high-quality stylized or photo-realistic assets that meet the technical and aesthetic standards of the project
  • Troubleshoot issues in areas such as shaders, renders and surfacing tools, and pro-actively escalate tickets as required
  • Provide technical solutions to visual problems
  • Create hand-painted or procedural textures, to the necessary level of detail for production assets
  • Create procedural rigs for grooming and instancing
  • Work closely with the Lead and Supervisor to help achieve the project's visual goals
  • Take direction from the Surfacing Lead, and present solutions or questions to pro-actively improve asset quality
  • Create and update technical documentation for surfacing workflows
  • Share knowledge and communicate openly with other artists on your team
  • Participate in reviews as required
  • Assist with resource management and project clean up on an ongoing basis

What you bring:

Experience
  • 3+ years' experience on feature films (vfx), animated features, or high-end episodics, with a focus on surfacing
  • 3+ years' experience working on high quality texturing, shading and surfacing (preferably on photo-realistic material)
  • Technical background with the ability to troubleshoot surfacing related issues, such as shaders, renders, and surfacing tools
  • Production experience with Houdini, and a proven ability to create HDAs
  • Proven ability in surfacing and shading, and an interest in technical surfacing and proceduralism
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • A passion for making beautiful looking cg assets by combining strong visual and technical skills
Software/Technical
  • Production experience with Houdini
  • Production experience in Maya, Mari and Nuke
  • Experience in a modern raytracing package
  • Thorough understanding of, and experience working in, a physically based shading system
  • Proven ability with node-based procedural shading, grooming and instancing
  • Proven ability with node-based or procedural grooming and/or instancing tools
  • BONUS: Knowledge or experience with USD pipelines
  • BONUS: Working experience with Python and/or VEX
  • BONUS: Experience with shader writing
  • BONUS: Experience with Substance Designer and/or sculpting tools (Mudbox)
  • An understanding of lighting and colour theory in feature film production
Soft Skills
  • Excellence in problem solving and balancing quick turnaround with long term quality
  • Strong written and verbal English language skills
  • Strong communication skills, and the ability to efficiently organise and prioritise work across multiple areas
  • Ability to work solo as well as collaboratively within a team environment
  • Ability to take direction and feedback and apply this to assets or shots; be willing to show WIP and take feedback

What you should demonstrate in your demo reel/portfolio:

  • Feature animation quality texturing, shading, lookdev, and grooming
  • Complex assets that you've surfaced using HDAs that you've created
  • Excellent attention to detail, with strong visual skills

title: newDevelopment Animator
description:
• Must be willing to relocate to British Columbia.


-


ICON Creative Studio is Canada’s largest independently owned animation entertainment company located in the historic Gastown district of Vancouver, BC Canada with design, storyboarding, modeling, rigging, animation, technical finaling, lighting, visual effects, and compositing artists alongside creative and management teams.


Known for our quality, efficiency, and timely deliveries, ICON has partnered alongside distributors, broadcasters, and streaming platforms around the world to help create, realize and produce noteworthy content.


ICON operates from a holistic philosophy that leverages individual skill sets to maximize production efficiency on the floor while maintaining an optimal balance of creativity and quality on-screen.-


-


During this challenging time, we have successfully transitioned to a virtual studio. The health of our employees is always our priority. We will see you soon!


-

Why work at ICON?


At ICON we constantly invest in raising the bar of our productions and fostering our people. If you are a passionate artist capable of sharing success with others, we'd like to hear from you!

  • Join the fastest growing CG Animation studio in Vancouver
  • Work in a safe environment. The company has successfully transitioned into a virtual studio via a high-speed Teradici connection
  • Work on top feature episodic CG franchises for leading streaming platforms (Netflix, Disney+, Apple TV+, Amazon, etc.)
  • Work with a diverse group of artists from all over the world who have come to BC to join our expanding studio
  • Use all of the latest tools and Softwares
  • We uphold a premium standard of quality across all of our production
  • We hire for the long term and give artists the opportunity to grow, get promoted and take on as much responsibility as they can manage
  • We offer flexibility and autonomy
  • We facilitate requests and make changes in a timely manner
  • We support PR applications
  • We offer a generous benefits package for all employees

-


DEVELOPMENT ANIMATOR


Responsibilities

  • Help establish show look and drive personality for new characters
  • Create unique, high quality, character specific cycles that will be used in production. Cycles must be highly polished and demonstrate a strong understanding of body mechanics and physics.
  • Build studio library poses that highlight each character and their personality. (Hand poses, Facial expressions, Full body poses, unique moves/transitions/mounts/dismounts, etc.)
  • Build crowd systems and accompanying animation
  • Watch animatics in advance to identify and create episode specific animation
  • Work closely with the rigging team to ensure all rigs are consistent both in quality, and naming convention. This requires regular testing and feedback on all rigs.
  • Work closely with the Animation Directors and Series Supervisor to ensure your work is meeting their needs, as well as the clients.
  • Assist with scene set up for highly complex sequences

Requirements

  • 2+ years work experience in 3D animation using MAYA in a series or film production.
  • A strong background as a Mid and/or Senior Animator
  • Have experience animating in various styles (Cartoony, Realism, Action, Acting, etc.)
  • Quadruped experience recommended
  • Comfortable with filming reference footage and applying that reference to your animation correctly.
  • Ability to work within an established pipeline and learn to use custom tools
  • Ability to understand and interpret storyboards, and feedback from clients, directors and supervisors.
  • Must possess strong time management skills
  • Can work well both independently and on a team and communicate concerns professionally and effectively.
  • Game experience/cycles experience an asset

-

ICON Creative Studio is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.


  • Ask us about our generous benefits program.

title: Previz-Layout Artist - VFX -- Artiste de Previsualisation-La...
description:
Une version française va suivre


The Previz and Layout Artist creates high quality virtual staging, blocking and camera work that makes the foundation of a successful shot and/or sequence of shots, across a variety of styles and projects


Responsibilties:

  • Collaborates with the Head of Matchmove/Tracking Layout and Previz to set up a layout set to define scale and location of a scene, as well as setting up the renders to match Cinesite's level of quality.
  • Works from given data "storyboards and/or animatics" in order to convey to a full 3d masterscene.
  • Works from simple briefs to get the initial iterations of previz.
  • Delivers camera blocking, staging, and overall ease of work with different camera rigs in 3d.
  • Identifies any creative or technical points that might affect production and communicating it to the HOD.
  • Analyzes and assesses the work needed and the deadlines, communicating any points to the HOD/production.
  • Optimizes, refines and corrects geometries/assets to meet the VFX Sup artistic requirements.
  • Interprets references/concept art to prototype and iterate models based on feedback.
  • Finesses of cameras at animation stage where required.
  • Maintains consistent quality, style and continuity, both visually and technically throughout the project.

Requirements:

  • 4 to 5 years of experience in previz and layout with accomplished examples
  • Great visual storytelling skills and a well grounded understanding of the language of the camera
  • Strong knowledge of framing, perspective, lenses, coverage, continuity, camera movement, blocking
  • Autodesk Maya experience is essential and Maya camera sequencer a plus.
  • Good communication skills and ability to work interactively with production and other departments to solve production challenges.
  • Strong understanding of cinematography, with a sharp eye for composition.
  • Preferred experience working with mocap data.
  • Experience with Postvis/techviz experience is an asset
  • Unreal experience is a plus.

-


L'artiste de Prévisualisation et Layout est en charge de créer une mise en scène virtuelle de haute qualité, un travail de blocage et de caméra qui constitue la base d'un plan et/ou d'une séquence de plans réussis pour une variété de styles et de projets


Votre rôle

  • Collabore avec le Responsable de Matchmove/Tracking Layout et Prévisualisation pour mettre en place les mises en scène permettant de définir l'échelle et l'emplacement d'une scène, ainsi que pour paramétrer les rendus afin qu'ils correspondent au niveau de qualité de Cinésite.
  • Travaille à partir de "story-boards et/ou animatiques" afin de transmettre à un masterscène 3D complète
  • Travaille à partir de simples briefs pour obtenir les premières itérations de prévisualisation
  • Réalise le blocage des caméras et la mise en scène générale avec différents appareils photo en 3D
  • Identifie et communique au responsable de département tous les points créatifs ou techniques qui pourraient affecter la production
  • Analyse et évalue le travail nécessaire et les délais, en communiquant tous les points au responsable de la production
  • Optimise, affine et corrige les géométries/actifs pour répondre aux exigences artistiques du Superviseur VFX
  • Interprète les références/concepts artistiques pour prototyper et itérer les modèles en fonction des retours
  • Affine les caméras au stade de l'animation si nécessaire.
  • Maintient une qualité, un style et une continuité constants, tant sur le plan visuel que technique, tout au long du projet.

Compétences souhaitées

  • 4 à 5 ans d'expérience dans le domaine de la prévisualisation et de la mise en scène (layout) avec des exemples de production concrets
  • Grande capacité de narration visuelle et bonne compréhension du langage de la caméra
  • Connaissance approfondie du cadrage, de la perspective, des objectifs, de la continuité, du mouvement et du blocage de la caméra,
  • L'expérience d'Autodesk Maya est essentielle et le séquenceur de caméra Maya un plus.
  • Bonnes aptitudes à communiquer et capacité à travailler de manière interactive avec la production et d'autres départements pour résoudre les problèmes de production.
  • Solide compréhension de la cinématographie, avec un œil aiguisé pour la composition d’images
  • Expérience de travail avec des données Mocap.
  • Expérience avec Postvis/Techviz est un atout
  • Connaissance de Unreal un plus.

title: newVFX Assistant
description:
Company Description


Part of the great Rodeo FX family, BLVD is an innovative, award-winning sound studio, trusted partner to the world's most celebrated businesses, agencies, artists and entertainment companies. BLVD is made up of a growing creative team of sound engineers, music composers and audio producers.


Job Description


Under the direction of the VFX Supervisor of Rodeo FX's Advertising Department, the role of the VFX Assistant is to prepare the elements for each step of a project (colourization, online) and to ensure that the sessions are always ready for the artists and to assist them, if needed, during the project.

We are looking for someone where this is clearly not their first Rodeo! This person must be able to demonstrate experience and knowledge in the discipline of offline editing but not limited to it. The person will act as a mentor for the other editors by providing all the technical and creative support necessary for the editors and the projects entrusted to him.

A true professional chameleon, this person will be able to adapt to the needs of each project as requirements change and progress. The VFX Assistant will have a strong desire for innovation and a passion for new technologies.

More specifically, the main responsibilities of the position are as follows:

  • Preparation of colourization sessions, online and during offline sessions;
  • Receiving, importing and filing media;
  • Verification and technical validation of files;
  • Follow up on the progress of the post-production stages of a project (sound mixing, online and colourization).

You are a person Who Is:

  • Cooler than a Popsicle: you're calm, cool and collected and stressful situations don't scare you. You stay highly motivated and productive under pressure;
  • Who always thinks outside the box: you make organizational and creative contributions throughout the project by communicating effectively with the team;
  • With a high reliability factor: you must be able to accept direction and meet deadlines. People can trust you to get the job done as planned. You must be able to work independently and as part of a team, ensuring effective communication;
  • Reaches for the stars: ambitious and self-motivated, you strive to constantly push the boundaries of your craft by demonstrating a positive attitude and a willingness to constantly improve and learn.

Qualifications
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in a similar position;
  • Excellent knowledge of the following tools: Resolve, Autodesk Flame, Adobe suite, Avid, FinalCut, and/or similar software;
  • Knowledge of Nuke, an asset;
  • Fluency in spoken and written French and functional English

Additional Information
  • Full time permanent position;
  • Full group insurance;
  • Dialogue platform: access to a virtual health care program;
  • EAP: Employee Assistance Program;
  • Group RRSP with employer contribution;
  • And much more!

If you are interested in this position, please send us your application via the form.

Diversity is a core value at Rodeo FX. We are passionate about building and sustaining an inclusive and equitable work environment where diversity is celebrated and valued. We believe every member on our team enriches our work by exposing us to a broad range of ways to perceive and interact with the world, identify challenges, and to design and deliver projects.

title: Technical Artist: Animation
description:
At Rockstar Games, we create world-class entertainment experiences.

A career at Rockstar Games is about being part of a team working on some of the most creatively rewarding and ambitious projects to be found in any entertainment medium. You would be welcomed to a dedicated and inclusive environment where you can learn, and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.

Rockstar Games is looking for an experienced and passionate Technical Artist focused on Animation to help research and develop new technology for future titles as well as improve on existing technology and tools. This role will involve the development of new approaches and workflows within the scope of animation including core animation as well as facial motion capture (facial animation, tracking, and recognition). A person taking on this role will also be involved in improving pipelines currently in place as well as managing workflows for the very large number of files and assets that make up our games.

The ideal candidate will have at least 2 years of game or VFX industry experience in a similar role working in at least one of the typical "industry-standard" DCC packages (such as Motionbuilder or Maya), possessing a good foundation and core knowledge of object-oriented programming, and a strong background working on tools for animation. Bonus points for having a solid foundation in math as well as experience working with a facial motion capture pipeline.

In addition to technical skills, it is important that a candidate holds strong soft skills and can work well in a highly cooperative environment. This position involves working together with many others in different roles and the ability to work collaboratively as a trustworthy member of the team is essential.


WHAT WE DO

  • Collaborate with tech art team(s) to build, maintain, and improve tools across multiple pipelines.
  • Interact closely with gameplay, cinematic, and facial animation teams to support all efforts.
  • Support rigging and animation pipelines, including ongoing investigation to improve facial rig and animation solving solutions.
  • Work alongside animation programmers on developing and improving runtime solutions.
  • Continually innovate while solving technical problems throughout all phases of production.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Work closely with animators, automation, and other TAs to create tools and improve pipelines.
  • Help develop and build on the facial animation and recognition pipeline.
  • Manage facial pipeline and be heavily involved in working with face assets from motion capture.
  • Develop automated solutions to help process large amounts of animation data more efficiently.
  • Create production tools to support new pipelines and future tech.
  • Write documentation for pipelines/tools created.
  • Stay current with and research new technology solutions.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Experience using 3D DCC software (Motionbuilder and/or Maya preferred).
  • Strong programming skills in Python.
  • Familiarity with coding UI using PySide/Qt.
  • Experience creating tools for animators.
  • Enthusiasm for R&D/future tech development.
  • Strong communication, self-management, and organizational skills.
  • Effective time management skills to meet deadlines.

PLUSES
(Please note that these are desirable/bonus skills and are not expected when applying to the position.)

  • Experience with facial animation, facial motion capture, and/or facial tracking.
  • Experience using source control software (such as Perforce or Git).
  • Solid foundation in math (specifically 3D math).
  • Strong knowledge of character setup and good rigging standards.
  • C#/C++ programming skills.
  • Experience using MongoDB/SQL.

HOW TO APPLY

Please apply with a resume and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the skills above. If we would like to move forward with your application, a Rockstar recruiter will reach out to you to explain next steps and guide you through the process.

Rockstar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to hiring, promoting, and compensating employees based on their qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities.

If you've got the right skills for the job, we want to hear from you. We encourage applications from all suitable candidates regardless of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, belief, or race.

title: VFX Production Coordinator
description:
Company Description


As a company founded and run by an artist, it's our mission to provide talented artists with the freedom and resources they need to deliver quality work and to thrive in a fun and creative environment.


Job Description


The VFX Coordinator is the main level of support for the entire production team throughout the course of a project, from pre-production to final delivery.

Main responsibilities:

  • Maintain show shot list. Determine, with the VFX Supervisor and VFX Producer, milestones for the project and artists and ensure they are met;
  • Maintain shot status and artist targets and be able to produce show status at all times;
  • Update all documents that allow follow up on the show status (shotlist, schedule, etc.);
  • Take, receive and disseminate internal and client shot notes;
  • Manage the flow of information and transfer of information/work between departments or with clients. Oversee the file transfer and receipt process with the Production Assistant;
  • Make sure that artists have the necessary information and elements to begin work efficiently;
  • Set and track targets for the week with the VFX Supervisor and VFX Producer. Meet with each artist assigned to the project on a daily basis to ensure they are clear on their targets, answer questions, follow-up on progress, etc.
  • Anticipate and raise any concerns about targets, deadlines, etc. based on daily artist activity;
  • Arrange, attend, and manage meetings, turnovers, reviews with VFX Supervisor and artists, ensure that all notes are transmitted to the artists;
  • Organize the dailies playlist, and take detailed notes throughout the meeting;
  • Keep artists and supervisors up to date with information – client notes, shot changes, modifications - and evaluate impact on current work. Relay information to Producer if there are anticipated schedule implications;
  • Evaluate and validate all work with VFX Supervisors to make sure they are approved, and notes are distributed to relevant crew.

Qualifications
  • Minimum of 2 years of production experience in visual effects or film;
  • Experience in an administrative position;
  • Fluent in English, written and spoken;
  • Excellent knowledge of GSuite and Microsoft Office;
  • Strong organizational skills.

Additional Information
  • Full-time, Permanent Contract;
  • 5 paid sick days;
  • 2 additional statutory holidays in the winter holidays;
  • Group Insurance, access to Dialogue online support and to an Employee Assistance Program (EAP);
  • RRSP with employer contribution;
  • Discounts with Bixi, Nautilus Plus and many more local businesses.

Diversity is a core value at Rodeo FX. We are passionate about building and sustaining an inclusive and equitable work environment where diversity is celebrated and valued. We believe every member on our team enriches our work by exposing us to a broad range of ways to perceive and interact with the world, identify challenges, and to design and deliver projects.

title: CG Supervisor
description:
Company Description


As a company founded and run by an artist, it's our mission to provide talented artists with the freedom and resources they need to deliver quality work and to thrive in a fun and creative environment.


Job Description


The CG Supervisor is responsible for all CG aspects of a show, ensuring work meets the high quality standards of Rodeo FX and the specifications of the project. Working closely with the VFX Supervisor and VFX Producer, they establish the workflow and methodology for the project, taking into consideration the technical challenges, the Rodeo FX pipeline, and the client's creative vision.

Main responsibilities:

  • In conjunction with the VFX Supervisor, take responsibility for the visual and technical quality of all CG deliverables, in accordance with Rodeo FX’s high quality standards;
  • Work with the VFX Supervisor to develop and create the visual appearance of the project;
  • Establish and maintain the workflow and methodology that will be applied throughout the project, ensuring the best creative and technical approach to meet project requirements, budgets and deadlines. Outline the technical needs that arise from the project, and suggest appropriate procedures to the VFX Sup to address them;
  • Anticipate and eliminate problems that could arise from any work tool, before they can negatively impact production. Initiate and follow-up on any tool development required, ensuring clear directives to the development team;
  • Understand and respect the requirements of the client as well as the project’s specifications, and attend Cinesync sessions;
  • In conjunction with the VFX Supervisor and Production, identify the resources needed for the project and participate in the casting of artists on projects;
  • Communicate the creative vision and objectives to their team, ensuring individual and/or team responsibility for results are understood;
  • Direct the artists in their work and closely monitor the quality of work produced. Attend dailies sessions, review assets and shots and make sure work follows proper methodology and corresponds with client’s artistic vision;
  • Resolve visual, artistic and technical issues throughout the project, working with other supervisors and escalating to the Head of Department as needed;
  • Monitor upcoming milestones and keep the VFX Supervisor and VFX Producer informed of the status of work, issues to be resolved, ramifications of problems encountered and potential solutions;
  • Assist the VFX Supervisor with final approvals for shots before they are sent out. Ensure a technical check of the visual effects is completed before delivery to the VFX Supervisor;
  • Review results of mid and post-mortem assessments, identify areas for improvement and ensure that all issues are addressed going forward. Complete mid & post mortem reviews for the artists with whom they worked directly;
  • Intervene rapidly with team members who do not meet the set objectives, ethics or work methods, by proposing solutions and clarifying expectations. Notify the Head of Department of any repetitive or serious issues;
  • Actively monitor the work climate in the team, ensure the maintenance of a positive work environment and adherence to company values;
  • Mentor members of their team by providing training and sharing knowledge. Communicate any specific training needs to the Head of Department. May participate in preparing training materials or giving group training sessions;
  • May assist the production team with bidding for shows;
  • Maintain up-to-date knowledge of their specialty and be on the lookout for the latest technological advances in methods and approaches.

Qualifications
  • Minimum of 5 years experience as a CG Artist, within the VFX industry;
  • Experience in managing a team of artists;
  • Knowledge of English and French - should be fluent in one of these languages, functional in the other;
  • Excellent understanding of the VFX production pipeline;
  • Ability to stay calm under pressure and act as a positive role model and mentor.

Additional Information
  • Full-time, Permanent Contract;
  • 5 paid sick days;
  • 2 additional statutory holidays in the winter holidays;
  • Group Insurance, access to Dialogue online support and to an Employee Assistance Program (EAP);
  • RRSP with employer contribution;
  • Discounts with Bixi, Nautilus Plus and many more local businesses.

Diversity is a core value at Rodeo FX. We are passionate about building and sustaining an inclusive and equitable work environment where diversity is celebrated and valued. We believe every member on our team enriches our work by exposing us to a broad range of ways to perceive and interact with the world, identify challenges, and to design and deliver projects.

title: VFX Producer
description:
Rocket Science is an Emmy nominated boutique visual effects studio collaborating with filmmakers to create stunning visual imagery utilizing artistry, science and technology. Located in Toronto, Canada, notable credits include Eric Kripke’s Emmy nominated superhero series THE BOYS (Amazon), the epic video game adaptation HALO (Paramount +), the BAFTA winning mini-series TITANIC (iTV), six seasons of Naren Shankar’s sci-fi series THE EXPANSE (Amazon), and features such as Neil Jordan’s GRETA (Sidney Kimmel, John Leonetti’s WISH UPON (Broad Green Pictures) and David Cronenberg’s upcoming Cannes release CRIMES OF THE FUTURE.

RSVFX’s current productions include Tim Burton’s WEDNESDAY (Netflix), THE BOYS S3 (Amazon), Steve Blackman’s UMBRELLA ACADEMY S3 (Netflix) and LOCKE AND KEY S3 (Netflix) from Carlton Cuse and Meredith Averill.

Visit us @ rsvfx.com

Responsibilities

  • Manage script breakdowns and budgeting.
  • Liaise with show Producers, Directors, Production and Post-Production departments.
  • Manage project costs and overall performance.
  • Work with the Production team to establish and manage achievable schedules.
  • Provide guidance and mentorship to Production Assistants, Coordinators, and Managers.
  • Provide ongoing research and identify trends to ensure the studio is up to date with resources and processes, both creative and technical.

Requirements

  • At least 2 years’ experience as a VFX Producer on recognized Film and/ or TV series.
  • Proven ability to deliver quality VFX on time and on budget.
  • A calm and positive demeanor.
  • A complete understanding of both feature film and television VFX production pipelines.
  • Well versed in principles of live action film and television production, including directing, lighting, camera, special effects, grip, art department, costumes and props.
  • Excellent planning, negotiation, communication, and leadership skills.
  • Ability to multitask, prioritize, and problem solve in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to take initiative and handle both creative and technical issues in a professional manner.
  • A team player with excellent communication skills.

Rocket Science is an equal opportunity company which values diversity in the workplace. We would be happy to accommodate individual needs in keeping with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If you require accommodation in order to participate in our recruitment process, please contact us to make your needs known in advance.

Thank you for your interest in Rocket Science VFX. Please note that only those who meet the requirements will be contacted for an interview. No Phone Call Please. We are always interested in meeting motivated and talented artists.

title: 3D FX Supervisor - ON
description:
At Mainframe Studios, we’re creators first. We eat creative and technical challenges for breakfast and come back for more. We’ve been doing this for 25+ years, and we’re still going strong. We’re lucky enough to have the best team in the business. From our artists to our technical and production folks, everyone is passionate about collaborating on some kickass projects. We’ve partnered with the biggest names in the business to create a huge library of content. With partners like Mattel, Netflix, DreamWorks, Sony, Silvergate, and Nickelodeon, it's no wonder we’ve established ourselves as a creative force to be reckoned with.

WE WANT YOU (and your mad skills)!

We are looking for a talented FX Supervisor to join our team! Following the Director and CG Supervisor’s guidance, on a CG animated project, the FX Supervisor facilitates the establishing of the look of the project and its FX design development, application and choice of where stock FX can best be utilized.

Responsibilities and Duties

  • Oversees the development of FX tools and rigs to be used by the FX department.
  • Oversees the creation of the project’s FX style/technique. He/she works closely with other departments such as the Lighting Department in order to ensure the behavioural consistency of FX in relation to character, props and environment set ups regardless of the complexity of the shot.
  • Collaborates with the creative leads and CG Supervisor to ensure all FX, lighting and rendering requirements are successfully and efficiently met within the confines of the project’s timeline and fiscal parameters.
  • Provides support and documentation for tools created.
  • Ability to prioritize FX assignments with the goal to facilitate optimal work flow in the production pipeline as it pertains to shot production.
  • Provides vision, feedback, motivation and encouragement to the team.
  • Motivates, mentors and supports the crew to consistently strive towards excellence.
  • Partners with the production team in tracking and ensuring the on-time completion of shot assignments.
  • Collaborates with Lighting and Compositing Supervisor to test efficacy of the special effects, modifying FX as necessary.
  • Delivers assignments per project’s schedule.

Qualifications and Skills

  • Degree or diploma in fine arts or animation or equivalent experience is required.
  • 4-6+ years of experience working in a professional environment within their discipline.
  • Worked on at least 2-3 high quality animated series. Lead or Supervisor experience is preferred.
  • Expertise in developing FX designs/techniques per project’s art direction requirements. Superior artist vision, sense of design and composition. Experience writing scripts and/or programming is an asset.
  • Superior level understanding of 3D animation, texturing, modeling, lighting and compositing.
  • Superior level of proficiency in using Maya and Nuke for particle simulations, expressions, soft body, rigid body & cloth dynamics.
  • Experience with Houdini, Real Flow and Golaem is an asset.
  • Maintains up-to-date knowledge in the areas of rendering, lighting, shading and compositing.
  • Evaluates and recommends relevant software programs.
  • Ability to liaise with artists, crew/technical staff and clearly communicate production process, plans and concepts and set clear expectations. Excellent inter-personal skills. Practices attentive and active listening. Shares information, methodologies and ideas with others.
  • Ability to collaborate and facilitate feedback requested by executives.
  • Excellent leadership skills inspiring the team to work as a cohesive unit and eager to put forth their best. Ability to predict potential problems and trouble shoot as necessary.
  • Proven abilities to oversee FX Department and deliver all shots per project specs.
  • Adaptable to change, he/she can alter course of action quickly per production needs. Highly motivated, pro-active, solution minded, solid work ethic and positive attitude.
  • Outstanding organizational and time management skills. Ability to multitask and delegate.
  • Makes decisions in a timely manner. Accepts accountability for own actions. Creatively solves problems, eliminates roadblocks and focuses on issue at hand.
  • Efficient and detail oriented. Ability to prioritize duties in order to complete both personal assignments and oversee team output requirements.
  • Responsible for managing the FX Department while meeting quota expectations per project’s requirements.
  • Encourages open communication between the team and other departments.

-

Mainframe Studios is an Equal Opportunity Employer, which means we will not discriminate against any individual based on race, colour, sex, national origin, age, religion, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, military or veteran status, disability, or any factors prohibited by applicable law. This policy applies to every aspect of employment at Mainframe Studios, including recruitment, hiring, training, advancement, and termination. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and partners. Should you require accommodation throughout the recruitment process, please let us know your requirements when contacted.

title: Counter Manager, Cosmetics
description:
LocationREGINA,Saskatchewan,Canada
CategoryStores
Job OpenedMarch 7th, 2022
EducationHigh School Diploma/GED
Job Number220001GG
Job TypeFull-Time
RemoteNo

job description

What This Position is All About
You are a friendly, customer-focused individual who understands the importance of always being ready to serve the customer. You are a team player who has earned the respect of your peers through commitment, partnership and effective communication. You organize and prioritize your workload in a way that always puts the customer first and delivers the operational standards that are required. In a dynamic fast-paced environment you are self-motivated, adaptable and decisive ensuring the best outcome for the customer and the business.
Who You Are:
  • Acts with customers in mind, great networking and relationship management.
  • Puts the needs of internal and external customers first. Seeks customer information when improving products and services.
  • Often goes above and beyond their goals. Is consistently a top performer and elevates the performance of others
  • Sees ahead clearly, is knowledgeable and has a capability for a big picture perspective.
You Also Have:
  • Knowledge of skin/body care treatments with 2-5 years of work experience in Cosmetics
  • Certified Make-up Artist
  • Must have experience in a commission and clientele selling environment
  • Full flexibility with schedule (including evenings and weekends)
As The Counter Manager of Cosmetics, You Will:
  • Analyze business metrics to develop action plans that address opportunities and positively impact the business
  • Build your client base through the Preferred Customer Program
  • Observe staff on the selling floor and their interaction with customers, co-workers and overall customer service level
  • Achieve daily / weekly / monthly sales goals based on the department's goal and are expected to track their sales
  • Deliver World-class service through client communication, product knowledge, fashion direction and solution-based selling at the highest-level
  • Work with Vendor Partners to maximize sales opportunities through suggestive selling, store events / seminars and wardrobe clients
How Often You May Travel:
  • NA
Your Life and Career at HBC:
  • Be part of a world-class team; work with an adventurous spirit; think and act like an owner- operator!
  • Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities, from retail to supply chain, to digital or corporate.
  • A culture that promotes a healthy, fulfilling work/life balance
  • Benefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, vision and dental).
  • An amazing employee discount
Thank you for your interest with HBC. We look forward to reviewing your application.
HBC provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, HBC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
HBC welcomes all applicants for this position. Should you be individually selected to participate in an assessment or selection process, accommodations are available upon request in relation to the materials or processes to be used.

title: Technical Artist
description:
Who are Timbre Games?
Timbre Games are a Vancouver based early-stage game development studio with over 100 years of founding leadership. We believe culture drives creative, where we draw on community and diversity to build truly unique experiences.

Our mission is to build a world class network of Game Studios; to provide accessible awesomeness to our players, to our team, to the world.

Everyone has a story. Come write yours!
Who you are:
As a human, you’re a visionary explorer, a pursuer of fun, and focused on building community. You see an opportunity within games to do more and to have more than “ just a job”. You’ve had unique experiences both at work and personally that have expanded your curiosities to seek the root of a problem, to seek out issues, and work with people to explore solutions! Your experiences have made you who you are, and that has led to you understanding the importance of diversity in both thinking and in people. Oh, and games… You may like those, too!

Who you are at work:
You lead with humility in all that you do. When you have a problem that leaves you scratching your head, you lean in for support from your team and collaborate to solve that problem. You connect with people through humour and curiosity and use that communication style to take high level ideas from others and create what they’re thinking! You are excited at being on the cutting edge of technology, bringing products to life and being the voice for Technical Art.

What impact will you have as a Technical Artist at Timbre:

  • Being our first Technical Artist, you’ll bring strategy and direction to our Technical Art department as we start integrating assets into our first game
  • Build customizable procedural generation tools within Unreal, that makes the lives of our Art team so much easier!
  • Be the key bridge between Artists and Engineers, understanding their needs to build out unique Timbre solutions
  • Provide recommendations for tools that optimize and improve the creative process
  • Document pipeline and tools development process for now and future Timbre teammates!

Your track record may include:

  • 4+ years of experience working within the creative industries
  • Highly skilled communication, both verbally and digitally, to different disciplines within the studio
  • Deep understanding of 3D art pipeline tools (Maya, Houdini, etc)
  • Past experience building shaders and procedurally generated custom tools
  • Development experience in Python, JavaScript or other scripting languages
  • A beautifully crafted gaming experience!
About Timbre Games:
Timbre Games are headed up by industry veterans in beautiful Vancouver, BC. Our experience stretches through mobile to AAA (think Gears of War, the Sims, SSX, FIFA, Age of Empires, among others!). We’re excited to build a ‘playoff ready’ studio that is centered on creativity, humour and diversity. We can’t wait to share our first project that we’re secretly working away on, and we welcome your application with open arms as we grow a world-class studio here in Canada!

BENEFITS:

  • Competitive salary & benefits
  • Annual bonus & RRSP matching
  • 20 days paid vacation, plus Christmas week off
  • Remote / Work from home / Flexible hours
  • Open door policy with direct access to leadership
  • Industry veterans with a wealth of knowledge to share
Timbre Game’s Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
Timbre recognizes the importance of creating an environment where all our employees feel included and empowered. We believe that culture drives creative, we value each employee’s unique experiences and perspectives across our company and recognize that it is both the smart and right thing to foster diversity, equity, and inclusion within our organization.

By diversifying our workforce, increasing equality, and ensuring that our individual differences are valued, we are better able to deliver an experience that reflects, inspires, and connects with our audience... because games are for everyone!
DO I NEED TO MEET ALL CRITERIA TO APPLY?
Definitely not! If you share our mission of creating games that are accessible for everyone, we’d love to meet you and see what is possible!

If you believe you are who we’re looking for, contact us at: work@timbregames.com

Please upload a link to your portfolio/github for us to review if applicable!

title: Technical Animator – Dragon Age
description:
Multiple Locations: Edmonton, Alberta, Canada • Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada • Toronto, Ontario, Canada • Montreal, Quebec, Canada • Austin, Texas, United States

Requisition Number: 172441

Position Title: Technical Artist 2

External Description:

Technical Animator

At BioWare, our mission is to create worlds of adventure, conflict, and companionship that inspire you to become the hero of your story. Our teams inspire creativity using tech and tools such as the Frostbite engine and work with thousands of developers across EA’s network of studios. We are passionate about games and their potential as a creative medium to reach and inspire people through emotion, artistry, and engaging storytelling. If you share this passion, this is an amazing opportunity to help shape the next generation of gaming.

Responsibilities:

  • Independently drive multiple key features for technical animation, including runtime systems, physics/ragdoll, and facial animation R&D and implementation
  • Lead communication efforts related to assigned features, including reaching out to external partners as needed, and clearly describing the needs of the project
  • Develop and maintain animation tools and pipelines
  • Prototype and implement procedural animation systems such as facial animation, destruction, cloth, and hair
  • Collaborate with the design, character art, animation, and outsourcing teams
  • Debugging and support of animation systems and tools

Qualifications:

  • 3+ years of technical animation experience
  • Experience in rigging and skinning assets
  • Experience with python or C++
  • A demonstrable understanding of animation principles and anatomy
  • Experience with motion capture and retargeting
  • Proficient with standard industry tools such as Autodesk Maya
  • Excellent problem solving skills. The candidate must be able to quickly identify issues and resolve them.
  • Collaborative team player with strong cross-group communication skills
  • Excellent decision making capabilities
  • Demonstrates dependability and commitment to projects/tasks

Portfolio:

  • All submissions must include a portfolio showing personal and/or professional artwork

City:

State:

Remote?: 1

Community / Marketing Title: Technical Animator - Dragon Age

Company Profile:

Electronic Arts is an innovative tech company that creates incredible experiences for millions of players around the world. But what matters most is our people who inspire us, and the world, to play. As we bring new forms of entertainment to people around the world, we need innovative, collaborative, diverse and adaptable people to keep making Electronic Arts better.

EEOText: About EA We exist to inspire the world to play. Through innovative technology and immersive storytelling, we deliver new ways of experiencing worlds of interactive entertainment for our millions of players worldwide. Our strength lies in the diversity of our people, combining creativity, innovation and passion. We fully champion inclusive culture, and provide opportunities for growing, learning, and leading that allows for the most impactful and rewarding work of our teams’ careers. We put our people first, and we make sure they’re taken care of both in and out of the office. As we reflect on our learnings and successes from remote work, we aim to provide dynamic, collaborative and flexible work environments for our teams. Our employees connect through our Employee Resource Groups, which are actively involved in driving business decisions every step of the way. But our support doesn’t end at the workplace—we also encourage a balanced lifestyle with paid time off and new parent leave, free video games, fitness reimbursement and more. Our goal is to provide a safe, respectful and inspiring workplace for all of our employees. Through our diversity, equity, inclusion and social responsibility programs, we’re doing the work to give everyone the space to be their full selves while giving back to our community. We’re looking for problem-solvers, game-changers, innovators, dreamers, doers—people that are ready to move the needle and build on our success. As our industry accelerates, we aren’t just keeping up—we’re staying ahead of the game. Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. title: FTF Counter Manager - Armani
description:
LocationVANCOUVER,British Columbia,Canada
CategoryStores
Job OpenedMarch 25th, 2022
EducationHigh School Diploma/GED
Job Number220001W5
Job TypeFull-Time
RemoteNo

job description

What This Position is All About
You are a friendly, customer-focused individual who understands the importance of always being ready to serve the customer. You are a team player who has earned the respect of your peers through commitment, partnership and effective communication. You organize and prioritize your workload in a way that always puts the customer first and delivers the operational standards that are required. In a dynamic fast-paced environment you are self-motivated, adaptable and decisive ensuring the best outcome for the customer and the business.
Who You Are:
  • Acts with customers in mind, great networking and relationship management.
  • Puts the needs of internal and external customers first. Seeks customer information when improving products and services.
  • Often goes above and beyond their goals. Is consistently a top performer and elevates the performance of others
  • Sees ahead clearly, is knowledgeable and has a capability for a big picture perspective.
You Also Have:
  • Knowledge of skin/body care treatments with 2-5 years of work experience in Cosmetics
  • Certified Make-up Artist
  • Must have experience in a commission and clientele selling environment
  • Full flexibility with schedule (including evenings and weekends)
As The Counter Manager of Cosmetics, You Will:
  • Analyze business metrics to develop action plans that address opportunities and positively impact the business
  • Build your client base through the Preferred Customer Program
  • Observe staff on the selling floor and their interaction with customers, co-workers and overall customer service level
  • Achieve daily / weekly / monthly sales goals based on the department's goal and are expected to track their sales
  • Deliver World-class service through client communication, product knowledge, fashion direction and solution-based selling at the highest-level
  • Work with Vendor Partners to maximize sales opportunities through suggestive selling, store events / seminars and wardrobe clients
How Often You May Travel:
  • NA
Your Life and Career at HBC:
  • Be part of a world-class team; work with an adventurous spirit; think and act like an owner- operator!
  • Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities, from retail to supply chain, to digital or corporate.
  • A culture that promotes a healthy, fulfilling work/life balance
  • Benefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, vision and dental).
  • An amazing employee discount
Thank you for your interest with HBC. We look forward to reviewing your application.
HBC provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, HBC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
HBC welcomes all applicants for this position. Should you be individually selected to participate in an assessment or selection process, accommodations are available upon request in relation to the materials or processes to be used.

title: VFX Bidding Producer
description:
Company Description


Technicolor Production Services is the division with Technicolor which contain Technicolor’s world leading Visual effects and Animation brands such as MPC, Mr X, The Mill, and Mikros.

Technicolor’s brands have worked on the spectacular scenes and tiny details that make movies, advertising campaigns and Animation movies truly mind-blowing. We’re the people behind the effects in countless blockbuster films like The Lion King, The Spongebob Movie: Sponge on the Run and advertising campaigns for clients such as Samsung, Audi, Nike and Apple.

We are constantly looking for the best talent in the world, enthusiastic people that come in everyday to be a part of some of the best work in the industry. Technicolor’s artists are wildly creative, uber talented and passionate about the possibilities of VFX, Experiential, Animation and Technology. When you join the team, you’ll be working with and learning from the most skilled people in the business.


Job Description


This is an exciting opportunity for someone with a strong and up to date knowledge of the VFX workflow to join the Global Business Development team.

Based in Montreal, the VFX Bidding Producer is responsible for the creative assessment of potential new projects, up to award for Technicolor’s VFX brands MPC Episodic, MPC Film and MR.X.

They will work across multiple projects, analysing scripts, VFX breakdowns and other materials in order to provide competitive packages to our clients.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Review all materials received from clients and creatively assess and bid the work required to complete a project
  • Consult with VFX supervisors and Head of Departments on creative, technical approaches, and methodologies as needed.
  • Responsible for flagging any approach that may require significant further development from the technology teams.
  • Act as a primary contact for client liaison on allocated projects.
  • Attend all client meetings, prepare and lead all creative client discussions with VFX Supervisors.
  • Work with the Business Development Manager and commercial analyst to prepare financials on all bids for approval by EPs.
  • Work with Business Development Manager and EP to develop strategy for award for each project.
  • Understand the industry cost structures and how this effects creative assessment.
  • Stay current of studio capacity and talent capabilities to effectively create bids.
  • Responsible for creative handover of awarded shows to the local EP/show Producer, maintaining a comprehensive set of notes relating to each project.

Qualifications
  • Previous experience in providing detailed and accurate bids for features and episodic
  • Detail orientated
  • Goal driven
  • Highly motivated working within a fast-paced environment
  • High-level knowledge of Excel.
  • Extensive knowledge of the VFX workflow
  • 3+ years VFX Production experience.

Additional Information


Please click here to review our privacy notices for job applicants.

If you require assistance applying, please reach out to talent@thefocus.com and we'll be happy to assist.

TECHNICOLOR IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
Technicolor complies and prohibits against discrimination on the basis of race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, medical condition (including genetic characteristics), mental and/or physical disability or handicap, marital status, sex, age, veteran status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender identity, political party preference, political belief, socioeconomic status, familial status, registered domestic partner status, military service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions and any other characteristic or activity protected by federal, state/provincial or local law.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: 3D Lighting Lead - ON
description:
At Mainframe Studios, we’re creators first. We eat creative and technical challenges for breakfast and come back for more. We’ve been doing this for 25+ years, and we’re still going strong. We’re lucky enough to have the best team in the business. From our artists to our technical and production folks, everyone is passionate about collaborating on some kickass projects. We’ve partnered with the biggest names in the business to create a huge library of content. With partners like Mattel, Netflix, DreamWorks, Sony, Silvergate, and Nickelodeon, it's no wonder we’ve established ourselves as a creative force to be reckoned with.
WE WANT YOU (and your mad skills)!
We are looking for a Lead Lighting Artist to join us on an exciting new series! Under the guidance of the Director and Lighting Supervisor, on a CG animated film, the Lead Lighting Artist needs to know how to utilize lighting principals and techniques to realize an image based on a reference such as an image or photograph.
Responsibilities and Duties

  • Following the Director, Art Director/Production Designer and/or Visual Effects Supervisor’s guidance, the Lighting Lead plays a critical role in establishing the look of the project and its expected lighting requirements.
  • Supports the creation of the project's look and lighting style/technique.
  • Evaluates the lighting of characters to make sure they work well and then sets the lighting which establishes the lighting that will be used as a guideline for the rest of the other artists (such as Surfacing).
  • Works closely with other departments in order to ensure the consistency of character and environment lighting set ups and shot complexity requirements as per storytelling needs.
  • Assists the Department Supervisor with artist evaluation and casting.
  • Ability to work within the lighting and rendering pipeline and capable of troubleshooting common rendering and lighting technical issues.
  • Crafts innovative lighting designs. He/she supports the Supervisor in ensuring that the rigs can function efficiently and the established look and complexity are successfully met within the confines of the project's timeline and fiscal parameters.
  • Provides input for artist's performance review to the Department Supervisor.
  • Able to prioritize lighting setups and implementation pending production requirements.
  • Provides vision, feedback, motivation and encouragement to the team.
  • Motivates, mentors and supports the team to consistently strive towards excellence.
  • Partners with the production team in tracking and ensuring the on-time completion of shot assignments.
  • Interprets, implements, and facilitates notes and feedback from Director, Art Director/Production Designer,
  • Visual Effects Supervisor, CG Supervisor and Dept. Supervisor in a timely and qualitatively acceptable way.
  • Collaborates with Surfacing Team in achieving the desired look and establishing the production design complexity and behavioural consistency as it pertains to characters, props and environments.
  • Collaborates with Effects Artists to test efficacy of the special effects, modifying lighting as necessary.
  • Delivers assignments per project's schedule.

Qualifications and Skills

  • Degree and/or diploma in fine arts or animation or equivalent experience required.
  • 5+ years of experience working in a professional environment within their discipline.

Senior or Lead experience preferred.

  • Knowledge of Katana and rendering software such as Redshift and/or Arnold. Ability to script is an asset.
  • Extensive experience in exploring and delivering lighting styles/techniques per project's production design requirements. Experience in photography is an asset.
  • Expert understanding of principles of lighting (such as choice of light, placement of the light source, its direction and how to create the desired effect such as contrast and shadows). In-depth knowledge of compositing a plus.
  • Ability to apply advanced knowledge of digital 3D animation, special effects and lighting. In-depth knowledge of compositing principles and compositing software such as Nuke.
  • Expert knowledge of Maya and rendering software such as Renderman and/or Mentalray. Ability to script is an asset.
  • Maintains up-to-date knowledge in the areas of rendering, lighting, shading and compositing.
  • Evaluates and recommends relevant software programs.
  • Ability to communicate ideas clearly and concisely.
  • Ability to inspire team by example; provide constructive feedback and draws out excellence. Open to and encourages feedback and new initiatives. Shares information and techniques with team members.

Proven abilities to manage design team to create artwork from conceptual phase through final artwork deliverables.

  • Adaptable to change, he/she can alter course of action quickly per production needs. Highly motivated, pro-active, solid work ethic and positive attitude. Consistently strives to expand knowledge base.
  • Makes decisions in a timely manner. Accepts accountability for own actions. Creatively solves problems, eliminates roadblocks and focuses on issue at hand.
  • Efficient and detail oriented. Ability to prioritize duties in order to complete both personal assignments and oversee team output requirements.
  • Excellent problem solving skills and ability to work collaboratively.
  • Ability to deliver assignments on time and meet or exceed lighting objectives within the production budget and scheduled parameters.

-
Mainframe Studios is an Equal Opportunity Employer, which means we will not discriminate against any individual based on race, colour, sex, national origin, age, religion, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, military or veteran status, disability, or any factors prohibited by applicable law. This policy applies to every aspect of employment at Mainframe Studios, including recruitment, hiring, training, advancement, and termination. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and partners. Should you require accommodation throughout the recruitment process, please let us know your requirements when contacted.

wf8LTelecM

title: Senior Technical Artist, Labs / Artiste technique sénior, La...
description:
The opportunity

Unity Labs' "Slices" Team researches and develops experimental user-experiences, with a focus on augmented, mixed, and virtual reality. We push the boundaries of traditional UX concepts in XR, delivering innovative solutions to challenges that XR developers are meeting today, and will encounter in new forms tomorrow. Our work was recently presented in the form of the "Unity Slices" project, at the 2021 Meta Connect conference. We're seeking a senior technical artist that wants to join us in developing Unity Slices, and the future of XR!

You will guide all related matters in a small cross-discipline team, with a long history of development experience in XR. Our team thrives upon an intuitive and fluid exchange of ideas, inclusive of all perspectives. You will have a demonstrated ability to maintain artistic quality, while working within the narrow technical constraints of current XR hardware. You will assist in creating & optimizing assets, while developing artist-friendly tools and workflows in Unity. Through research, development, and iteration, we will set new standards in XR experiences that will inspire the industry!

What you'll be doing

  • Work alongside artists, designers, and engineers to build performant content of outstanding quality
  • Create new 2D & 3D content, and optimize existing content
  • Develop artist-facing tools for Unity (including custom editor inspectors)
  • Manage internal and external content development efforts
  • Define content development processes & requirements that will drive the development of new Slices-related content created by external developers

What we're looking for

  • Extensive experience with multiple DCC tools, & familiarity with industry standard formats (FBX, BLEND, GLTF, USD, etc)
  • Experience using procedural generation tools such as Houdini, Blender, and Substance
  • Demonstrated capability in writing tools and pipelines using relevant scripting languages (C#, Python, Max/MELScript, etc)
  • Experience with shaders, post-effects, visual scripting, VFX authoring, and graph based tool design
  • Broad experience in 2D & 3D asset creation pipelines that takes into account the strengths & weaknesses of mobile hardware (CPU & GPU), going from DCC to engine (modeling, vertex colors, UV unwrapping, texturing, rigging, integration, profiling and optimizations)

You might also have

  • Experience with AI/Machine learning and its usage in content generation and asset placement
  • A drive to stay up to date with DCC pipeline evolution trends and solutions
  • Gameplay programming experience (visual scripting and/or C#)

Life at Unity

Unity (NYSE: U) is the world's leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity's platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices.

Unity is at the forefront of development by working alongside partners to ensure optimized support for the latest releases and platforms. Apps developed by Unity creators were downloaded more than five billion times per month in 2020. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.

Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations or accommodations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

Artiste technique sénior, Slices

L'opportunité

L'équipe « Slices » de Unity Labs recherche et développe des expériences utilisateur expérimentales, en se concentrant sur la réalité virtuelle, augmentée et mixte. Nous repoussons les limites des concepts traditionnels de l'expérience utilisateur en matière de réalité étendue en développant des solutions novatrices pour faire face aux défis d'aujourd'hui et de demain. Nous avons récemment fait la démonstration de nos travaux sous la forme du projet « Unity Slices » à la conférence Meta Connect de 2021. Nous sommes à la recherche d'un(e) artiste technique sénior qui souhaite nous rejoindre pour développer les Unity Slices et l'avenir de la réalité étendue.

Vous piloterez tous les sujets connexes au sein d'une petite équipe transversale qui possède une expérience de longue date dans le développement de solutions de réalité étendue. Notre équipe travaille en échangeant des idées de manière intuitive et fluide, et ce, en tenant compte de tous les points de vue. Vous aurez démontré votre capacité à maintenir la qualité artistique des produits, tout en travaillant dans les limites des contraintes techniques serrées des équipements de réalité étendue actuels. Vous nous aiderez à créer et à optimiser nos actifs, tout en développant des outils et des processus conviviaux pour les artistes utilisant Unity. Grâce à un travail de recherche, de développement et d'itérations, nous établirons de nouvelles normes en matière d'expériences de réalité étendue qui inspireront l'ensemble du secteur!

Ce que vous allez faire

  • Travailler aux côtés d'artistes, de concepteur(rice)s et de développeur(euse)s afin de créer des contenus performants et de qualité exceptionnelle
  • Créer de nouveaux contenus 2D et 3D, et optimiser les actifs existants
  • Développer des outils destinés aux artistes qui travaillent sur Unity, notamment des inspecteurs d'éditeurs personnalisés
  • Gérer les efforts de développement de contenu interne et externe
  • Définir les processus de développement de contenu et les exigences qui conduiront au développement de nouveaux contenus liés au projet Slices et créés par des développeurs externes

Ce que nous recherchons

  • Une expérience approfondie avec plusieurs outils de DCC, ainsi qu'une bonne connaissance des formats standard de l'industrie (FBX, BLEND, GLTF, USD, etc.)
  • Une expérience en matière d'utilisation d'outils de génération procédurale comme Houdini, Blender et Substance
  • La capacité démontrée à utiliser des outils d'écriture et des pipelines en utilisant des langages de script appropriés (C#, Python, Max/MELScript, etc.)
  • Une expérience avec les nuanceurs, les effets post-rendu, les scripts visuels, la création d'effets visuels et la conception d'outils graphiques
  • Une grande expérience avec les pipelines de création d'actifs 2D et 3D qui tiennent compte des avantages et des limites des systèmes mobiles (UCT et GPU), du DCC au moteur (modélisation, couleurs des vertex, dépliage UV, création de textures, trucage, intégration, profilage et optimisations)

Vous avez peut-être également

  • Une expérience en matière d'IA et d'apprentissage automatique, et de leur utilisation dans la génération de contenu et le placement d'actifs
  • Une volonté de se tenir au courant des dernières évolutions des pipelines de DCC et de leurs solutions
  • Une expérience en matière de programmation de la jouabilité (script visuel et/ou C#)

La vie chez Unity

Unity (NYSE: U) est la plateforme la plus utilisée au monde pour la création et l'exécution interactive de contenu 3D en temps réel (RT3D). Des créateurs, notamment des développeurs de jeux vidéo, des artistes, architectes, concepteurs automobiles et cinéastes, utilisent Unity pour donner vie à ce qu'ils ont imaginé. La plateforme de Unity offre un ensemble complet de solutions logicielles pour créer, exécuter et monétiser du contenu interactif 2D et 3D en temps réel pour les téléphones mobiles, les tablettes, les ordinateurs, les consoles et les appareils de réalité augmentée et de réalité virtuelle.

Unity est à l'avant-garde du développement. En collaborant avec nos partenaires, nous offrons un soutien optimal aux plus récentes technologies et plateformes. Les applications développées par les créateurs au sein de Unity ont été téléchargées plus de cinq milliards de fois par mois en 2020. Pour en savoir davantage, visitez le site www.unity.com.

Unity est un employeur axé sur l'égalité des chances qui s'engage à favoriser un environnement inclusif et innovateur avec les meilleurs employés. Par conséquent, nous fournissons des opportunités d'emploi sans tenir compte de l'âge, la race, la couleur, l'ascendance, l'origine nationale, la religion, le handicap, le sexe, l'identité sexuelle ou l'expression, l'orientation sexuelle ou tout autre statut protégé. S'il y a des préparatifs ou des ajustements que nous pouvons faire afin de vous aider à avoir une expérience d'entrevue confortable et positive, veuillez-nous le faire savoir.

Les chasseurs de têtes et les agences de recrutement ne peuvent pas soumettre résumes/CV par ce site Web ou directement aux superviseurs. Unity n'accepte pas des chasseurs de têtes non sollicités et des résumés (CV) d'agence. Unity ne payera pas d'honoraires à aucune agence tierce ou entreprise qui n'a pas signé d'ententes avec Unity.
